story:
Story of My Book:

Arose from War is a book about a Syrian child that persevered in the United States after relocating due to civil war. 

My name is Rama Youssef and I am the author of Arose from War. I wrote this book to inspire young people who have encountered adversity in their life or who are currently experiencing trying situations. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover your power within yourself to create the life you dream of and bring it to reality. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to learn how to always find a way to move forward in life through forgiveness, attitude, and discovery.

In this book, you'll encounter multifaceted dimensions of a little girl growing up in an unhealthy communal environment, witnessing oppression of women and making it alive through war. In addition, the relocation to another continent at the age of 12, losing physical touch with parents and siblings, fitting into the American educational system, and finally prospering through every refugee obstacle.
 

For all:

You will love this book if social issues matter to you if you are raising a teenager and if you are an immigrant kid figuring out your future.

Arose from War speaks to immigrants, women, immigrants, politicians, Americans, and more who want to grapple with social issues and perseverance in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that Arose from Way inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

- How can I help children that relate to Rama’s situation? 

- Am I surrounding myself with people that make inspire me to make change in the world or take me backward? 

- Why do are some high school kids not receiving the support they need in order to grow?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing immigrant children, education and opportunities will change us all for the better.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in [August, 2021].

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this [Summer].
When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

About the Author:

Rama Youssef is a third-year college student at California Lutheran University. She has been involved in several humanitarian aid and educational projects within her Portland and Thousand Oaks community like “Syrian American Medical Society” event outreach, volunteering at Rose Haven shelter for women, volunteering at the Arab American Culture Center of Oregon, youth camp speaker, Harvard National Model United Nations. Rama has been highlighted in several articles and news resources. She was on the cover of the Oregonian once and has been labeled “The Resilient Daughter of the Arab Spring.” And now she’s looking forward to serving as one of Portland’s Policy Commissioner this summer. 

She wrote this book with the intention of telling the world her side of the story as a refugee child that lost physical touch with her parents since the age of 12. She aspires to present a mosaic image of her diverse challenges along with her success in the United States and to inspire politicians to consider people like her when making policies.  

On a good day, Rama likes to invent and try food recipes, debate social issues among her peers, and creates social media content. Additionally, she likes to enjoy the beauty of nature and go on adventures. 

For more information, you can connect with Rama Youssef at Rama99.youssef@gmail.com .
 

International Preorders:

For international preorders, please send me a private message.
 

Risks & Challenges:

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help:

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #AroseFromWar and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Rama Youssef

story:
From Where I Stand & PresenTense

From Where I Stand is a brand new online platform that captures the narratives of women working in the Jewish world to find common threads, dialogue challenges and celebrate opportunities. 

This project was turned from an idea into a reality because of the vision and mentorship of PresenTense, an organization that helps individuals, like myself, foster innovation by turning ideas and early stage projects into stronger, more sustainable projects. 

Since January 2014, I have been honored to be part of the PresenTense NYC cohort. The money raised by this campaign will help support PresenTense in its mission of fostering innovation among young social entrepreneurs.

  • PresenTense has made an incredible difference in my life, providing me with the skills turn frustrations and a vision into a tangible platform for dialogue and communication. 
  • Your donation, no matter how large or small (see incentives on the right before you make your decision!) will help foster the next generation of social entrepreneurs by helping innovators and entrepreneurs build new ideas into transformational ventures.

More About From Where I Stand 

  • About Liz, creator of FWIS: In 4th grade I hung a poster of Gandhi on my wall. When I was a little girl, I wanted to change the world.  This passion and drive coupled with a vision for a stronger Jewish future led me and many other young women to begin our careers in the Jewish non profit world. 
  • About the blog: From Where I Stand is an online presence that captures the narratives of women of all ages working in the Jewish community with the hopes of finding common threads, dialoging challenges, and celebrating opportunities
  • With the stories written on this platform, the Jewish community can mobilize to create cultural change and serve as examples to the rest of the world to supporting women in the workforce and creating career paths for young professionals.

Bottom line: stories, our personal experiences, are what provide us with the power and momentum to make change. Ask yourself: What does it look like from where I stand?

The Impact

"From Where I Stand" is the first step toward creating change within our community and our world toward a more favorable, balanced, and healthy workplace. Your donation supports PresenTense and From Where I Stand to ensure that they will continue to make a strong, positive impact.

Want to write your own post?

Visit standforus.wordpress.com and look for the story submission form. Your thoughts and experience is important to us. We can't wait to hear from you!

story:
WHY I'M RAISING FUNDS:

I am raising funds to complete a book which I plan to have professionally bound, published and marketed through online book publisher lulu.com.  This will allow me to share my story with more people.  

The motivation for writing this book was initially as a gift to my twin daughters, both of whom are dancers. I have already written a 25 page short story who's main character and story line are loosely based on their real life experiences with dance.  They loved the story so much they asked me to write a longer more detailed story.  This is where I need your help.

WHAT I PLAN ON ACCOMPLISHING:

I plan to write a 100-125 page book based on the characters and story line of the original short story I have already written. 

WHO WOULD LIKE THIS BOOK?

Anyone who loves dance or has a child who dances would be interested in this book.

STORY LINE OF BOOK:

The main character in the book is Catrina.  She is a 13 year old from a fictitious city in California (Danceville).  Her main motivation is to make the senior dance team at her dance studio.  She has to overcome injury and other obstacles on her way to becoming the best dancer in her town.

The story follows Catrina from her teenage years all the way to adulthood and her auditions on Broadway.  Will she realize her dream of becoming a professional dancer?  Help fund the book and let's find out together!

WHAT WILL FUNDS GO TOWARDS?

-Publishing fees

-Editorial fees

-Book binding/manufacturing

-Shipping/Freight

RISKS AND CHALLENGES:

The greatest risk I face on this journey may be writer's block.  

However, I am very organized and dedicated to writing this book and I will push through and work as long and as hard as I need to in order to complete this project.

Should any setbacks occur I will let my supporters know immediately with a status and a plan of action.

story:
Hello. My name is John Ingle. I live in the heart of Kansas City, MO and I like to think that I'm a writer. I've been putting ideas on paper for as long as I can remember, from the short stories and cartoons I wrote/drew as a kid to the handful of unproduced screenplays I've slaved over as an adult. Last year an idea for a different kind of project came to mind and I decided to pursue it. 

Dodd Skalle Investigations Volume 1: the Simian Case is a hand drawn, computer colored, pseudo-sci-fi/noir graphic novel that started as few sharpie sketches and ended up being a full-fledged passion project. 

Here's the gist:


Dodd Skalle is a fledgling private detective of an unknown species, living in a world populated with intelligent animals and sentient objects. He doesn't know where he came from or what he is…and he doesn't care. Dodd just wants to make his name in the detective business, so he takes on a high-profile and dangerous case that'd surely put his name in the paper if he can pull it off. 



As Skalle works the case, the trail pulls him down into the black underbelly of his city's dive bars, coffee shops, and libraries. But as he feels his way through that menacing world, he unwittingly (and unwillingly) starts to uncover the truth about his own past--a truth which may prove to be darker and more dangerous than his present reality which consists of machete chuckers, brain-washers, and an unseen kingpin who runs the nefarious borrough of Birdtown.


 

He knew this job would be a dangerous one. Hell, you gotta take chances if you're gonna get your name in the paper. The only question is: will Dodd Skalle make it to the front page…or the obituaries?



That's just a little example of the oddball story I've been working on. Thanks for checking out this much. But why stop there? Buy the book and READ ON!

Thanks, 

--John


WARNING! This book contains strong language, potentially disturbing illustrative technique, creative grammar, and graphic violence.

story:
Short Summary

CLICK THE BOXES ON THE RIGHT WITH THE DOLLAR AMOUNTS ON THEM, AND THEY WILL OPEN AND SHOW YOU THE PERKS YOU GET FOR THAT PRICE. (Quite a few people have asked me about this.)

Back in 2011, during a time that, to outsiders, might've looked like one of my highest points, but was actually one of the lowest lows of my depression and anxiety, I started writing this book. I had recently gotten out of the U.S. Army diagnosed with major depressive disorder and anxiety disorder, had gone back to college, and got an internship at Comedy Central in New York City, 2000 miles away from the small city in south Texas where I grew up. While things were coming together, my mental illness tricked me into believing that I was incomplete and inadequate. I'd say that I didn't choose the best methods of handling that, but as you'll read in the book, I wasn't handling it at all.

I tucked the book away for a while because I was too scared to revisit the dark headspace I was in when I started it. Then, I eventually finished it, in like 2014-15, with some tweaks here and there between then and now, even tweaking into 2020.

Then, I was too scared to release it for a while because of how vulnerable it is, and how detailed it is about the mess that lived inside my head for a looooong time, and, at first, how embarrassing it could be for me, but then because of how embarrassed of me those I love could be. 

But the more I read it, the more I felt like it could help other people like me feel less ashamed for the person that their mental health made them, and maybe give some hope that they, too, didn't have to remain that person. They didn't have to let those damn diseases win. 

Now, when I read this book (which I've done AT LEAST 40 times through editing and audio book recording), as someone who has taken better care of himself for years, with therapy and PROPER medication, I only believe more and more that it will help not only people who struggle with things like depression and anxiety, but I also believe that it will help others have a better understanding of mental health issues like those. 

Also, thanks to that therapy and those proper meds, I find myself so far removed from the "me" in the book, that I'm finally strong enough to set aside the shame and the fear, and to release this.

It's the most important thing I've ever done. And I've always felt that way, I've only now gotten the courage to actually do it.

Rock Bottom at the Renaissance - An Emo Kid's Journey Through Falling In and Out of Love In and With New York City

It's a book about, well, just that: Romanticizing things (love, New York City) to such a point that they almost kill you. It's about the mental illnesses that almost kill you. But it's also about music, and how the right bands and the right songs can keep you alive. 

What We Need & What You Get

I've definitely already spent a few grand on this book, and that's not counting the hours of rewrites and edits. I'm just talking about websites, professional editing, professional formatting, professional cover design, test pressings that I've used for promotion, courses and subscriptions about self-publishing and digital marketing, and some other expenses. And that's fine. If I had money, I'd pay for this all myself. But, as you'll read in the book, I never have.

So...here's what this money will go to:

1. I have some cool "influential" people who want to work with me on promoting this book because they see what I see in it. But...their time is valuable, and while they haven't put a price on their help, I have, because I've worked in the music and marketing business long enough to WANT to compensate these people accordingly. 

2. Publicity and Marketing: I don't care much about the money I make from this book. Would I love to quit my job, sure. Who wouldn't? BUT...the most important thing to me, and one thing that's been keeping me from releasing this, is that I want to release this RIGHT. Nothing matters more to me than this book getting in front of the people who need it like I needed the bands I mention in it. And that's going to take a publicist and some marketing, which takes money. 

3. Audiobook Recording and Licensing: Now, I probably still won't be able to afford all of this with this goal, BUT, if we reach this goal, it will set the book launch on the right track, which should hopefully get book sales to handle the rest. I've been recording the audiobook myself for promotional purposes only, and that's what some of you will receiving depending on your perk. But I'd like to hire a notable person to record the official audio book that will be for sale (and I already have someone in mind). Plus, I use a lot of songs in the book, and I'd like to include clips of some of those songs as a sort of soundtrack. And that's going to cost quite a bit.

HERE ARE SOME OF THE COOL PERKS...I'LL BE ADDING MORE AS WE GO ALONG.

 

18 x 24 POSTER (Limited to 100)

The Impact

As I mentioned above, I've held on to this thing for a long time, because it never stopped helping me and I never stopped believing that it will help others. There's at least two or three times in the book in which I talk about being suicidal and nearly dying. My hope is that others will read this and see that I'm still here, and because I am, this book exists. The same way some of my favorite albums cover stuff like this, but if the artists who released them hadn't made it through, I wouldn't have had those albums, and maybe I wouldn't have made it through myself.

And once the book is launched officially, proceeds from book sales will go to Zero Platoon, a charity I started a few years ago that works with bands and other artists to reach out to active-duty military members who deal with mental health issues.

Risks & Challenges

Anyone can post a book to Amazon, anytime, if they have one and if they want to. And while that sounds like an opportunity and not a challenge, it presents a challenge because there's a billion books out there, and it's very easy for a book to get lost in the abyss. Hence, the publicity, marketing, and influential partners in promotion.

Fortunately, I've been working in music and marketing for, well, all of my adult life really. I've written about and interviewed bands and comedians as a music journalist, and I've worked for some big media brands like Comedy Central, Rolling Stone, Billboard, Spin, and Vice, as a digital media and video producer. So, I've learned some great lessons, and made some great friends and fostered some relationships with people who can help or point me in the right direction.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, no big deal. You'll get your chance to buy the book once it hits stores (April or May).

But...you can share this and spread the word.

It's a book about, well, just that: Romanticizing things (love, New York City) to such a point that they almost kill you. It's about the mental illnesses that almost kill you. But it's also about music, and how the right bands and the right songs can keep you alive. 


What We Need & What You Get
I've definitely already spent a few grand on this book, and that's not counting the hours of rewrites and edits. I'm just talking about websites, professional editing, professional formatting, professional cover design, test pressings that I've used for promotion, courses and subscriptions about self-publishing and digital marketing, and some other expenses. And that's fine. If I had money, I'd pay for this all myself. But, as you'll read in the book, I never have.
So...here's what this money will go to:
1. I have some cool "influential" people who want to work with me on promoting this book because they see what I see in it. But...their time is valuable, and while they haven't put a price on their help, I have, because I've worked in the music and marketing business long enough to WANT to compensate these people accordingly. 
2. Publicity and Marketing: I don't care much about the money I make from this book. Would I love to quit my job, sure. Who wouldn't? BUT...the most important thing to me, and one thing that's been keeping me from releasing this, is that I want to release this RIGHT. Nothing matters more to me than this book getting in front of the people who need it like I needed the bands I mention in it. And that's going to take a publicist and some marketing, which takes money. 
3. Audiobook Recording and Licensing: Now, I probably still won't be able to afford all of this with this goal, BUT, if we reach this goal, it will set the book launch on the right track, which should hopefully get book sales to handle the rest. I've been recording the audiobook myself for promotional purposes only, and that's what some of you will receiving depending on your perk. But I'd like to hire a notable person to record the official audio book that will be for sale (and I already have someone in mind). Plus, I use a lot of songs in the book, and I'd like to include clips of some of those songs as a sort of soundtrack. And that's going to cost quite a bit.
HERE ARE SOME OF THE COOL PERKS...I'LL BE ADDING MORE AS WE GO ALONG.

 
18 x 24 POSTER (Limited to 100)




The Impact
As I mentioned above, I've held on to this thing for a long time, because it never stopped helping me and I never stopped believing that it will help others. There's at least two or three times in the book in which I talk about being suicidal and nearly dying. My hope is that others will read this and see that I'm still here, and because I am, this book exists. The same way some of my favorite albums cover stuff like this, but if the artists who released them hadn't made it through, I wouldn't have had those albums, and maybe I wouldn't have made it through myself.
And once the book is launched officially, proceeds from book sales will go to Zero Platoon, a charity I started a few years ago that works with bands and other artists to reach out to active-duty military members who deal with mental health issues.


Risks & Challenges
Anyone can post a book to Amazon, anytime, if they have one and if they want to. And while that sounds like an opportunity and not a challenge, it presents a challenge because there's a billion books out there, and it's very easy for a book to get lost in the abyss. Hence, the publicity, marketing, and influential partners in promotion.
Fortunately, I've been working in music and marketing for, well, all of my adult life really. I've written about and interviewed bands and comedians as a music journalist, and I've worked for some big media brands like Comedy Central, Rolling Stone, Billboard, Spin, and Vice, as a digital media and video producer. So, I've learned some great lessons, and made some great friends and fostered some relationships with people who can help or point me in the right direction.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't donate, no big deal. You'll get your chance to buy the book once it hits stores (April or May).
But...you can share this and spread the word.

story:
¿Qué?

Inmarcesible podría englobarse en eso que viene a llamarse new adult, pero con un contenido poco habitual en el género por la complejidad de los pensamientos e inquietudes de sus personajes, sin renuncia por ello a ofrecer entretenimiento.

Chica conoce a chico, a ratos se quieren, a ratos se lloran, pero finalmente terminan por comer perdices. Sin embargo, la historia que nos cuenta Amanda poco tiene que ver con cuentos de príncipes y princesas. Sino más bien con dos personas que deciden quererse hasta arañarse el corazón mientras luchan por no ser nunca lo que el mundo espera de ellos.

Inmarcesible habla de caos y casualidades, de cambios y oportunidades. Y de una joven que emprende un camino cogida de la mano de la experiencia y del amor para redescubrirse a sí misma y convertirse en otra mujer: una más libre, más fuerte y más valiente.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para valorar la aceptación y viabilidad de cada título.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Nadie mejor que la propia autora para presentarse.

Me llamo Yolanda González y nací en la primavera de 1994 en Avilés, Asturias. Crecí entre mundos inventados por mujeres como J.K Rowling y Laura Gallego, pasando poco tiempo con los pies en la tierra. No sé qué fue lo que me empujó a escribir pero empecé a llenar páginas blancas de cuentos nunca terminados desde que muy pequeña. Las ganas de contar historias me llevaron a estudiar periodismo y comunicación audiovisual en Madrid y con dieciocho años me planté en la ciudad que me hizo crecer como persona y como escritora.

A los veinte tuve la suerte de poder vivir un año en Praga, ciudad que acoge a Inmarcesible. Fue perdida entre Malá Strana y Žižkov dónde se engendró esta novela que, pese a ser ficción, deja de representar una etapa de evolución y descubrimiento personal.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«La vida es un cúmulo de caos y casualidades.
          Te sorprende tantas veces la hija de puta que nunca sabes qué será lo próximo que te lanzará a la cara. A veces te deja sola, otras te regala un beso y muchas juega contigo al azar de las causas perdidas. Te acorrala en callejones o te abre puertas; o ventanas de quintos pisos para que te tires.
          Sea como sea, es imposible tratar de entenderla o predecirla. Así que, personalmente, me basta con ir esquivando a duras penas las trampas que me pone y atrapando los regalos que me deja. De otra forma sólo sería una sombra triste y cobarde que se esconde para evitar el miedo y que se pierde lo bueno de verdad.
          Porque hay cosas buenas, como lo que teníamos tú y yo.
          Sí, sí. Sé lo que pensareis el resto. Topicazo del amor loco y juvenil. Pues sí. Ese amor que te folla en la rama más alta del árbol más alto de la colina más alta. Ese que trata siempre de llevarte al cielo. Ese amor construido por dos y para dos sin dependencia, sin ser esclavos el uno del otro. Sin sentirse atados por quererse.
          Así éramos nosotros: un tópico. O más bien un cuento hecho chiste o el mito hecho película. Peor aún: un desastre natural con nombre de mujer del extrarradio.
          Para adelantaros el final al resto, esto fue así: inmarcesible. No esperéis final feliz porque no lo hubo.
          Fue todo caos y casualidades, y fuimos nosotros»

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 840€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Inmarcesible que saldría después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona a la autora, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Yolanda González vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
Introduction

Hi, my name’s Fay Roberts. You may know me from Hammer & Tongue, Allographic, Wild Strawberries, Other Voices Spoken Word Cabaret, Spoken Word @ PBH’s Free Fringe, the BBC Slam, or even Poetry Kapow! from back in the day. Alternatively you may be a friend, relative, or colleague. Hello!

I write, produce, and publish poetry and prose, and provide platforms for performers, focusing on providing spaces where people can be bold, and especially where they can tell their stories that may otherwise go unheard.

Short version: I wrote a show called “The Selkie: A Song of Many Waters”, it was well-received, I performed it at Edinburgh Fringe 2016, and subsequently got so sick that I could barely sleep, eat, or speak. I’m better recovered now and would like to bring The Selkie back to life – give her a voice again. I’ll be performing the show at Edinburgh Fringe 4th-15th August at 52 Canoes, Grassmarket, 12:30pm every day except Wednesday 8th, and – for once – I’ve decided to ask for people’s help to make this happen.

It’s expensive to take shows to Edinburgh – even with The Free Fringe, an organisation I’ve been an active part of for several years now. Publicity, accommodation, transport, props, hiring a technician to provide music cues, insurance, costume – they all cost money. And creating merchandise to sell to try to recoup some of that cash means spending money up-front. In all it costs between one and two thousand pounds to take a show run of eleven days up to The Fringe. And no – as far as I can tell, there are no official grants available!

My health is fragile enough that working extra hours for extra income while I’m up in Edinburgh may very easily damage my health again, and I cannot stress enough how keen I am to avoid that! Similarly, in order to take everything I need with me, I need to hire a car, which gets really expensive really quickly.

You can help me by pledging money in exchange for a reward (anything from a hearty thanks through badges and copies of the book or album, up to a writing or performance coaching session with me, and plenty of other goods and services), or just sharing this with other people!

 

What I Need & What You Get

Publicity £347.20
Equipment £22.17
Merchandise £645.52
Support £220.00
Accommodation £228.75
Transport £211.36
Total £1,675

 

(Total accommodation for my full time there will be £915, and transport £845.44, but I am taking another show (Other Voices Spoken Word Cabaret) up for the full run, so am assuming a 25% share of resources, for want of a better phrase, for The Selkie, even though I’m not running any crowdfunding campaign for that show.)

The perks offered are a mixture of physical (badges, postcards, books, CDs, etc.) and virtual goods (pdf of the show, digital download of the album), plus services (bespoke poems, coaching sessions, performances). The goods will all carry Sa’adiah Khan’s gorgeous artwork inspired by the show, and will be signed by me – either directly or on the packaging. These will be unique mementos of the show or even more unique treats for you or gifts for loved-ones (bespoke poems are an amazing way to show someone how you feel about them, or to commemorate an event!)

If I don’t reach my entire goal. the priority for using the funding will be for publicity (without which I don’t get an audience), and support (technician – without which it will be next to impossible to run the show, and flyerer – without which I’m less likely to get a decent audience, and also run the risk of making myself more ill flyering by myself). The next priority will be to produce the book and CD for minimal merchandise (without which I stand less of a chance making my money back), followed by transport (without which I don’t get get to bring as many items that will help me run the shows and maintain my health while at The Fringe).

If I make more than my goal (!), the extra money will go towards my total costs of accommodation and transport.

 

Risks & Challenges

I acknowledge that this is a niche project to say the least – not only is it an arts project, but it’s a poetry project to boot. Added to which: it’s for a show that’s difficult to explain or describe, and doesn’t even have the courtesy to stick to one genre! And then we have the fact that I’m notoriously poor at asking for help (ask pretty much any of my friends or family about this stubbornness).

I’m banking on the audiences that I’ve entertained over the years, plus the artists I’ve hosted on innumerable stages over the last ten years, responding favourably to helping me out with a few quid each, and that some of them will be keen to get hold of the more elaborate perks such as bespoke poems, coaching sessions, and the like.

I will be using social media (Facebook, Twitter, Blogger, even Instagram, if I can work out how to do it!), my specialist mailing lists, and live performances over the next few weeks, to push the crowdfunding campaign, plus putting out a press release.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand (believe me!) that it’s not always possible to share cash support – let’s face it: times are tough for all but the super-rich at the moment. If you can’t spare even the £1 for some hearty thanks, please consider sharing this campaign with your friends online or in person – IndieGoGo have some lovely social media sharing tools and literally every little helps.

story:
The Journey Home

Taking the journey and finding home. This is what we—a group of storytellers, photographers, wanderers and homebodies—wanted to explore. So we left our cities and wandered into others: Kolkata, Mumbai, Nepal. Now, we're ready to share the stories of what we found. 

Here's the part we love most: 

Your contribution goes directly to Freeset USA—a noble community fighting sex slavery in Kolkata, India. 

How does 100% of our profit go to Freeset USA? Because all contributors donated their artistic talents; all printing costs were covered by KetMoy and CJK; and the Crossroads' community in Cincinnati built infrastructure every step of the way. 

Now, it’s up to you. Since infrastructure and printing is covered, with only a few dollars set aside for shipping, anything you donate goes to Freeset USA. In return, you get a beautiful print magazine and lovely perks—and the knowledge that you contributed to a community of women who are learning a sustainable trade and finally living in a healed, loving community. 

We can't imagine a better place for the profit to go. 

*Freeset USA is an independent U.S. Nonprofit section 501(c)(3) tax exempt organization dedicated to assisting Freeset Bags and Apparel in the charitable purpose of ending human trafficking and modern slavery. Freeset USA will conduct independent reviews and monitor the use of funds to ensure the contributions are used for the intended charitable purposes. Freeset USA retains full control and discretion over the funds raised, consistent with its tax-exempt purposes.


Why $50,000?

We asked Freeset how much it would cost to upgrade their screen-printing equipment, and $50,000 hits the jackpot. But honestly, our goal is thousands more, and we're doing everything we can to make that happen: multi-city dinner gatherings, shop placements, social media fireworks. We want to shower Freeset USA with funds and make this the merriest Christmas for a community who sacrifices every day. 


    The Haven Crew

    What started as a few has quickly turned into a growing collective of talent—professional photographers, art directors, published authors, stylists, shop owners, media gurus—all named on our Haven website. Many of us are Cincinnati cats, but we added California, Charlotte, NYC, Columbus and a few vagabonds along the way.

    It's getting better and better. 


      Spread the Word

      If you can't financially contribute, we would still love for you to help get the word out. Use the Indiegogo share tools and post us on Facebook, Instagram, your dorm walls, your telephone poles. Our gratitude runs deep.

story:
'I'm very excited about my Indiegogo campaign for my debut collection Cawl  out through Parthian Books this year. Hoping to raise some money so that it's as unique as possible, full of poems, prose, essays and cartoons.' – Siôn Tomos Owen


Praise for the book:

‘Siôn Tomos Owen’s book couldn’t come at a more opportune time as Wales and the valleys especially, face the future. Owen’s work speaks for the present with magnificent confidence; witty, elegant, profound. This book should be read widely as it brings us the finest blend of what literature can do to enrich the mind and tug at the heart with the intermingling of prose and poetry. It is a delight to read but also an urgent book as it challenges simplistic assumptions of what it means to belong.  The need for roots is  present here but uprootedness is never more than a heart beat away from y filltir sgwâr, the ‘square mile’. Owen is a writer of breadth and depth. He is a writer of extraordinary gifts who will soar to great heights. It is more than a book — it is a revelation.’ – Menna Elfyn

'Llais gwreiddiol a heriol-  a'i hiwmor mor ddu â'r glo gynt. Casgliad rhyfeddol o eclectig, lle mae'r llaw yr un mor ddeheuig, a'r llygad yr un mor graff, â'r llais.' – Ifor ap Glyn

[Translation: 'An original and exciting voice with humour as black as coal. A remarkably eclectic collection where the hand as detailed and the eye as sharp as the voice.' – Ifor ap Glyn]

‘Good, honest, mean-minded, violent, foul-mouthed stuff, just what a good cartoon should be. Siôn Tomos Owen is a down ‘n’ dirty Welsh Robert Crumb, as exhilarating and slightly terrifying as a Saturday night in the rougher parts of Swansea (and if you can find the less rough parts, good luck to you!).’ – Martin Rowson

‘An electrifying concoction, of poetry, essays, cartoons and short fiction that veers from Charlie Brooker-esque black comedy to warm tributes to family members. Sewn together these fragments form a tapestry that tells the whole gut-wrenching story of the Rhondda, the pride of the past to the uncertainty of the future, shot full of seething anger for the architects of the community’s downfall but scorching with love for the resilience of the trodden upon. From a place where hope is hard to come by, emerges Sion, himself an intrepid cawl of talent and passion, frustration and hunger, of devotion and revulsion, his voice crucial.’ – Rachel Trezise

About the book:

Cawl  is Siôn Tomos Owen's debut full-length collection – an anthology of essays, stories, poems, and cartoons. If this campaign is successful Cawl will be published by Parthian Books in 2016 and edited by their Publishing Editor Susie Wild.

Consisting of short stories, poems, essays and cartoons and comics, Cawl is an anthology of one multi-prize winning, funny, angry young man’s creative endeavours and social and political frustrations. Traditionally Cawl is a mix of everything thrown into one stew pot and left  to simmer, boil over and be savoured. Here Siôn Tomos Owen invites the reader to choose what to taste next. The meat of the essays, the parsnip of poetry, the spud of satire or the OXO cube of comedy.

Ranging in genre from gritty realism, macabre, sci-fi  and comic writing, his is a collection that can be interpreted as an anthology of more than one writer but written by one author. The poems range from short rhyming poems to long free form but consist mainly of valleys-based Cwm on ‘en butt poetry including a centre-piece reinterpretation of Rhydwen Williams’ epic ‘In Praise of a Valley’ from his Rhondda Poems.

The cartoons are a mix of comic-strip-style social humour and satirical cartoons, heavily influenced by Martin Rowson, Art Spiegelman and Gren.

The essays blend humour and frustrated social commentary on Wales and particularly the political situation in the valleys, and are entrenched in Labour idealism while hoping for change that can only come from the people themselves. 


About Siôn:

Siôn Tomos Owen was born and raised first language Welsh in the Rhondda Valley. After a BA in Creative Writing and Media at Trinity College Carmarthen, Siôn won the Tudor Bevan Bursary Award in 2007, was runner up in the Terry Hetherington Young Writers Competition in 2014 and 2013 for short fiction, won the Young Writer’s Prize in the Planet Essay Competition 2013 and was a specially commended in the Welsh Poetry Competition 2014. His writing has been published in a number of magazines and anthologies including Ten of the Best, Square, Nu, Nu2, Planet, Red Poets and Cheval and he’s performed at many events including the Hay Literature Festival 2009-2014 and a very late night Poetry Slam on BBC Radio 5live. 

@sionmun


What We Need & What You Get

We need £1000 to contribute towards the development, production, printing and distribution costs of this debut book from an outstanding young writer. This is not the full cost of the project and Parthian will also contribute money, staff time, marketing and expertise.
This is our first crowdfunding venture. We hope the perks will excite and invite you to support us along the way. Siôn Tomos Owen is a multi-talented creative individual who writes essays, stories, poems, songs and political rants as well as being a doodler and cartoonist. 
He recently presented the six-part S4C documentary series Pobol y Rhondda, a documentary series where he met and drew a contemporary map of the people of the Rhondda. 

We are offering a signed copy of Cawl, a doodle from Siôn, a recipe for Cawl, an invite to the book launch and a free glass of Welsh wine on the night to all who pledge £10.
If we don't manage to reach our goal through this campaign we will still aim to produce a debut collection for Siôn, looking into other possible fundraising routes and events, other traditional financing avenues, or altering either publication date or the size or format of the anthology to something more cost effective such as an ebook. We'd rather have a print edition though, as would Siôn.

About Parthian Books:

Parthian Books is a 22-year-old independent publishing house and a known entity in nurturing and promoting new creative talent in Wales and beyond (e.g. Rachel Trezise, Cynan Jones, James Smythe, Tyler Keevil, Rebecca F. John, Deborah Kay Davies and more). This is an experiment into alternative routes that may mean we can continue to do these worthwhile, but not always commercially-viable, ventures and services in an era of funding cuts to the arts.
www.parthianbooks.com
Twitter: @parthianbooks

Other Ways You Can Help

Those who want to help out but don't have the cash to flash, you can still spread the word about this campaign using the Indiegogo share tools and your social networks on and offline. As always, we appreciate all your support!

story:
Le projet est maintenant terminé, vous pouvez vous procurer le livre au www.humanimo.org Merci de votre soutien!


Le livre


La fondation Humanimo est fière de vous présenter son premier livre, Ton chien te parle, apprends à le comprendre, de la Collection La Ménagerie des Petits, qui est destiné aux enfants de la prématernelle et du primaire ainsi qu'aux parents et aux professeurs afin de les aider à interpréter les gestes et les postures qu’adoptent nos amis canins lorsqu’ils communiquent avec nous. Nous souhaitons que cet outil éducatif permettre aux jeunes d’interagir de façon sécuritaire et positive avec les chiens, et qu’il contribue à favoriser une meilleure compréhension de leurs comportements respectifs de sorte à renforcer le lien qui les unit. 

Ton chien te parle, apprends à le comprendre!

Reliure allemande (5 x 7 pouces): 32 pages, illustrations en couleur

Éditeur: Éditions Humanimo

De Kathleen Desrosiers

Illustré par Nathali Ruel

Vous pouvez vous procurer le livre à l'unité, dans les onglets ici à droite, pour le Canada ou l'International ou à un prix avantageux en lot spécial de 10, 25 ou 50 livres pour livraison au Canada seulement. Nous prévoyons débuter les livraisons à partir du 10 décembre 2014!


Témoignages


  • "Chouette ce petit livre illustré et bien raconté pour que nos enfants interagissent avec les chiens avec joie et sécurité!"

Joël Dehasse www.joeldehasse.com

Diplômé Docteur en Médecine Vétérinaire (DMV) en 1979, de l’Université de Liège (sise à Cureghem, Bruxelles) et Diplômé Médecin Vétérinaire Comportementaliste en 1998, des Écoles Nationales Vétérinaires Françaises. Diplomate (Spécialiste) de l'ECAWBM (Collège Européen de Bien-Être Animal et de Médecine Vétérinaire Comportementale)


  • "Un véritable petit bijou à mettre dans les mains de tous les enfants  ! Pratique, ludique, facile à lire et à comprendre, ce livre essentiel résume bien tout ce que nos enfants doivent savoir pour bien se comporter avec un chien. Bref, un indispensable pour tous les parents et les professeurs d'école. Enfin, il était temps qu'un tel livre voit le jour!"


Anne-Lise Paul www.azca.ca
Technicienne en santé animale, récipiendaire du prix ATSAQ 2014 : Meilleure TSA Entrepreneure de l'année, Comportementaliste praticienne® membre de l'APCP

Explication du projet

Mon nom est Kathleen Desrosiers, je suis technicienne en santé animale, spécialisée en comportement canin. Je travaille depuis plus de 20 ans dans différents établissements avec les animaux et j'ai également plus de 6 ans d'expériences en conception, vente et distribution de produits innovants pour animaux. J’aimerais vous présenter un projet que j’ai mis sur pieds et qui me tiens vraiment à coeur; la Fondation Humanimo, c'est un organisme à but non lucratif qui a une mission éducative auprès des enfants.

Comme mes passions dans la vie sont les enfants et les animaux ainsi que leur mieux-être, j’ai débuté, il y a 2 ans, l’écriture de mon premier livre pour enfants, qui s’intitule: "Ton chien te parle, apprends à le comprendre!"

J’ai écris ce livre afin d'aider les enfants à interpréter les gestes et les postures qu’adoptent nos amis canins lorsqu’ils communiquent avec nous. Je souhaite que cet outil éducatif permettre aux jeunes d’interagir de façon sécuritaire et positive avec les chiens.

Selon un sondage Léger Marketing réalisé en 2010 pour le compte de l’Association des Médecins Vétérinaires du Québec, en partenariat avec CDMV et Hill’ s Pet Nutrition, au Québec, 45 000 enfants âgés de 12 ans et moins ont été mordus par un chien au cours des 12 derniers mois; cela représente un peu plus de 120 morsures par jour. Le chien de la famille est responsable de 38 % de ces morsures. C’est vraiment énorme...

Je me suis dit que si je suis capable d’éviter un seul accident avec ce livre,  et bien ce sera mission accomplie!

C’est certain que ce projet n’aurait pas été possible sans la collaboration de Nathali Ruel de la compagnie Mon ami Muso qui a fait toutes les illustrations du livre. Nathali est responsable d’un service de garde en milieu familial et elle a suivi de nombreuses formations en comportement canin. Je lui suis très reconnaissante de sa participation!
Nous avons choisi le financement participatif afin de faire connaitre notre nouveau livre pour pouvoir mieux évaluer la demande et ainsi amasser les fonds minimums nécessaires à la publicité et la mise en marché du livre.
Nous prévoyons débuter les livraisons à partir du 10 décembre 2014!

Comment vous pouvez nous aider à faire connaître notre projet?

  • Vous pouvez vous procurer le livre en vente dès maintenant! (voir les différentes options à droite) Les frais inclus les taxes (si applicables) ainsi que les frais d'envoi au Canada, aux États-Unis ou à l'International. 
  • En partageant cette vidéo par e-mail et sur vos réseaux, à vos amis et votre famille afin de nous aider à faire connaître le langage canin aux tout-petits. Les outils de partage Indiegogo peuvent vous aider à sauver du temps.
  • Vous pouvez également contribuer à notre mission éducative en versant un don de votre choix qui vous donnera droit à l'inscription de votre nom comme donateur sur la page "mur des donateurs" dédiée à cet effet sur notre site web!
  • Vous pouvez finalement vous procurer un superbe Calendrier de L'Avent pour chien tout en aidant la Fondation BEA! (www.fondationbea.org) Il contient 200g de Biscuits naturels pour chiens Crocx.

Une section de notre site pour favoriser l'adoption!


Puisque nous préconisons l’adoption dans un refuge ou chez un éleveur éthique afin de ne pas encourager la maltraitance des animaux dans les usines à chiots et à chatons. Nous avons donc conçu une page vous donnant accès à tous les animaux offerts à l’adoption dans les refuges, les SPA et les SPCA du Québec afin de trouver le match parfait pour vous et votre famille.

Merci de nous encourager et de soutenir notre mission éducative !

story:
To Our Community of Family, Friends, Colleagues, and Supporters.

Team AKILA is happy to announce a powerful project that we hope will excite and inspire you.

AKILA WORKSONGS INK (a new division at AKILA WORKSONGS, Inc., a communications agency founded in 1993) will publish an anthology series focused on women (ages 30 to 80+) from unique yet related backgrounds and experiences. As a two-volume project, the I've Got Life! anthology series will profile Black women, Latinas, Asian women, and White women from various paths. All of them passionately believe in making the world a better place to live and who have persevered with this mission for at least a decade, despite the challenges and sacrifices that only women have had to endure. April R. Silver (founder of AKILA WORKSONGS) will edit the anthologies.

The series intends to be bold and groundbreaking and it will explore the joys and pains (and sometimes the hard-to-digest truth) of what life looks like when you're a woman dedicated to social justice. Approximately 25 women per volume will be featured in the series:

  • Volume 1: I've Got Life! Persevering Women Talk about Arts and Activism (profiles of women artists and activists, mostly from the U.S.). Target release: Summer 2015
  • Volume 2: I've Got Life! Persevering Women Media Makers (profiles of women activists in mass media, i.e., filmmakers, journalists, producers, etc.).  Target release: January 2016

Perhaps the best way for one to understand the essence of this project is to WATCH THE VIDEO of Nina Simone singing "I Ain't Got No...I've Got Life." The lyrics are perfect! In our view, Nina is #ArtsAndActivism personified and we're honoring her bold spirit by naming the series after one of her songs.

Our Request to the Community

To independently publish the volumes, we need to raise funds!

Basic production and publishing costs include:
  1. hiring a proofreader
  2. hiring a graphic artist to do design and layout for the book
  3. getting the book printed
  4. getting the interviews transcribed
  5. compensating the women in the series
We are turning to the community-at-large for support. Help us get these books to the shelves (summer 2015 and January 2016).

This campaign is specifically for VOLUME 1 and we aim to raise at least $5,001 to offset the aforementioned costs. Your dollars will enable us to deliver a quality product to the marketplace...on time!

If you are able, please give generously and often until the end of the campaign on Tuesday, February 10, 2015 at 11:59pm PST (same as Wednesday, February 11th at 2:59am EST). Your generous support could mean that we get to publish BOTH anthologies in 2015. And it will most certainly mean that you'll help bring a lifetime of inspiration to people who count on the wisdom of women.


The Women of LIFE! (Vol 1 + 2)

Below is a partial list* of women who have agreed to participate in either volume 1 or volume 2. It's an amazing list of women who are 30 to 80+ years of age and who have been doing social justice work for at least a decade.

Some women have achieved national and global acclaim. Others may only be known in their local communities. All of them have stories to tell that will inspire anyone who has boldly persevered for something they believe in, anyone who believes that making the world a better place is actually achievable!

  • Akanke Washington
  • Aletha Maybank, MD, MPH.
  • Amina Baraka
  • asha bandele
  • Baraka Sele
  • Brenda‎ Greene, Ph.D.
  • Brittney Cooper, Ph.D.

  • Esmeralda Simmons, Esq.

  • MaryKay‎ Penn

  • Monifa Bandele

  • Nayaba Arinde

  • Nina Mercer
  • Renair Amin
  • Rha Goddess
  • Richelle Carey
  • Rosa Clemente
  • Salamishah Tillet, Ph.D.
  • Shani Jamila
  • Shantrelle P. Lewis

  • Sonia Sanchez
  • Stacey Muhammad
  • Susan L. Taylor
  • Terrie M. Williams
  • Thandi Chimurenga
  • Thembisa Mshaka
  • Thysha M. Shabazz
  • Toni Blackman
  • Tracie Morris
  • Tulani Kinard
  • Yaba Blay, Ph.D.

* This is a partial list.

What Can You Expect in LIFE!

On a basic level, this is an anthology of interviews and essays.

Silver explains that on a deeper level, "women will talk or write candidly about their social justice work, their victories, their failures, what they know, and what they are still trying to figure out."

"Also, they will express what they treasure and perhaps fear about being a woman; a worker; an intellectual; a daughter, sister, partner, wife, mother, caretaker; a bitch; an artist; a corporate executive; a pacifist; an atheist...or about being misunderstood (nod to Nina). They are a small sample of women who have made life choices that no one should have to make and that half the world can't relate to. And 9 times out of 10, these women have made choices while wallowing in pain. But they persevered anyway, for the good of their families and the communities for which they stand. We should seize every opportunity to get these kinds of victories and cautionary tales out in the world."

Our Promise

In exchange for funding, we promise to deliver quality books as well as the perk for which you are eligible. While all perks were carefully thought of with the reader and writer in mind, the items certainly have wide appeal. Some perks will even yield permanent acknowledgement in the book.


»» Take a look at the PERK details outlined to the right of your computer screen »»

Notes: These are sample images. Actual color and size may differ slightly. Shipping costs are included for U.S. orders only. For international orders, add $20 USD.

You can trust us to deliver! For more than 20 years, the AKILA WORKSONGS team has worked with distinguished clients across the U.S. and on three continents. We are not perfect BUT! we are in good standing. But don't take our word for it. We encourage you to ask about us, search. If we're known at all, then we're known to be an upstanding group of people. We will deliver on our promises.

Time to Contribute! How?

It might sound cliche but we totally mean it when we say that no dollar amount is too small or too large. Here are three ways to financially support volume 1:

  1. You can make an online payment using your credit or debit card.

  2. You can pay via PayPal. For this campaign, PayPal is the preferred method of payment. If you don't have an account, you can create one at www.PayPal.com (no charge). We've created BONUSES exclusively for PayPal'ers ;-)

  3. You may also send a check or money order via postal mail. Make payable to AKILA WORKSONGS and send to PO Box 250553, Brooklyn, New York 11225-0553. PLEASE NOTE...

  • If you would like a perk, please put the name of the perk in the memo and send the minimum amount for said perk.

  • In order to get the perk you pick, your payment must be postmarked by Wednesday, February 11, 2015.

  • Be sure that you give us your full shipping address (including your zip code). We'd love your email address too so that we can keep you abreast of the project's developments.

  • If you leave the memo blank or forget to give us a shipping address, we will not be able to send out any perk.

Other Contribution and Perk FAQs

  1. What if I don't want a perk? If you want to contribute without collecting a perk, you can. Just click the "CONTRIBUTE NOW" red button on the right side of your screen (above the perks column) and then follow instructions.
  2. I want to give anonymously. May I? Yes. You have an option to have your name NOT publicly associated with this campaign.
  3. What if I want to give an amount that is not listed in the perks column? You totally can. Click on the "CONTRIBUTE NOW" button for your options or click on a perk and enter a "custom" amount.
  4. Can I upgrade my perk? YES! If you contribute now and again later, then we'll combine the contributions and match the final amount with the appropriate perk. For example, you can start off by giving $5 today, $20 in two weeks, and another $25 two weeks after that. Your sum total of $50 would allow you to get the #LifeSupporter perk! » IMPORTANT « You must contribute using the same email address each time so we can credit you appropriately.
  5. Can I write a check? Absolutely. See above.

What Happens WHEN We Raise More Than $5,001?

We're campaigning to raise funds for volume 1 but over the course of 60 days but we actually hope to raise the necessary funds for BOTH volumes (fingers crossed). Whatever we raise beyond $5,001 will go directly to the production and marketing of volume 1 and then production and marketing for volume 2. Every dollar raised for the project as a whole will go toward making the series come to life, pun intended :-)

The Woman Behind the Series

We believe that few people are as well poised to do this series as April R. Silver.

Photo credit: Saddi Khali

ABOUT APRIL: Silver is a social entrepreneur, activist, writer, and editor. In 1993, she founded AKILA WORKSONGS, the leading communications agency of its kind in the United States. Her distinguished roster of clients range from progressive filmmakers, public intellectuals, and poets to social justice organizations and cultural arts institutions. Ms. Silver is also a former talk show host of My Two Cents (formerly BETJ, now known as Centric TV).

As a result of her work, Ms. Silver has been featured, profiled, or quoted in The Washington Post; Ms., ESSENCE, EBONY, Time, and Newsweek magazines; on CNN, BET, HuffPost Live, The Tom Joyner Morning Show, and many other local and international outlets. As a writer, her essays and commentaries have been published in books, newspapers, and journals including the New York Daily News and Word.Beats.Life (The Global Journal of Hip Hop Culture). She speaks regularly at colleges, universities, and conferences across the country and in 2013, she visited Africa at the invitation of the American University of Nigeria to present on arts and activism (twice in one year).

A proud graduate of Howard University (where she co-lead the historic student take-over of 1989), Ms. Silver is also founding president of The Cultural Initiative, Inc. and co-produced the nation's first hip hop conference in 1991 – helping to originate the hip hop education movement that is now embraced by academia. In 1998, Silver became a member of the NYC Chapter of the National Academy of Recording Arts and Sciences aka NARAS (The GRAMMYS®) and chaired the spoken word committee.

Be it on-the-ground, behind-the-scenes, at the mic, or in the boardroom, whether in public or in private, Ms. Silver has played a pivotal role in cultural arts and social justice movements for nearly 30 years. In 2013, to celebrate her 20th anniversary in business, Silver was featured at the world renown Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture in Harlem. The one-on-one interview was conducted by award-winning journalist Curtis Stephen. In 2014, Mayor Ras J. Baraka of the City of Newark, NJ appointed Silver to the city's Arts, Cultural Development, and Tourism Transition Committee.

Silver's Editorial Experience

In 2008, April's first book was published by Soft Skull/Counterpoint Press. The anthology was the brainchild of Loren Harris, formerly of The Ford Foundation. It collected essays, interviews, and poems from 24 Black men who "came of age" during the golden era of hip hop...and who had inspirational stories to tell about family and fatherhood. Be a Father to Your Child: Real Talk from Black Men on Family, Love, and Fatherhood was a critical success and featured Aaron Lloyd, Adisa Banjoko, Alford Young, Jr., Bakari Kitwana, Bill Stephney, Byron Hurt, Cheo Tyehimba Taylor, Davey D., Dion Chavis, James Braxton Peterson, Jelani Cobb, Kevin Powell, Kevin Williams, Lasana Hotep, Loren S. Harris, Lumumba Akinwole-Bandele, Mo Beasley, Rhymefest, Saddi Khali, Shaun Neblett, Steven G. Fullwood, Talib Kweli, Thabiti Boone, and Timothy D. Jones.

Here are a few reviews...

  • HuffPost Black Voices (formerly AOL Black Voices) called the book a “powerful and groundbreaking anthology.”
  • Foreword Magazine claims “Editor April R. Silver has turned her first book into a must-read for anyone involved in the black community.”
  • Mothering Magazine: It is an “artfully designed anthology that addresses the intersection of hip-hop with issues of black masculinity and parenting…”
  • Also from Mothering Magazine: The anthology "...moving and authentic..."
The I've Got Life! series will be Silver's second and third books.

You Can Support by Sharing!

We have launched this campaign during the giving/holiday season. Because we think that I've Got Life! is an amazing project, we see this time of year as a golden opportunity for people to invest in inspiring work. We firmly believe that any day is a great day to uplift a woman's good work. So yes, we are working to make I've Got Life! a project to support NOW and at the top of 2015.

But if you're not able to contribute financially, then PLEASE SHARE this campaign. Help us make some noise!  Word-of-mouth is still a HIGHLY EFFECTIVE way to create a buzz. We wish for as many people as possible to help bring this work to life.

Here are some ways to share:
  1. Update your Facebook statuses and tell your friends and fans about I've Got Life! See the SHARE button at the top of this page.
  2. Inbox your FB friends and tell them how utterly excited you are about this project. Inbox them this URL for volume 1: http://igg.me/at/artsandactivism
  3. Tweet about the project! Use the hashtags #ArtsAndActivism and #IveGotLife. The SHARE button is up top.
  4. Download any of images from the gallery and post them to FB, Twitter, Instagram, etc. Post the URL for volume 1: http://igg.me/at/artsandactivism
  5. Send a personal email to folks. URL: http://igg.me/at/artsandactivism
  6. Repeat steps 1 - 5...often :-) Remember: #ArtsAndActivism and #IveGotLife.
  7. Journalists, bloggers, and other people in the press: We welcome your curiosity and inquiry (be it about the amazing women who have agreed to participate in the project or about the editor). Media inquiries are directed to Drake R. Holliday at drake@akilaworksongs.com.
Word-of-mouth, emails, texts, phone calls, smoke signals, or carrier pigeons...whatever method works, it will all help promote our campaign to raise at least $5,001. We think you'll agree that these women's work is worth the push.
We encourage you to give feedback (public or public) in the COMMENTS section of this campaign. We'd love to read your thoughts about the project!

Thanks again. We're excited about LIFE! and your role in it.

Sincerely,
Team AKILA
Search Everything @AKILAWORKSONGS on Twitter + Facebook + Instagram
story_txt:
To Our Community of Family, Friends, Colleagues, and Supporters.Team AKILA is happy to announce a powerful project that we hope will excite and inspire you.AKILA WORKSONGS INK (a new division at AKILA WORKSONGS, Inc., a communications agency founded in 1993) will publish an anthology series focused on women (ages 30 to 80+) from unique yet related backgrounds and experiences. As a two-volume project, the I've Got Life! anthology series will profile Black women, Latinas, Asian women, and White women from various paths. All of them passionately believe in making the world a better place to live and who have persevered with this mission for at least a decade, despite the challenges and sacrifices that only women have had to endure. April R. Silver (founder of AKILA WORKSONGS) will edit the anthologies.
 The series intends to be bold and groundbreaking and it will explore the joys and pains (and sometimes the hard-to-digest truth) of what life looks like when you're a woman dedicated to social justice. Approximately 25 women per volume will be featured in the series:



Volume 1: I've Got Life! Persevering Women Talk about Arts and Activism (profiles of women artists and activists, mostly from the U.S.). Target release: Summer 2015


Volume 2: I've Got Life! Persevering Women Media Makers (profiles of women activists in mass media, i.e., filmmakers, journalists, producers, etc.).  Target release: January 2016




Perhaps the best way for one to understand the essence of this project is to WATCH THE VIDEO of Nina Simone singing "I Ain't Got No...I've Got Life." The lyrics are perfect! In our view, Nina is #ArtsAndActivism personified and we're honoring her bold spirit by naming the series after one of her songs.Our Request to the Community

To independently publish the volumes, we need to raise funds!Basic production and publishing costs include:
hiring a proofreader
hiring a graphic artist to do design and layout for the book
getting the book printed
getting the interviews transcribed

compensating the women in the series
We are turning to the community-at-large for support. Help us get these books to the shelves (summer 2015 and January 2016).This campaign is specifically for VOLUME 1 and we aim to raise at least $5,001 to offset the aforementioned costs. Your dollars will enable us to deliver a quality product to the marketplace...on time!If you are able, please give generously and often until the end of the campaign on Tuesday, February 10, 2015 at 11:59pm PST (same as Wednesday, February 11th at 2:59am EST). Your generous support could mean that we get to publish BOTH anthologies in 2015. And it will most certainly mean that you'll help bring a lifetime of inspiration to people who count on the wisdom of women.

The Women of LIFE! (Vol 1 + 2)
Below is a partial list* of women who have agreed to participate in either volume 1 or volume 2. It's an amazing list of women who are 30 to 80+ years of age and who have been doing social justice work for at least a decade. Some women have achieved national and global acclaim. Others may only be known in their local communities. All of them have stories to tell that will inspire anyone who has boldly persevered for something they believe in, anyone who believes that making the world a better place is actually achievable!

story:
This May, the people of Wales will vote in the most important elections since devolution. In Neath and our valleys the choice is clear: a continuation of the rule of a tired and increasingly divided Labour Party or a fresh start with Plaid Cymru. Having been born and bred in Ystalyfera, Alun understands local concerns and will fight tirelessly for increased investment in our NHS, a first class education for all and the regeneration that Neath town centre and our valleys so desperately needs.  

By contributing you can help bring about the change Wales needs.

Mis Mai yma, bydd pobl Cymru yn pleidleisio yn yr etholiadau pwysicaf ers datganoli. Yng Nghastell-nedd a'n cymoedd mae'r dewis yn glir: parhad o reolaeth flinedig y Blaid Lafur sy'n fwyfwy rhanedig neu ddechreuad newydd gyda Phlaid Cymru. Ar ôl cael ei eni a magu yn Ystalyfera, mae Alun yn deall pryderon lleol a bydd yn ymladd yn ddiflino ar gyfer mwy o fuddsoddi yn ein GIG, addysg o'r radd flaenaf i bawb ac yr adfywio y mae angen mor daer ar ganol tref Castell-nedd a'n cymoedd.

Trwy gyfrannu gallech chi helpu dod a'r newid sydd ei angen i Gymru.

story:
The SaltyLife Magazine

As a continuation of both JustBreathe and SaltyGirls, The SaltyLife will be a quarterly magazine about living with Cystic Fibrosis that will expand it's focus to EVERYONE, finally including SaltyGuys as well as SaltyKids and families. Every issue will introduce and tell the stories of new families, new men & women, BUT will also have fantastic content about health, fitness, diet, treatments, Tips, and so much more. We WELCOME all your feedback and look forward to you helping US make this one of the top platforms for CF Patients around the world. We'll be trying to get exclusive content from medical professionals worldwide as well.

Currently we are compiling a list of articles and great interviews, and so far it's coming along WAY BETTER than i could have imagined. We'll have articles and profiles from respected people in the CF community from all around the world.


NOW... most of you are familiar with me and my work. You KNOW what I am capable of, and that I usually get done what I say i'm going to do. And I know how to get PRESS and SUPPORT for our cause... look at the media outlets below that covered SaltyGirls!!!!!


First I set out to get JustBreathe made, and I did. Then I did the same for SaltyGirls!!! Now for The SaltyLife we really want to make this a showcase piece, and maybe even one day turn it into a monthly magazine.

What We Need & What You Get

This fundraiser is ONLY to launch the initial, first issue. We are very confident that it will be a success, and then - when it comes time to work on issue #2 - we'll start to offer subscriptions. As for the perks, I decided to keep things pretty simple. Some fundraisers offers WAY TOO MANY variations on perks, but this is pretty basic: HELP US get this magazine off the ground. That's why we are only looking to raise $6,000. This gets the first issue off the ground and some breathing room to get issue 2 going.


The Impact

It's really only through these fundraisers that it allows us to embark on these goals. WITHOUT YOUR generosity, it would be almost impossible. So YOU really do help make the difference in your own lives. And hopefully through this magazine we can make a REAL difference in many people's lives.

HOW ELSE CAN WE IMPACT THE CF COMMUNITY?

By giving back in the way of employing those with CF. All of us know, holding down a job - ANY job - with CF is all but impossible. That makes not just paying medical bills sometimes very difficult, but just paying regular bills as well. Our goal is to raise enough that we are able to PAY people to help on the magazine, either by writing articles, conducting interviews, even proofreading. Whatever. We want to give back in a way that will make an immediate impact on lives.


Risks & Challenges

We hope we have set our goal at a level that is VERY attainable, but there is always the risk that we fall short. That's just life. But I think with the right mix of timely, important articles and great photography we'll get there. The challenge will be from issue to issue, but we'll be asking everyone for help.

Other Ways You Can Help

PLEASE help get the word out. Do anything you can, if you are unable to donate, to shout it to the world.
story_txt:
The SaltyLife Magazine As a continuation of both JustBreathe and SaltyGirls, The SaltyLife will be a quarterly magazine about living with Cystic Fibrosis that will expand it's focus to EVERYONE, finally including SaltyGuys as well as SaltyKids and families. Every issue will introduce and tell the stories of new families, new men & women, BUT will also have fantastic content about health, fitness, diet, treatments, Tips, and so much more. We WELCOME all your feedback and look forward to you helping US make this one of the top platforms for CF Patients around the world. We'll be trying to get exclusive content from medical professionals worldwide as well.
Currently we are compiling a list of articles and great interviews, and so far it's coming along WAY BETTER than i could have imagined. We'll have articles and profiles from respected people in the CF community from all around the world.

story:
WHO I AM

I'm I. A. Ashcroft, teller of stories. Some of my favorite writers include Neil Gaiman, Terry Pratchett, Margaret Weis, and, well, I could go on for about ten years. I live in a house filled with what some might call an unreasonable number of books, but I'd call whoever said that a silly person. 

For over a decade, I’ve been chasing that wonderful writing dragon, and I would like to introduce to you my first full-length book for publication, a 95,000 word dark fantasy/sci-fi novel called Raven Song. It’s a story of hope, loss, love, magic, and a lot of the dark corners where the old gods still live long after humanity has almost burned itself to ash.

It is the first of a four book series, and as part of the launch, I want to create  a professionally recorded audiobook to bring the world to life. 

And that, my friends, is where you come in.

PROJECT DETAILS

Please help yourself to this blurb and free excerpt!

Blurb:

A century ago, the world burned. Even now, though rebuilt and defiant, civilization is still choking on the ashes.

Jackson, a smuggler, lives in the shadows, once a boy with no memory, no name, and no future. Ravens followed him, long-extinct creatures only he could see, and nightmares flew in their wake. Once, Jackson thought himself to be one of the lucky few touched by magic, a candidate for the Order of Mages. He is a man now, and that dream has died. But, the ravens still follow. The nightmares still whisper in his ear.

Anna's life was under the sun, her future bright, her scientific work promising. She knew nothing of The Bombings, the poisoned world, or the occult. One day, she went to work, and the next, she awoke in a box over a hundred years in the future, screaming, fighting to breathe, and looking up into the eyes of a smuggler. Anna fears she's gone crazy, unable to fill the massive hole in her memories, and terrified of the strange abilities she now possesses.

The Coalition government has turned its watchful eyes towards them. The secret factions of the city move to collect them first. And, old gods stir in the darkness, shifting their pawns on the playing field. If Anna and Jackson wish to stay free, they must learn what they are and why they exist. 

Unfortunately, even if they do, it may be too late.

Free Excerpt (Prologue):

A boy lay on the broken sidewalk, eyes closed. He was pale and thin, looking not a day over ten years old. His half-clothed body shuddered against the chilly night air. His bony frame scraped against the grime of the street as he curled into himself, trying to keep back the cold. Overhead, the stars hung bright and lonely.

In the alley, almost invisible against the midnight darkness, a man stood tall over the boy. His well-pressed suit was as black as the shadows, as his skin, and as the raven on his shoulder. The way he hovered over the child, he seemed a strange guardian. But his eyes were turned upwards to the sky, away from the boy’s plight, as if it was no real matter. In those black eyes the stars were mirrored, impossible and brilliant. Those eyes stared back into the past, when the celestial lights were loved and revered, when each constellation had a story. 

Once upon a time… this was when the world had sung to him, the dream-walker, the song-weaver, the star-stringer. 

Once, before humans had forgotten his name.

Now, the starry sky was almost hidden by the glowing blue haze of the Barrier, a shield cast over what was left of the city: proud New York, ruined, rebuilt, defiant.

The stranger kept staring upwards into oblivion, even as the boy let out an unhappy whimper, chills wracking his weak frame. The raven flew from the stranger’s shoulder then, alighting onto the sidewalk, picking past the weeds and rubble. It rejoined its fellows who had settled amicably around the child, oblivious to the fact that ravens were all supposed to be dead. One hundred years ago, poison had leeched into the earth, into the grass, into the grazers, and into the corpses left behind. The blight spared little, its kind no exception. Regardless, this impossible creature affectionately brushed at the boy’s dark hair with its beak.

At the touch, the boy awoke with a start. His wide, uncomprehending eyes took in the world as he struggled to sit up, his head swinging around wildly, past awnings and high rises he had never seen, past scrawled words and graffiti he could not understand. He teetered to his feet, then fell back down again as his knees gave out, sending the birds around him into flight.

He saw no starry eyes in the darkness, no stranger standing nearby. He was half-naked, shivering, hungry, and alone, his head aching down to his teeth. The nameless boy shook off the dreams he couldn’t remember and wondered where he was.

If there had been any passersby on that cold autumn night, they would have sworn that this boy hadn’t been there a minute ago, and no stranger or ravens had been there at all.

Risks & Challenges

The Raven Song audiobook is an extremely low-risk campaign. The novel is finished, the ISBNs are purchased, the cover art is done, and the pages are typeset. This is ready to release now in digital or paperback book format (there is a hardcover as well, EXCLUSIVE to backers of this campaign). 

The only question remaining is the audiobook. It will be contracted through Amazon’s ACX platform, which has been around for some time and will allow me to select from several professional narrators to bring you the very best experience. Though this is the first audiobook I have contracted, I have done extensive research and am confident that ACX’s narrators will bring you an excellent reading. This company and these people devote their professional lives to this, so this will not be an amateur work. 

Contribution Perks

I hope you'll be excited about reading this story as much as I am about sharing it with you. Backers of this campaign can choose from many different perks as a sign of my gratitude, and those who choose to receive digital or physical editions of the book will get their copies a full week before its wide release. 

Backers can also receive the hardcover copy of Raven Song EXCLUSIVE to this campaign. It's professionally printed and beautifully bound, with cream paper and a quality dust jacket. 

Finally, all backers will receive updates as the audiobook is recorded, and those who contribute at certain tiers will receive a copy of the audiobook a full week before its wide release as well.

And finally, whether you can contribute or not...

Thank you so much for taking the time to read about my project. Even if you can’t contribute, if you've enjoyed what you've read, I’d love to connect with you on Twitter, Facebook, Goodreads, or via the campaign contact link. I like having friends in reading or writing, and my friends tend to get free prose if they should want it. And, by all means, please share my campaign with your own friends, family, and maybe even that crazy guy you pass on your way to work every morning. I'm excited for us to get this going and tell some stories together!

Have a lovely New Year!
