story:
¿Qué?

El asesino de canciones se sitúa en un lugar a medio camino entre las obras de Julian Barnes y Boris Vian.

La epilepsia musicogénita, según Oliver Sacks, es un mal ocasionado por la estimulación musical. La sensibilidad deja de ser un don para convertirse en una maldición; se pierde el control y el bienestar. Y lo más curioso del caso es que puede ser atribuido a estímulos sumamente específicos. A un tipo específico de canción.

El asesino de canciones narra la historia de León, un hombre que se ve superado por el mundo y que sin embargo intenta encaminar su vida, al tiempo que se enfrenta a una experiencia musical perturbadora. Ciertas canciones excitan su autocompasión, lo inducen al desgarro emocional y se vuelven para él un incordio permanente. Obsesionado con esta idea, León decide eliminar las canciones sensibleras de la faz de la tierra.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Pablo Manzano.

Pablo Manzano (Argentina, 1972). Estudió Comunicación Social en la Universidad de Buenos Aires. En 1999 se mudó a Barcelona, donde empezó a trabajar como traductor de narrativa y realizador de proyectos editoriales juveniles.

En 2006 se publicó su primera obra de ficción, El rencor de los bufones (relatos), y en 2008 salió su segundo libro, El puente de la jirafa (novela), ambos bajo el sello de Barataria Ediciones, editorial para la que además tradujo cuentos de O’Henry, publicados con el título de Esto no es un cuento y otros cuentos (2008). En 2009 participó en la antología argentina La erótica del relato (Adriana Hidalgo Editora), junto a autores como Patricio Pron, Oliverio Coelho, Matías Néspolo y Jimena Néspolo. Ha colaborado en diversas publicaciones literarias, como Quimera y Boca de Sapo.

Actualmente vive en Viena.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 800€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de El asesino de canciones que saldría después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Pablo Manzano vea publicada esta obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
For the last few years, I've aspired to have my first book made into an audiobook.  Recently, I found a very affordable professional narrator and identified some back up options should that fall through.  I'd love your support in bringing this project to fruition.  From the time I kick it off, I expect it to take about two months to complete.

The reader will read the entire book and provide all the sound editing.  I'll end up with files ready to upload and sell on Audible.

If you contribute any amount, you'll receive the audio files for your personal use.  In addition, for those who contribute $25 or more, I'll provide personal shamanic work on your behalf to support you in learning shamanic journey.  Check out the video for details.

About "Practical Shamanism, A Guide for Walking in Both Worlds" by Katie Weatherup

There are worlds of healing, protection, and insight available to you just beyond ordinary reality. The knowledge to simply, powerfully journey to these worlds, to connect with your spirit guides, to build a vision of yourself as healthy, intuitive and psychically alive, is within this book. Whether you are just beginning to seek a truer and more meaningful existence, or you are an experienced traveler of worlds, this book provides a reliable, straightforward, friendly and practical guide to basic shamanic practices, including more advanced instruction in past life healing, shadow work, and soul retrieval.

Review:
Excellent guide that blends modern views with time-honored shamanic traditions by Midwest Book Review
"Written by shamanic practitioner, Reiki master, and mechanical engineer Katie Weathercup, Practical Shamanism: A Guide for Walking in Both Worlds is a guide to the metaphysical power of exploring worlds beyond the mundane, building a bond with spirit guides, past-life healing, shadow work, soul-retrieval, and the search for a more meaningful existence. Written to be accessible to readers of all backgrounds, Practical Shamanism guides both novices and experienced shamans with sensible advice and provides numerous anecdotes of other individuals' mystic experiences. A bibliography rounds out this excellent guide that blends modern views with time-honored shamanic traditions."

You can learn more about me and my work at my website which is www.handsoverheart.com

story:
We are currently shipping this sucker! Please be patient we are working through the back list now. Have not ordered your copy?

You can get a non-signed naked copy off Amazon at: 

https://www.amazon.com/Migration-Snack-Die-Scot...

Signed copies with bonus hand drawn sketches are listed when in stock at:

 http://www.ebay.com/usr/snackart 

 

 

 

 

 

The Bundy Court Sketches are unapologetically scratchy misspelled reports from the front line of the Bundy bunch court cases. Join us for the continuing coverage at .... 

BOOKFACE

https://www.facebook.com/bundycourtsketch/

TWITTWETTER

https://twitter.com/hecktow

 

When Ammon Bundy et al showed up in Burns Oregon to take over a bird refuge it got my attention. I followed the Bundy's first performance in Bunkerville Nevada in 2014 fairly closely. I at least I thought I followed it closely at the time. Now two years later we find him in my home state and I was a bit angry and curious. 

Now Ammon to his credit invited everyone to go see him and law enforcement decided on the hands off approach. So as a micro small time film maker I decided to toss the cameras in the car and head over to check out the daily press conference they had. Unfortunately I missed him both times I tried. First due to me being late coming over the mountain pass and second due to him being arrested.

The focus shifted to the courts of my home town of Portland Oregon. No cameras allowed, So I decided to change my approach. I thought this was a perfect job for the old school sketch artist. The only problem was I have never really drawn before.

This book is not the court sketches. "The Migration" is a fictional story inspired by the stand-off. It is designed to kill two birds with one can of vanilla flavored coffee creamer. First is to fill some requests to do a book and draw earlier events. B is to raise some funds to continue the coverage as the court cases approach. In particular travel expenses for Nevada cases now slatted for Feb 2017.

What We Need & What You Get

The book is currently in "pre-production". That means "I haven't finished it yet".  It will be a  8" X 10" Paperback color cover and black & white illustrations. Projected to be around 100 pages, it will look sort of like a children's book. All copies will be signed. We will also have a version with some hand draw illustrations. A digital copy should also be available sometime in the future.

The book is fictional satirical story not a docubookary. However, the Snacktivist in your home will appreciate the inside jokes and Easter eggs. 

"Clebone and his family have a long standing battle with the Feds because their cow keeps pooping in prime tortoise humping grounds. When the Feds move in, Clebone and his patriot buddies successfully keep them out. Years later Clebone's sons, Ammo and Rifle, go all out one year for Father's Day and take over a bird refuge in Oregon.  Unfortunately things do not go as planned."

Nest Egg = $600 - seed money to get the thing produced and moving. 

Profits above that will be focused on continuing the Court Sketch project. Travel expenses for the Nevada case as an example. So the more money raised means more and better coverage. 

Risks & Challenges

I'm really poor so the more you can buy the more future coverage I can do. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like what you see pass the word. Pass a link.

Have not ordered your copy?You can get a non-signed naked copy off Amazon at: https://www.amazon.com/Migration-Snack-Die-Scot...Signed copies with bonus hand drawn sketches are listed when in stock at: http://www.ebay.com/usr/snackart      The Bundy Court Sketches are unapologetically scratchy misspelled reports from the front line of the Bundy bunch court cases. story:
In Short...

I've been a part of the online CSI media coverage for a decade, starting out on a very small "Freewebs" platform, moving on to Modern Day Sherlock based on Tripod, before finally settling in at CSI Files--a site highly respected by those officially involved with the CSI franchise. CSI Files has been a great foundation for me to evolve as a writer, and make a little money on the side. Unfortunately, the decrease in site traffic over the past few years has forced some cutbacks and due to those cuts, it is incredibly hard to cover the gas mileage, phone, train tickets, and other expenses that allow me to get to places and do things to continue pushing out content.

If you know who I am, you know that I adore what I do and love being able to update the fans with all of the latest exclusives and interviews. As with all things in life, money helps keep things going. 

 

What I Need

I live just a little over an hour from Los Angeles, where CSI and CSI: NY are filmed. Over the course of the season, I make occasional visits to the set for CSI Files content and meet-up with the cast, writers, and crew for interviews. To break things down...

  • A round-trip train ticket is $57.00
  • Gas is over $4 a gallon, and driving 65 miles is not pretty in the least.
  • My cell phone is on a 300 minute a month plan and it is the only phone I have. It costs $30 just for those minutes, and a typical interview for me lasts anywhere between 30 minutes to two hours. 

The Impact

This section is a beast to tackle, because I do not enjoy reaching out for money. What I do enjoy is being a fan that can connect with other fans via the work that I do. It is my sincere hope that the fans continue to choose CSI Files for their daily news and I would absolutely love to continue providing all of the neat stuff that CSI Files is able to tackle. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're broke too I know the feeling.

Share the links. Tweet it, G+ it, even Facebook it. Any help and support is beyond appreciated.

story:
Short Summary

Having a diabetic child requires 8-10 finger pricks per day and 1-3 throughout the night to monitor blood sugars. Gracie is on an insulin pump, so her canula gets changed every other day as well. Unfortunately in children, it is often difficult for them to recognize when their sugar is dropping or spiking. This can be very dangerous, because they can go into a diabetic coma or worse, especially while sleeping. A diabetic alert dog is trained to smell the change in blood sugar and alert the child and/or an adult when a "high" or "low" occurs. They sleep with their child and wake up and alert at the onset of a problem. Our dog will also be trained to get help if Gracie were to collapse or just can't get to an adult in an emergency. These dogs are true service dogs and certified as such so that they can go everywhere with the child. Because these dogs are so highly skilled, they are also extremely expensive. The average alert dog is $15,000-$20,000. However, the Foothills Kiwanis Club of Boulder has a service dog project that trains diabetic alert dogs as well as other forms of service dogs. They are a very special group of people volunteering their time to change the lives of children with special needs.     

What We Need 

The Foothills Kiwanis Club has two programs. The original program is for families of children 8 and older and they receive a fully grown and fully trained service dog for free. Since our family does not qualify for that program, they have started a new one. They felt like Gracie would bond better with a puppy. So In this new program, we will get our puppy, 2 years of specialized training for us and the puppy, the service dog certification, 2 years free vet care AND food all for $3,000!!! Here is the breakdown of the costs:

  • $1800 Cost of puppy
  • $1000 Cost of 2 yr Kiwanis memberships for Joe and I which includes all of the training + 2 yrs of vet care and food
  • $200 Kennels, leashes, and other gear needed for puppy raising and training
  • Anything extra will go to a fund for future families to get service dogs through the Kiwanis program. 

Please keep in mind that these dogs cost between $15,000 and $20,000 normally if you go through the very few specialized breeder/trainers there are in the US. So the fact that we can get our dog plus vet care and food for 2 years for $3,000 is AMAZING! Our puppy is a Golden Retriever from a highly regarded breeder and will be chosen from their latest litter after the puppies have been tested and one is determined worthy to be a service dog.  

Because we are so honored to be a part of the Foothills Kiwanis Club of Boulder, and we believe what they are doing is making a MAJOR impact on those in our community dealing with special needs, we want to contribute anything we can raise above the $3,000 to a fund that they are setting up for future families who can't afford their service dog, but desperately need one. How exciting!!! 

The Impact

   To explain why this is such a blessing for us, let me explain exactly what this dog will offer Gracie. First and foremost, this dog could save her life. The reality is, Gracie's blood sugar could drop low enough at night for her to go into a diabetic coma or even not wake up in the morning. We check her throughout the night to be sure her levels are in range, but mistakes can be made and children's bodies and blood sugars are just not always predictable.

   We will all be able to go to bed at night and not worry for once about whether she is going to be ok. At this point, I cannot even imagine that, but it may be a reality for us in the near future! I cannot tell you what that will mean for our family- to know that our baby is safe while she sleeps.

   Also, this dog will make every day life easier. It will be able to go to every soccer game, swim class, play date, and school day she has and will help her when she is distracted or playing hard, when its easy to lose track of her blood sugar level. This will also mean that she could actually get to go to a sleepover one day! Aside from the safety factor, Gracie will have a devoted companion that is right by her side wherever she goes. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute we (obviously) understand! But that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so very much for taking the time to read our campaign page and supporting Gracie! Please keep in mind that any money collected above and beyond the $3000 we need will be put in a fund through the Kiwanis Club for future families who need help getting their service dog! Please make sure we get your mailing address so we can send you a note of thanks for contributing!

story:
I am thrilled and grateful that my campaign has met its goal! I appreciate everyone's support more than you can know! Any contributions that surpass my original goal of $500 will go toward additional entry fees and/or an inexpensive printer. THANK YOU!!


My Story

It is humbling to have to ask you, friends and strangers, for money in this manner. I have been pursuing my writing/filmmaking goals for 24 years now. It has been a tough slog, with many ups and downs. Some of my small victories include winning a 2008 Fellowship in Screenwriting from the New York Foundation for the Arts, and being a 2-time semifinalist in the Nicholl Fellowships, the industry's most prestigious competition. I have screened my no-budget films at Anthology Film Archives and Two Boots Pioneer Theater (both in New York City), Film Kitchen (Pittsburgh, PA), and Emerging Filmmakers (Rochester, NY). To see a reel of my no-budget work, click here:


Zoje Stage Directing Reel: javascript:nicTemp();


But now I am at a crossroads. Due to a nearly lifelong convergence of chronic health problems and poverty, it is becoming nearly impossible for me to pursue my writing/filmmaking goals. I feel I must make this the last year that I make writing/filmmaking the main emphasis in my life, as poverty is encroaching to an overwhelming degree. To read more about my background and this decision, please read my blog piece:


Facing the Fork in the Road: javascript:nicTemp();

 

It is common for screenwriters to spend hundreds (possibly thousands) of dollars a year to enter contests and grants that might further their career. I have only ever been able to afford entering a couple of things a year, but this year even that is too much. Yet, my writing is at a great place, and I would like to make every possible effort to make my dreams come true this year. Toward that goal, I would like to enter multiple scripts in the programs that would have the most benefit and impact on my career: The Nicholl Fellowships, The Sundance Screenwriters Lab (which feeds into the Directors Lab), and the IFP Emerging Narrative program.


The Impact

With your help, I will be able to enter 3 scripts into the Nicholl Fellowships, 3 scripts into Sundance, and one script into IFP Emerging Narrative (which first requires paying to join IFP). 

The Nicholl Fellowships offers 5 prizes of $35,000 - which is 7 times more money than I earned in 2011. But even being a quarter- or semi-finalist can be beneficial to a writer. Sundance and IFP Emerging Narrative both offer opportunities to learn from and network with established film professionals. Needless to say, to get into one of these programs could truly change the trajectory of my career - and my life. And, as they say, you can't win if you don't play.

100% of the money I receive will go toward writing/filmmaking expenses. If I receive more than $500 I will have the option to submit scripts to additional contests - or possibly invest in an inexpensive printer/scanner (currently I am without a scanner, and my printer is almost useless at this point).

I am exceedingly thankful for the support I've already received - and I am determined to "make you all proud" --- I will absolutely do my best to submit the best applications and support materials possible!
 
I also want to assure all of you that I am looking for a better job and additional means of earning money... so that I do not find myself in this pickle again!


The Projects
 
Here are some of the projects that I hope to submit:

HANDS AND KNEES (indie/psychological thriller): In this look at the subtle horrors of domestic life, a stay-at-home mom is driven to the edge when her mute daughter suddenly claims to be a 17th century witch. As she struggles to prove to her husband that their daughter needs help, it becomes increasingly unclear just which one of them is mad.

 

THE MACHINE WHO LOVED* (indie/psychological thriller): A woman forced into early retirement makes a radical decision to ease her loneliness: she commissions her ideal mate - an artificial life form tailored to her every specification. But things quickly grow complicated when she fails to foresee the pitfalls of owning a sentient being. 

* Winner of the 2009 Screenplay Live! Screenwriting Competition

 

GRAND CANYON (indie/drama/adventure): The true account of how a family's dysfunction reflects the vastness of the landscape itself when they all become separated during a poorly planned backpacking trip.

 

FREEFALL (action/sci-fi): After the first-class passengers use all the escape pods to abandon a fatally damaged spaceship and leave the prisoner-class passengers behind, an incarcerated engineer fights his way through the crippled ship and panicked gangs to save his wife and repair the last remaining escape pod before the ship is destroyed.

 

 


Other Ways You Can Help

Please use the Share Tools and help me get the word out. I really appreciate your support!

Other Ways You Can Help
Please use the Share Tools and help me get the word out. I really appreciate your support!

story:
My Story

It's a relatively simple situation.  I'm trying to raise funds for the first print run of my children's book "Wilson Puck".  It's a story of determination, friendship, and having the courage to follow your dreams and keep trying no matter how many times you fail.  The reading level is at about a 6 or 7 year old level and is a great book to read to kids and eventually have them read it back to you!  It's perfect for any hockey loving family as there aren't that many hockey-related children's books out there.


The story goes something like this:

Wilson Puck is an ordinary nine year old boy that loves hockey, but isn't that great at it.  He's been trying out for his local hockey team for a while now but gets rejected every time.  One day, something happens to Wilson and some new friends rescue him from a tough situation.  These friends also provide him with new equipment that will help Wilson improve. Little does Wilson know though, that the only "power" this new equipment has is the power to give him the confidence to believe in himself.  Through hard work and the support of his new friends, Wilson can finally get a spot on the team.


The Impact

If I don't manage to raise enough money, then quite frankly I can't print the book. 

What We Need & What You Get

I have to AT LEAST hit $400 to print the book and cover costs ($400 because indie go go takes a percentage and it will take some money to send all the rewards out).  If I manage to actually raise more than the $500 goal, then that would be phenomenal and could really help out in covering promotional costs.

The first print run will have 100 copies, 24 pages for each full colored book.  The book has a $5.00 price tag and each contributor will receive a signed copy of the book.  The money I'm trying to raise will fund the print run, bookmarks, coloring pages, pins, and more.  There's some other great rewards too, like some of my graphic novels (signed of course), artwork, sketch cards, art prints, and more.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to donate anything, that's fine too.  If you do like the sound of this fundraiser though, it'd be really awesome if you could at least help spread the word, even if it's just on facebook by providing a link to the fundraiser. Thank you for taking the time to read this! I can't do this without you!

 book.  The book has a $5.00 price tag and each contributor will receive
 a signed copy of the book.  The money I'm trying to raise will fund the
 print run, bookmarks, coloring pages, pins, and more.  There's some other great rewards too, like some of my graphic novels (signed of course), artwork, sketch cards, art prints, and more.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't afford to donate anything, that's fine too.  If you do like the sound of this fundraiser though, it'd be really awesome if you could at least help spread the word, even if it's just on facebook by providing a link to the fundraiser. Thank you for taking the time to read this! I can't do this without you!

story: Anyone who can help as soon as possible. Thanks for the help!

story: I moved to San Francisco from San Antonio on a Greyhound with two bags. I arrived the morning of New Year's Eve 2012. My goal is to be able to procure a studio aparment for myself and stay in the city long enough to promote Bullshit Rodeo, my novel which is forthcoming from Epic Rites Press in 2013. I'm also working on my next novel, Power in the Blood. I receive a small SSI check each month which I have tried to supplement with various odd jobs (cleaning, organizing, editing and such) but I've had no success in finding odd jobs. Any donations would be greatly appreciated. My PayPal address is roxixmas@yahoo.com. Thank you.

story:
Story of My Book

Pendulum: Rebelling Heresy is a magnificent composition of stories about heritage and character.  Pendulum uniquely aligns tales of African descendants in both the Americas and Africa and further engages us into exploiting our own identity conscious norms that result in a silent conformity to these standardized systems designed to egotistically preserve whatever is conceived as the self or for the self. Expressively, Pendulum calls for the oneness of humanity into a non-resisting presence by living in momentum accord between what is known and unknown. Pendulum is for lovers of poetry, history, psychology, philosophy, entrepreneurship, and self-help books about how inter-personal learning can be transformed into equitable global investments.

My name is Bruce Sakindi and I am the author of Pendulum: Rebelling Heresy. This book is focally directed toward the complex reconstruction of the African identity. I wrote this book because the entire world indwells in a destructive loot psychology that Africa is secondary and by default, as so are its descendants. This sentiment is exhaustive, oppressive, and deteriorates humane living when in-groups suppress out-groups. This book invites readers to reflect on their individual role in the cycles of hatred and destructive conformity. It further engages a willingness to evolve within us a consciously humane character that works against collusive obedience.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that beyond the hold of any confining group identity or thought, individuals have within themselves, whatever is necessary to recreate and reconcile with their ever-shifting philosophies about living in a fixed world. By any means necessary.

I want you to see this book as an opportunity to engage with your unconscious forms of egoic and eugenic superiority. I wish for you to escape from the mundane conscious negligence about the oneness in our being. And to learn alongside the heroic revolutionaries and freedom fighters of our times. Pendulum is about awakening and emboldening an inner space within us that is earthshaking, ego killing, and spiritually transforming our human bond into a deeply uniting, truthful, and fruitful being.

In this book, you'll also join in me using language to render distinct aspects of the lessons beyond through poems like:

  • T.e.t.h.e.r.e.d. Canvas "We sink our kin in pieces for peace." 
    • Tethered canvas is about the space where our being is split between the known and the unknown; the pleasurable and the painful. It feels for the broken parts of ourselves that we hate the most. The parts which we cannot show to the world. Most times, it is our inherited trauma from living in our world.  Yet again, being a canvas, though broken, speaks into the content of our unbrokenness. How we can be both full and empty at the same time. This poem is about the way we love our kin. It is also about our desire to what is near and familial. It is about how desperately we hold onto that peace of certainty, so much so that if a piece of it splits, the fear within us, sinks us.
  • Isano Ku Isonga " Being African and human is finding a balance between fantasy and reality"
    • Being is deeply about the worth of our existence. What is our value to ourselves and the world around us? The story of African descendants has had its fair share of compromise, surrender, and renaissance of its worth. And by the order of earthly standard, for worth to be credible, it must meet the prerequesite of validation. This poem is about the bridge between seeking validation of African worth and actually realizing its irrepressible existence. In Kinyarwanda, 'Isano Ku Isonga' translates to 'Oneness at Peak'.
  • Poetry " A foul tool and a fine remedy"
    • How can one thing also be two different things? Much alike Tethered Canvas and Isano Ku Isonga, Poetry illustrates how the known can coexist with the unknown or how the dark can coexist the light. The opportunity that the Pendulum analogy gifts is the telling of an unshaken momentum between two dual and extreme opposites. As such is poetry. It is both a hidden element which requires reading in between the lines message yet it is also enough for the entire message to be drawn out. And even then, entirety or incompletion can also be debated.

​FOR ALL:

You will love this book if you are a student of the universe, passionate about understanding the legacy contribution of the African Continent and its descendants towards global revolutions. Pendulum is for every person shifting into a conscious sharing of pain with the aim to find oneness within vulnerable truths. More specifically, this is for anyone who feels a connection to the African continent, where human life begins. 

Ultimately, I hope that [Pendulum] inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • Who am I worthy to become?
  •  Why is my world also your world? And how do we find a bipartisanship in our being and living?
  • Where are we now, how did we get here, and where are we going?
I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. Coming together and discussing [collusive normalcy, unconscious conformity, and identity reconstruction ] will change us all for the better.

 

The Book - [Pendulum: Rebelling Heresy]


The book is written in 2 Parts....

Part [1] contains the introduction + additional chapters about the mediocre normalcy from which identities are constructed. Pendulum begins by leading an explosive discovery into the Eugenicist Psychology which emphasizes on biological superiority of certain human kinds. As a trajectory to purifying humanity, methods of religious doctrines, scientific human experiments, social, economic, and political motives subsequently result in a traumatic "us against them". This education legacy of passing on human trauma is copped with by a conscious conformity to structures of in-group identities. And by abiding to this collusive obedience, their is an outright righteously justified destruction of out-groups.

Part [2] contains Chapters where readers will learn to read in between the lines of the known and the unknown. This is the part about awakening to our worth and becoming. It leads the pendulum swing of thought into how to coexist together and find balance between the pain and pleasure  through stories about leaders and people we all call rebellious heroes. Conclusively, this part in rebelling heresy invites readers into a momentum of non-resistance within all that exists.

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in [December, 2020]
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this [Fall 2020]

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and some additional sections of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author

Bruce Sakindi is the founder of Grow Up Smart Organization, a Non-Governmental Organization focused on building the potential of vulnerable youth in Rwanda, a Degree holder in Industrial and Organizational Psychology at Barry University in Miami, Florida, an avid world traveler and student of the universe.

He wrote this book because he is curious about listening to the unforgiving discomfort through which we separate our own being as superior to that of others.  He wanted to explore how we embrace extreme and opposite dualities as we indeed meet the choice between life and death at every turn. Choosing the title Pendulum is an imagery of the momentum swing of pendulum, going left to right, mirroring the oneness within opposites. 

In his 22 years on this earth, Bruce has lived in Rwanda, Connecticut, Rome, and Miami. In between the third world, first world, modern worlds, and ancient worlds, he uncovered several thoughts about worth and way of being in our world. Bruce Sakindi is son to a liberation soldier and a genocide survivor of the 1994 Genocide Against the Tutsi. He is also the eldest brother to 2 sisters and 1 brother. He hopes writing Pendulum is an opportunity for others to share their journey of worth and living, as he quotes " between the world and me."

For more information you can connect with Bruce at [syrbrucesakindi@gmail.com] and [Linkedin: Bruce Sakindi, Twitter: Bsakindi, Instagram:syrbrucesakindi].

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use the hashtag [#Pendulum, #Syr] and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,

Bruce Sakindi.

story:
Story of My Book

 

Journey and Struggle: Finding Peace in the Four P’s - Passion, Purpose, Progress and People. After one full career, I realized I defined success by individual accomplishment, a product of my natural drive to work. But recently, I learned to view the marginalized and poverty stricken in our world with a different lens.

With this new view, my thinking was reshaped. So I started to search for new insights, new perspective, a new direction and focus.

My name is Billy Bob Brown, Jr and I am the author of Journey and Struggle: Finding Peace in the Four P’s - Passion, Purpose, Progress and People. I wrote this book as a journal, a collection of stories and ideas to help me chart a new course and destination. It put into words, my restlessness and desire to help address poverty.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover your own peace in the four P’s - passion, purpose, progress and people. In this book, I hope you find the same zeal and excitement I have for technology and a drive to find your life's purpose. Ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool. Let it help you "own who you are" and then step boldly in expressing your unique talents.

In this book, you'll learn about resolve and action: deciding that we must do something. You will learn to:

  • Inspire yourself
  • Inspire a team
  • Find hope for a generation

You will love this book if you are “a helper.” If you see the needs of hurting people all around us, and in every corner of the globe. Wealthy, poor, powerful, and weak - all of us experience inner hurts at various levels. When you see hurting people, if you want to help, then you will love this book.

Journey and Struggle: Finding Peace in the Four P’s - Passion, Purpose, Progress and People is a non-fiction book that speaks to philanthropists and artists. People who look and 'See the marginalized' and who want to 'Take action to make a difference'  for the first time.

 

The Book - Journey and Struggle: Finding Peace in the Four P’s - Passion, Purpose, Progress and People

This book is written in 4 Parts....

Part 1 contains the introduction + additional chapters.   (Purpose) - I lost Everything. What I had considered deep and utter failure was actually the turning point to victory. That event shaped the way I think.

Part 2 contains Chapters 9-15.  (Passion) - Age is only a number. Although Genevieve, a widow in Washington DC was 84, she had hidden in her heart a love for the words of a book by Lautréamont.  She read the book 60 years earlier, and then decided to travel to Uruguay to visit the birthplace of the author.

Part 3 contains Chapters 16-22.  (Progress) - Consider, dream, and seek to understand how we connect. Ying and yang is a drive to improve relationships. They are the seed of innovation.

Part 4 contains chapters 22-26 and the conclusion.  (People) - Be alive!  Technology creators, innovators, and sculptors of science. They see creation in its purest sense and combinations as beautiful.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish next Spring

 

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author

Billy Bob is a co-founder of the tech start-up Zoomiee, a fan engagement platform delivering digital content to mobile devices. He graduated from the United States Air Force Academy, served a career in the military and civil service with the federal government.

I wrote Journey and Struggle: Finding Peace in the Four P’s - Passion, Purpose, Progress and People, to record a collection of stories, on my own journey, to find a destination. It puts words to my inner restlessness and desire to help solve needs in our world.

Despite any achievements, I'm still just a little boy from Texas who loves people and loves life. Before having children, I used to think I was a genius. Then I had kids and realized I was wrong.

For more information you can connect with Billy Bob at b3007713@me.com and @BillyBob7713 on Twitter and Instagram.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #Journeyandstruggle and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Billy Bob Brown, Jr

 When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
And more...
 About the AuthorBilly Bob is a co-founder of the tech start-up Zoomiee, a fan engagement platform delivering digital content to mobile devices. He graduated from the United States Air Force Academy, served a career in the military and civil service with the federal government.I wrote Journey and Struggle: Finding Peace in the Four P’s - Passion, Purpose, Progress and People, to record a collection of stories, on my own journey, to find a destination. It puts words to my inner restlessness and desire to help solve needs in our world.Despite any achievements, I'm still just a little boy from Texas who loves people and loves life. Before having children, I used to think I was a genius. Then I had kids and realized I was wrong.For more information you can connect with Billy Bob at b3007713@me.com and @BillyBob7713 on Twitter and Instagram. Risks & ChallengesThe biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship. Other Ways You Can HelpSome people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #Journeyandstruggle and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.
Thank you so much of all of your love and support!Thanks again,Billy Bob Brown, Jr

story:
Story of My Book

All My Love, From the Trenches surrounds two families, the Perrys and the Harlows, as they face the beginning of World War I. Samuel Perry must find his place in the changing society while Lillian and James Harlow wrestle with duty to their family and the isolation of being left behind.

My name is Reilly Vore, and I am the author of All My Love, From the Trenches. I wrote this book because I deeply wanted to explore a turbulent period in time that brought about a significant amount of change. 

In reading this book, I hope you will see how people of the past are like us. They struggled, fell in love, worked, had fears, had goals, and simply did the best with the world in which they lived. I hope you will find pieces of yourself in them. 

Samuel Perry has spent his childhood on and around the Harlow estate with his sister Nellie close behind. The three Harlow boys, Daniel, James, and John, became his brothers while Lillian Harlow became his dearest friend. But when war threatens a changing world for them all, each one is faced with a difficult choice. 

To be the first to leave or the last?

To follow family duty or their own?

To confess the feelings that have grown since childhood or bury them completely with the men in the trenches?

With letters tying them all together, the questions only grow, and the days and months drag on, and one year turns to the next. The Perry and the Harlow children soon find that none of them are safe from the grip of World War I, and each one is left wondering if they’ll make it out alive. 

If you like historical fiction or period pieces that envelope you in the past, then this book is for you.

All My Love, From the Trenches is a book for lovers of the past, old souls, and those who read to escape to another time and place.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish in August 2021. 

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

About the Author

Reilly Vore is first, and foremost, a curious spirit. With a bachelor's degree in both History and English Literature, she enjoys learning anything about everything. Currently, she works in guest relations in higher education. She greatly appreciates the opportunity to talk to many different kinds of people and hear their stories. 

Her passion lies in the written word and the past, which played greatly into the creation of her first novel. With publishing credit as an editor for the two-volume encyclopedia Conspiracies and Conspiracy Theories in American History, and a poet in Indiana's Best Emerging Poets 2019: An Anthology, she looks forward to finally fulfilling the dream of publishing her first full-length work of fiction.

Reilly enjoys reading anything she can get her hands on and watches any black and white film available, which has granted her the title of "old soul" amongst her dearest friends. You can usually find her with a chai latte in hand, not far from a bookstore, her vinyl records, and her sweet pups.

For more information, you can connect with Reilly Vore at reillyvore@gmail.com, and through the following social media platforms:

Instagram: @reillymvore (https://www.instagram.com/reillymvore/)

Twitter: @reillymvore (https://twitter.com/reillymvore)

Facebook: Reilly Vore: Author (https://www.facebook.com/Reilly-Vore-Author-107...)

LinkedIn: Reilly Vore (https://www.linkedin.com/in/reilly-vore-6806711a7/)

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #AllMyLoveFromTheTrenches or #AMLFTT and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all your love and support!

All My Love,

Reilly Vore

story:
On December 15, 2019, Yolanda C. Rondon will publish her first novel, The Market. The publication of her novel is the culmination of over a year of work and persistence to be a published author. Part of her dream is to host multiple book publication launches in New York City, highlighting the South Bronx, where she was born and raised. This pre-order campaign will support her book launch campaign.

Yolanda wrote The Market to educate readers about Bitcoin and blockchain technology, and how it can benefit disenfranchised communities. She uses Moto to show how the crypto industry began as a rebellion against big business yet turned into one itself through government interference and corrupt business practices.

The Market is a realistic novel exploring cryptocurrency and blockchain technology through its protagonist, Moto, and his creation of bitcoin. It explores the intersection of this innovation with civil liberties as the government’s demand for control over the industry grows with crypto’s rise.

If you are a financial-minded individual looking for an entertaining yet informative look at cryptocurrency, The Market will tell you everything you want to know while keeping you on the edge of your seat as the drama unfolds.

 

About the Author:

Yolanda C. Rondon is a civil rights and national security attorney in Washington DC and New York. In that arena, she’s dedicated her life to protecting civil rights and liberties, notably in communities of color. She studied at Case Western University School of Law and Georgetown University Law Center, where she took up an interest in cryptocurrency regulation and the principles underpinning the creation of Bitcoin. This interest led her to write The Market, a novel depicting the rise of cryptocurrency through a fictional company and its developers.

story:
*Updates and Milestones*

The presale is now closed! If you are still interested in ordering a copy, please email me at renzo.a.c.reyes@gmail.com to gain access to the mailing list where you can receive updates on Do It Anyway's December publication!

-----

 A massive THANK YOU to everyone who preordered already for supporting my dream to publish this book— with your help, we surpassed the final $8,000 stretch goal, meaning we will not only publish Do It Anyway in December AND a hardcover edition a few months thereafter, BUT WE ALSO confirmed the extended revisions period I needed to capture all the right voices in my book!

WHAT'S NEXT: As the campaign wraps up over the next day, I'm excited to announce that 25% of proceeds beyond the $8,000 will go to Management Leadership for Tomorrow, a non-profit organization close to my heart, whose mission to equip and embolden high-achieving individuals from underrepresented communities resonates strongly with the mission of my own book. The remainder will help me to continue spreading the message of Do It Anyway both before and after its publication, through a book tour, speaking engagements, partnerships, and much more!

Once again, thank you so much for all of your incredible support and I look forward to moving into the next step of the journey with you all!

 

Story of My Book

Do It Anyway: Feeling Enough in a World that Tells You You’re Not

Do It Anyway takes us through a journey of self-exploration as we examine our feelings of inadequacy through the lens of our identities. Renzo Reyes navigates us through the unique lived experiences of tenacious individuals that endure encounters with racism, coming out, and immigrating to new countries, to emerge from the strife delivering successful pitches on SharkTank, filming on popular Netflix shows, and starting their own companies from the ground up.

—————

My name is Renzo Reyes and I am the author of Do It Anyway. The idea of this book stemmed out of my desire to understand my own feeling of inadequacy that would often be my biggest obstacle in the pursuit of my ambitions. As a gay Latino immigrant, I found much of what I was already telling myself was being echoed by my classmates, social media, the news, and everywhere else I turned. This same feeling I found reflected by many others whose stories I had the privilege to hear. We all need—and deserve—a solution, which is what inspired me to write Do It Anyway.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how your identities interact with your sense of “enoughness,” or lack thereof. With this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of pride and motivation I’ve recently found from fully embracing my own identities. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you challenge the negative thoughts you hear and the ones you tell yourself so you can freely and passionately pursue your wildest dreams.

In this book, you'll learn about belonging and its counterpart, “othering,” before discovering just how to reprogram your inadequacy into your motivation. You'll read about the compelling stories of everyday individuals, including:

  • How the multiracial descendant of a monumental Supreme Court Justice of color came to terms with the pressure to uphold her family legacy
  • How a young Black female entrepreneur captured the hearts of every single shark on Shark Tank before accepting the investment from the legendary Mark Cuban
  • How a Venezuelan-born gay man of African descent became a recording artist in South Africa after seven years in law under the guidance of his mentor and former boss, the illustrious, Supreme Court Justice Sotomayor

You will enjoy this book if you’re the kind of person who is open to exploring your identity; or if you’ve ever told yourself, there’s no point in trying, they’d never accept me, I couldn’t possibly do that; most importantly, this book is for you, if you’ve ever been told you weren’t good enough, strong enough, smart enough, or just flat out, not enough.


Do It Anyway is a non-fiction book that speaks to people of color, women, LGBTQ+ individuals, among many others, who simply want to pursue their passions free from the effects of the tiring, toxic narrative they hear every day.

 

The Book — Do It Anyway

The book is written in two parts:

Part 1 contains the Introduction + Chapters One through Six. Here, we will dive into what it means to be “othered” and understand how it affects our self-perception, everyday behavior, and critical decisions. You’ll learn just why inadequacy—when left unchecked—can be so dangerous.

Part 2 contains Chapters Seven through Fourteen and the Conclusion. Here, we’ll cover the tried and true methods by which to reprogram your own feeling of inadequacy into one of self-worth and self-empowerment.

 

What I Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book.

Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise my manuscript and publish my book in December 2021
  • The Cover Design of my book (the mock-ups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats)
  • The Copy Editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Winter

    Since I have pre-sold 120 copies total of my book ($5,000), I will be publishing a paperback and ebook in December.

    Since I have pre-sold 150 copies total of my book ($6,000), I will also be publishing a hardcover edition a few months thereafter.

    Finally, when I pre-sell 200 copies total of my book ($8,000), I will be granted an extended revisions period as well, which will help me capture all the right voices in the book so it can make a true difference in the lives of those who struggle with a perpetual sense of inadequacy.


    I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

    • A signed copy of my book with a personal note when I publish
    • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book for your support
    • Early access to the Introduction of my book and select chapters from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback
    • The opportunity to help me select my cover and title
    • An invitation to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process
    • An invitation to my author Q&A series in the months leading up to publication, where you can ask me anything about my experience in writing this book
    • And much more!
     

    About the Author

    Renzo Reyes is a graduate from Georgetown University, with a bachelor’s degree in Marketing and Finance, and serves as a Management Consultant for Public Service at Accenture. He currently resides in Rockville, Maryland with his husband, Kevin, and their son (a precious two-year-old Siberian Husky), Kalel.

    For most of his life, Renzo carried the burdening weight of inadequacy on his shoulders. Growing up as a gay, Latino immigrant, he never felt like he truly belonged anywhere. Into his adulthood, this feeling seemed to only intensify. After twenty-five years, he had enough. In seeking to make sense of this complex, his research led him to conclude that trying to beat it was the wrong play— he’d have to build upon it. Renzo writes Do It Anyway in the hopes of inspiring his readers to re-examine their own feeling of inadequacy and use it to empower them to take on their boldest challenges.

    When he’s not working or writing, you can catch Renzo obsessing over Marvel movies, cooking with his husband, taking Kalel out for a run or hike, spending time with his family, or Latin-dancing with friends.

    For more information, you can connect with Renzo through:

    • Facebook: facebook.com/renzoreyes13/
    • Instagram: instagram.com/renzoareyes/
    • LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/renzo-reyes/
    • Email: renzo.a.c.reyes@gmail.com
    • Calendly (Schedule a Chat): calendly.com/renzoreyes

     

    International Preorders / Preordenes Internacionales

    For international preorders, please send me a private message!

    Para preordenes internacionales, mandame un mensaje privado!

     

    Risks & Challenges

    The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

    The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

     

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

    • Please use the hashtag, #DoItAnyway and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts when you share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, and other platforms with your friends, family, and network.

    Thank you so much for your support!

    Renzo Reyes

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book for your support
Early access to the Introduction of my book and select chapters from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback
The opportunity to help me select my cover and title
An invitation to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process
An invitation to my author Q&A series in the months leading up to publication, where you can ask me anything about my experience in writing this book
And much more!


 
About the Author
Renzo Reyes is a graduate from Georgetown University, with a bachelor’s degree in Marketing and Finance, and serves as a Management Consultant for Public Service at Accenture. He currently resides in Rockville, Maryland with his husband, Kevin, and their son (a precious two-year-old Siberian Husky), Kalel.For most of his life, Renzo carried the burdening weight of inadequacy on his shoulders. Growing up as a gay, Latino immigrant, he never felt like he truly belonged anywhere. Into his adulthood, this feeling seemed to only intensify. After twenty-five years, he had enough. In seeking to make sense of this complex, his research led him to conclude that trying to beat it was the wrong play— he’d have to build upon it. Renzo writes Do It Anyway in the hopes of inspiring his readers to re-examine their own feeling of inadequacy and use it to empower them to take on their boldest challenges.When he’s not working or writing, you can catch Renzo obsessing over Marvel movies, cooking with his husband, taking Kalel out for a run or hike, spending time with his family, or Latin-dancing with friends.
For more information, you can connect with Renzo through:

Facebook: facebook.com/renzoreyes13/

Instagram: instagram.com/renzoareyes/

LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/renzo-reyes/

Email: renzo.a.c.reyes@gmail.com

Calendly (Schedule a Chat): calendly.com/renzoreyes


 
International Preorders / Preordenes Internacionales
For international preorders, please send me a private message!
Para preordenes internacionales, mandame un mensaje privado!
 

Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please use the hashtag, #DoItAnyway and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts when you share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, and other platforms with your friends, family, and network.

Thank you so much for your support!Renzo Reyes

story:
Story of My Book

New Light is a tale of young Mystics forced into perilous danger on their first day of public service. With their new titles moving from a Mage to a Mystic (and hopefully one day recognized as a sorcerer) these Mystics will have to duel with an enraged anarchistic Mage.

My name is Warren Dotson and I am the author of New Light. I wrote this book because I didn’t have any reason not to. I also just wanted to show a world could exist where Magic users weren’t all the same-looking person. Anyone in the world of New Light can use Magic. There are no chosen ones. There are no prophecies. It is simply a world where Magic and Science intersect. A world where every race and ethnicity is capable of being the most powerful Mage in existence.

I want this book to inspire someone. Hopefully it can give the go ahead to make something beautiful from the world’s description or get going to do work when they see Mystics in action. I want it to make you jump up and see the beauty of Mysticism with a new twist. It’s not You’ll find that magic is not limited and science is magical.
 

Mystian is the fantastic world where Magic and Scientific innovation have fused to create a nearly perfect society. However to make sure order is kept between those who use magic and those who prefer science, there are certain laws and rules that need to be enforced. Regular non magic users use police, EMS, and so on but Mages use the Mystics. Mystics are a level above mages with the responsibility to keep Mystian safe. Because of their high position and noble charge they have the special privilege to explore and work on certain tasks. They are given the jurisdiction to explore the many cities, towns, and villages in Mystian, whilst giving the people in those areas assistance.

Whether it be teaching magic, controlling unrest, or even a simple lookout for a missing pet, Mystics keep everything on the up and up. Med, Cyset, Dixie, Jacks, Shade, and Scratch are the focus of this tale. They are newly minted Mystics. Young, eager, and somewhat naive, they all want to explore. Med will be seeing the rest of the world for the first time after spending her whole life working at home and in the adjacent areas. Cyset the protege of Solaria, the head sorceress is looking to be a true Mystic. His friend Jacks is becoming a mystic to help people and get to know people before moving onto his family legacy. Dixie, on the other hand is working as a newbie with little magical experience. Shade and Scratch have been thrust into the world of being a Mystic and have varying ideas of it. Shade being a little overwhelmed and Scratch being incredibly curious. On their first day, they find out how quickly the job of being a Mystic can kick off.

 

You will love this book if you want to see fantasy expanded, POC characters in action, and the depths of Science Fiction explored.

New Light speaks to people of color and fantasy/sci-fi fans who want to grapple with exploring the world and trying new things and meeting expectations.

Ultimately, I hope that New Light inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • What does exploration give you?
  • What happens when the expectations placed on someone are not clearly stated?
  • How do people of varying backgrounds work together to help a world they are just starting to understand?
I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I want to bring excitement to the idea of going somewhere new and doing what’s right, simply because you can.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring 2021.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!
 

About the Author

Warren Dotson is a soon-to-be Emerson College graduate. He was born in Birmingham, Alabama, raised in Greenville, Mississippi and now resides in Boston, Massachusetts. Warren always had a spirit for being creative. He was always great at writing creatively thus he chose to major in Creative Writing. He’s also had the pleasure of getting to meet Scott McCloud.

Warren wrote New Light to create a new narrative in magic, one that includes POC Mages. Due to a feeling that the genre was lacking in Mages that reflected him and his friends. He also wanted to give POCs a chance to see themselves as something other than the background characters in magical narratives.

Warren is not just an author but also an animator. His animation was originally 3D animation but he then moved to 2D animation later in life. He started due to the fact that as a child he would say that all animated shows are better than live-action ones.

For more information, you can connect with Warren Dotson at warrendotson1@gmail.com, at Twitter @warrendot50 and Instagram @warren_dotson_the_author.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #newlight and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Warren Dotson

story:
Da molto tempo desidero analizzare i piccoli dettagli che rendono la vita di un miliardario così interessante. Per questo motivo ho deciso di passare un anno a Parigi (il 2015 mi sembra l'anno perfetto: non ci sono Mondiali, Europei e Olimpiadi).

Per integrarmi meglio con le persone che andrò a studiare, ho deciso di acquistare un appartamentino (questo), in una delle zone che preferisco: Saint Germain de Près. Con una breve passeggiata (o un giretto sui vélib) potrò scattarmi svariate foto assieme ai gargoyle di Notre Dame e inviarvele, miei cari sostenitori. Quindi ecco: 12milioni e 600mila euro se ne andranno per la casa. Facciamo 13, che mi piace lasciare una mancia all'agente. Se devo studiare i miliardari devo fingere di essere abbastanza ricco ed entrare ai loro party o organizzarme di miei: la casa si presta molto. Ricco, ma senza esagerare, perché voglio sempre rimanere me stesso.

Ogni giorno andrò a mangiare nei ristoranti più costosi, mi farò costruire un bidet alimentato solo ad Evian e realizzerò un piccolo sogno tamarro: comprarmi questa (e ciao altri 240mila euro). 

Senza affrontare nel dettaglio le spese normali che una persona come me dovrà sostenere in questa avventura (abbigliamento, scooter, bici, monopattino, altre due o tre auto più sobrie, ogni tipo di console e qualsiasi videogioco, tecnologia varia a caso, due o tre mac, sei ipad, ventidue iphone, otto telefoni top di gamma con android, un nokia con windows per guardarlo e ridere, un attaccante del PSG), quantificate in circa ulteriori 35 milioni di euro, conto di avere a disposizione 50 milioni di euro per tutte le altre spese (il cibo, ad esempio) che sosterrò per sopravvivere 365 giorni a Parigi. Sono più o meno 137mila euro al giorno per fare tutto ciò che mi passa per la testa. Bello. no? Mi invidiate? Dovreste.

Ma dovrò fare qualcosa anche per voi, no? E allora, cari miei amici sostenitori, vi prometto che ogni giorno scriverò qualche tweet per raccontarvi quanto sia divertente svegliarsi alle 11, andare sul tetto del palazzo, nudo, guardando il panorama con un buon caffè in mano e un libro di carta (importante: deve essere di carta, e magari sapere anche di carta) nell'altra. Estate o inverno, non importa. L'importante è farlo. Poi scenderò in soggiorno e, dopo aver perso mezz'ora per decidere su quale mac scrivere tre righe per il libro che probabilmente non pubblicherò mai, mi alzerò, mi vestirò con qualcosa di costosissimo ma sobrio e uscirò per passeggiare guardandomi attorno. Magari vi invierò anche una cartolina. Più probabilmente non lo farò. Avrò qualcuno che lo farà per me. Con 137mila euro al giorno potrò permettermi uno schiavo addetto all'invio delle cartoline. Probabilmente gli detterò anche i tweet e sarà lui a fotografarmi nelle 334 foto che metterò su Instagram in quei 365 giorni. 

Ovviamente potrete essere miei ospiti quando e quanto vorrete. Non più di due alla volta, ovviamente. E non più di 5 giorni a testa. Il quanto era una balla. Anche il quando: non nei weekend e non dal 15 al 23 maggio. Spero sia chiaro che non dormirete nella mia dimora: vi affitterò una stanza all'Hotel in cui soggiornarono Diana e Dodi, dicono sia molto bello. Dovrete pagarvelo, ma potrete poi dire in giro di essere miei amici. Vi metterò nei ringraziamenti del libro. Purtroppo non li leggerà nessuno. 

Voglio che questa esperienza sia positiva anche per le persone a me vicine, quindi porterò con me non solo la mia ragazza, ma anche i miei gatti, Rosso e Kishka. Questi due teneri e simpatici felini saranno fondamentali in questo progetto: saranno infatti loro a pubblicare un libro con le loro memorie di questa esperienza. Hanno già in mente il titolo: "Siamo due gatti e abbiamo una vita migliore della tua. E siamo pure senza denti". 

Le ricompense che vi ho promesso saranno vostre solo se raggiungerò il budget richiesto di 100milioni di euro. 

Nel caso ricevessi un importo inferiore, intascherò comunque i vostri soldi (visto che c'è questa possibilità) e tutto il ricavato (tutto tutto tutto, tranne ovviamente le commissioni di Indiegogo) sarà devoluto in beneficenza all'Airc. 

Ovviamente darò svariate prove per dimostrare tale donazione.

Versate, stolti.
