Spero sia chiaro che non dormirete nella mia dimora: vi affitterò una stanza all'Hotel in cui soggiornarono Diana e Dodi, dicono sia molto bello. Dovrete pagarvelo, ma potrete poi dire in giro di essere miei amici. Vi metterò nei ringraziamenti del libro. Purtroppo non li leggerà nessuno. Voglio che questa esperienza sia positiva anche per le persone a me vicine, quindi porterò con me non solo la mia ragazza, ma anche i miei gatti, Rosso e Kishka. Questi due teneri e simpatici felini saranno fondamentali in questo progetto: saranno infatti loro a pubblicare un libro con le loro memorie di questa esperienza. Hanno già in mente il titolo: "Siamo due gatti e abbiamo una vita migliore della tua. E siamo pure senza denti". Le ricompense che vi ho promesso saranno vostre solo se raggiungerò il budget richiesto di 100milioni di euro. Nel caso ricevessi un importo inferiore, intascherò comunque i vostri soldi (visto che c'è questa possibilità) e tutto il ricavato (tutto tutto tutto, tranne ovviamente le commissioni di Indiegogo) sarà devoluto in beneficenza all'Airc. Ovviamente darò svariate prove per dimostrare tale donazione.Versate, stolti.

story:
Synopsis:

Proof of Our Resolve is a novel about a Texas Army National Guard infantry platoon deployed to Afghanistan. This books attempts to convey some of the experiences of soldiers serving in Afghanistan through a fictional platform. The characters are representative of and much like the Soldiers and Marines one would find in a combat unit. The story's environment and tactical operations are as close to real as possible.

About This Project: Proof of Our Resolve:

As part of the process of healing and helping our Veterans, Tactical 16 is honored to be working with Chris Hernandez to release his novel, Proof of Our Resolve, a story based on the author's personal experiences as a deployed Texas National Guard soldier in Afghanistan. By participating in success of this Indiegogo campaign - you will be providing the funding for the inaugural print run of paperback copies and ISBN registration of Proof of Our Resolve.

Any Indiegogo funding above and beyond what is needed for the initial publishing will go to help Chris Hernandez with travel expenses to book signings, marketing efforts, as well as future printed editions of this particular story.

All backer levels have shipping within the U.S.A. included.
Please add $9 for Canadian shipping, and $18 for International shipping.

About Tactical 16:

The benefits provided in the different Indiegogo sponsorship levels are from the working relationship of Chris Hernandez with Tactical 16 - a veteran owned & operated company based in Colorado Springs, CO.  You will not only be supporting the publishing of this incredible story - but for $10 and up you will receive some unique branded items from Tactical 16!

Tactical 16 was featured on Fox News for their growing effort to help Veteran authors begin their publishing journey.  Watch the video here:
http://video.foxnews.com/v/1577175389001/new-book-examines-life-of-an-american-soldier

Tactical 16 believes strongly in the healing power of writing, and is currently focusing its attention on gathering stories - full-length books, short stories, and poetry - of true American Heroes and getting those writings out to the world.

 

For those of you who are curious about the company name - there are separate parts, “Tactical” and “16”.  Each has a different meaning.

“Tactical” refers to the Armed Forces, Police, Fire, and Rescue communities or any group who loves, believes in, and supports Our Country.

The “16” represents the number of acres of the World Trade Center complex that were destroyed on that harrowing day of September 11, 2001.  That day will be forever engrained in the memories of many generations of Americans.

That day is also a reminder of the resolve of this Country’s People and the courage, dedication, honor, and integrity of our Armed Forces, Police, Fire, and Rescue communities.  Without Americans willing to risk their lives to defend and protect Our Country, we would not have the opportunities we have before us today.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're into supporting our Country's Veterans, like what you've read so far about Chris Hernandez's project, and what Tactical 16 is doing, then you can help even by sharing this fundraiser with your friends! We appreciate everyone's support in getting the stories of our Veterans out for the world to read!

Any Indiegogo funding above and beyond what is needed for the initial publishing will go to help Chris Hernandez with travel expenses to book signings, marketing efforts, as well as future printed editions of this particular story.
All backer levels have shipping within the U.S.A. included.Please add $9 for Canadian shipping, and $18 for International shipping.

About Tactical 16:
The benefits provided in the different Indiegogo sponsorship levels are from the working relationship of Chris Hernandez with Tactical 16 - a veteran owned & operated company based in Colorado Springs, CO.  You will not only be supporting the publishing of this incredible story - but for $10 and up you will receive some unique branded items from Tactical 16!
Tactical 16 was featured on Fox News for their growing effort to help Veteran authors begin their publishing journey.  Watch the video here:http://video.foxnews.com/v/1577175389001/new-book-examines-life-of-an-american-soldier
Tactical 16 believes strongly in the healing power of writing, and is currently focusing its attention on gathering stories - full-length books, short stories, and poetry - of true American Heroes and getting those writings out to the world.

 


For those of you who are curious about the company name - there are separate parts, “Tactical” and “16”.  Each has a different meaning.
“Tactical” refers to the Armed Forces, Police, Fire, and Rescue communities or any group who loves, believes in, and supports Our Country.
The “16” represents the number of acres of the World Trade Center complex that were destroyed on that harrowing day of September 11, 2001.  That day will be forever engrained in the memories of many generations of Americans.
That day is also a reminder of the resolve of this Country’s People and the courage, dedication, honor, and integrity of our Armed Forces, Police, Fire, and Rescue communities.  Without Americans willing to risk their lives to defend and protect Our Country, we would not have the opportunities we have before us today.


Other Ways You Can Help
If you're into supporting our Country's Veterans, like what you've read so far about Chris Hernandez's project, and what Tactical 16 is doing, then you can help even by sharing this fundraiser with your friends! We appreciate everyone's support in getting the stories of our Veterans out for the world to read!

story:
About the Writers

Diana Rose Dawson and Angela Malavolti are sisters with a common passion: using their God-given talent of writing to positively impact the world.  While Diana accomplishes this through songwriting, Angela authors unique and powerful children’s books.      

Diana has been singing and writing songs for over ten years, and some of her earlier work is showcased on her debut and sophomore albums, Diana Rose(2006) and You're Enough(2009).  While both albums reflect Diana's spunky personality and positive nature, neither is classified as “Christian.”   Diana writes from life experience; always from the heart.  The events of her life since 2009 have caused her to rely very heavily upon God, resulting in a powerful collection of Christian/worship songs.  “No Conditions” will prove to be her most authentic, inspirational album to date.  Diana is humbled and overjoyed to allow God to use her life-inspired music as a vehicle to bless the lives of others. 

Angela has always been an author by nature, but her first official publication came to fruition in 2011 with her book, “You Are a Twisting Tornado.” “Universe of You” and “Santa’s Wardrobe” followed in 2012.  Her books are works of beautifully illustrated poetry.  Her message is always positive and educational; her inspiration, most often, her children.  She now edits and publishes children’s books for other talented authors with her own publishing company in Rockford, IL, Jungle Wagon Press.

These sisters share a similar passion for glorifying God through their writing.  When life delivers a blessing or an obstacle, you can rest assured these women are writing about it!  One such event occurred in September of 2010, which pierced the hearts and lives of their entire family.   Their sister-in-law, Jennifer Lynn Murphy, died at the young age of 31, after losing a life-long battle with Cystic Fibrosis. 

JENNIFER LIVED A LIFE OF JOY.   She never took life for granted.  She never held a grudge.  Her glass was always half full, amidst the toughest of trials. She taught her family not only how to live joyfully, but how to die with grace and true acceptance of God's will.  She left behind a loving husband, Dan, and beautiful twin baby girls, Mady and Gaby. 

Jennifer's influence inspired some incredibly poignant writing.  Diana's song "When It's My Time" and Angela's book “Heaven,” are direct results of Jennifer’s life and death. 

An excerpt from "Heaven:"

 

I say a prayer for you

With every single breath you take.

I lay here with you through the night

‘Till morning when you wake.

 

I know that you can’t see me-

But I’m here; you must believe.

My body can’t stay with you

But my love will never leave.

© Angela Malavolti, 2012.  All rights reserved.

 

Help us honor Jennifer.  Help the world heal with their own loss by making these projects a reality. 

10% of all campaign proceeds will be donated to the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation so that other families won’t have to experience untimely loss as a result of this dreadful disease. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

If you find our story inspiring and are interested in getting more involved, please read on. Below is a breakdown of exactly how much funding we are going to need and why. We want to be as transparent about our needs as possible, in order to instill in you a great level of trust in us and in our work.

 

$21,000 will be broken down into the following:

$840 will be paid to Indiegogo for use of their site.

$2100 will automatically be given to the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation.

$7,500 will be used to fully illustrate, publish, and print a first run of Angela Malavolti's hardcover children’s book, “Heaven.”

$5,000 will be used to cover the cost of Diana's recording time in Nashville. This amount will secure flights to and from Nashville, as well as the recording time and production of 3/4 of the songs on the album.

$3,000 will be used to cover the recording and production of the remaining songs on Diana's album. This portion will take place in the Twin Cities area.

$2560 will cover artwork and distribution of Diana's album, as well as the upfront promotional expenses incurred for this project. 

In the event that we don't reach our goal of $21,000, Indiegogo will take a larger cut of our earnings: they will take 9% of whatever monies we raise as opposed to the 4% that is charged if our goal is reached. If we exceed our goal with your help, you can rest assured that the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation will still get 10% of whatever amount we do raise! 

What’s In It for YOU?

Remember, you're dealing with some extremely creative women, so the perks being offered are very reflective of their unique talents. Aside from the obvious perks you would expect, such as signed copies of Diana's CD and Angela's book upon their completion, there are some perks that are just over the top! Make sure to check out the perks section to the right of your screen for the full description of each specific perk offered!

 

The Impact 

The world needs Jesus.  We need survival tools to navigate through the waters of life. 

“No Conditions” and “Heaven” will serve as powerful navigational tools in your life and the lives of your loved ones.  We all require soul-inspired music to move our spirits to a higher calling.  When our children experience inevitable loss, they will need a God-centered, uplifting explanation to help them cope, understand, and imagine Heaven. 

WE WANT TO BLESS YOU with our gifts but we need your help to bring these projects to fruition!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If your budget is just too tight to give financially today, you can still be a tremendous blessing to us!

PRAY! The prayers of the righteous are very powerful.  We believe that if God wills these projects, he will breathe life into them.  But he loves to hear his people cry out for his help.  Pray for us and our endeavors, and we will be eternally grateful!

SHARE! If you are moved by this story, please pass it along by word of mouth, email, Facebook, etc…Please use the Indiegogo SHARE tools on this site to support us!

Thank you for taking time to listen to our story.

 

Angels around you…

~Diana Rose Dawson & Angela Malavolti

story:
Alright everybody, what is this crap? I'll tell you what it is. It's a book. Kind of. Here's a story:

In high school I wrote a "book" for a writing challenge. Knowing full well that I couldn't write so many quality words so fast, I decided to delibrately write the worst novel of all time. But here's the problem- I fell in love with it. Seriously. It's one of the funniest books I've read, and it always gives me a laugh when I re-read it. And now I'd like to publish it to bring the laughs to everyone. Will you help me bring the joy of literature to the world? Also, will you help me publish this book?

So.... What's it about?

 The Perplexing Journey of Frank is about an old man named Frank who loves hot dogs. Because of his undying love of this meat-based dish, he ends up traveling the world and traveling time to save himself, his love interest, and of course, his treasured hot dogs. It's a 4-in-1 type of book, so you essetially get 4 books for the price of one!

The books:

Book 1- Marge

Book 2- Edmantis

Book 3- The Hot Dog

Book 4- Frank

The nitty gritties

Break it down for folks in more detail:

So let's cut to the chase- money. How much do I need? Ideally, $3,000 because that would buy me a fantastic publishing package that would pretty much publish the book for me, because let's be honest, I'm just some middle-class white male that knows nothing about publishing. And very little about writing. But just wait until you read this....

Anyway, what do you get? Perks. That's right, perks. 

Go ahead and view that perks list. Looks nice, right? Yes, yes they do. And the coolest thing is- YOU can earn them! Yes, you!!

And worst case scenario and I DON'T get funded copletely, I'll save the money and wait until I can save enough of my own cash to publish. But that's not cool, dude.

 

How you make a difference

Well, you do. Trust me. To be honest, I've wanted to publish this thing for years. It's been on my new year's resolutions list since I wrote it. So will you help me out? 

And if you really can't donate

That's cool, I totally get it. I do. Because if I didn't, I could afford to publish this thing myself, eh? Anyway, you can still help out! Spread the word to your family, friends, dog, dog's friends, mailman, neighors, everyone! 

 

STILL NOT CONVINCED?

Read the first ten chapters of the book for free at:

http://frankjourney.blogspot.com/

Thank you.

What is Berfrois?

Berfrois is a literary-intellectual online magazine featuring essays, poems and curiosities. It is published daily.

What We Need

We need $25,000 of funding to continue publication for another year.

The Results

Berfrois will remain publicly funded and free of advertisements.

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends, tell your family, tell one and all. Ta muchly.

story:
Who We Are & What We'll Do


SPOKE magazine is a new publication dedicated to cycling in Philadelphia. As a free print quarterly, SPOKE will take a deep look at the politics, infrastructure and culture of cycling as it affects ordinary Philadelphians who bike -- whether they do so for work, play, commuting or exercise.

We believe that the bicycle’s growing popularity will change the face of our city. Yet you wouldn’t know it by reading mainstream newspapers, magazines and websites. There has been a lack of focused, informed reporting about cycling issues, with journalists resorting to tired cliches or casting bike culture as unaccepting or too intensive for newcomers. Cycling can’t afford such a narrow definition. In the 21st century, one of the best alternatives to the automobile should not be consigned to the fringe.

That’s the purpose of SPOKE magazine -- to give cycling in Philadelphia the thoughtful, in-depth coverage it deserves. Our team is currently in the process of editing an impressive series of stories that address city bike laws, infrastructure spending, cycling education, women’s bike gear and more, as well as designing the sort of magazine that you would want to have on display in your apartment. 


What We Need & What You Get


We have the stories, writers, photographers, illustrators, editors and designers. What we need now is your contribution. To cover the costs of printing our first issue and paying our talented crop of local freelancers, our all-volunteer team will need to raise $7,000 by December 19.

By contributing to SPOKE, you will help a new and necessary voice be heard in Philadelphia. What’s more, you will earn rewards from Philly’s cycling and sustainability communities. We have a number of sponsors on board who are just as dedicated to the city's cyclists as we are. They have agreed to reward our Indiegogo contributors with perks such as credit at a local CSA, a week's membership at a local coworking space, and free tickets to our launch party on January 23.

Every penny we earn from this campaign will go back into operating costs for SPOKE magazine. (No one on our staff will see a personal financial gain.) If we aren't able to reach our goal to print 7,500 copies of Issue One, we will use the funds raised to pay our contributors for their efforts and reduce the number of copies printed.


The Impact


Issue One is essentially ready to print. Here are some of the stories you can look forward to if we reach our goal:

  • How the city pays for bicycle infrastructure, by local urbanist and writer Jon Geeting

  • Inside the world of how parents are teaching their kids to bike on the streets, by SPOKE co-founder Alex Vuocolo

  • How traffic laws affect the safety of everyday cyclists, by local freelancer Andrew Zaleski

  • A wide look at how Philadelphians tackle bike theft, also by Zaleski

  • Commentary on the lack of decent bike clothes for women, by cycling advocate and writer Alex Baca

  • A roundtable discussion with bike professionals, by local reporter Cassie Owens

  • An annotated list of Philadelphia bike laws, by writer and SPOKE co-founder Katie Bohri

We will also feature illustrations by Tim Pacific, photography by Justin Durner and cover art by local artist Hawk Krall.


Risks & Challenges


Launching a print publication in 2014 may seem like a fool’s errand. Yet we feel that a real, hold-it-in-your-hands magazine, distributed for free in bike shops, coffee shops and bars around the city, is the best way to reach a wide readership in the Philadelphia area. The only drawback? It costs money to print the sort of magazine we want -- that is, a high-quality, design-forward, sturdy addition to your bookcase or coffee table. And don’t worry: Every story printed in the magazine will also go up on our website, www.spokemag.bike, in the months following its release.


Other Ways You Can Help


Can't donate? You can still help! Spread the word and tell your friends, neighbors, coworkers and fellow cyclists about SPOKE magazine. Get savvy online -- follow us, retweet us, and tag us on Twitter and Instagram under the handle @spoke_mag. Join the conversation and use #inmybikelane to show us what's in your bike lane.

If you are interested in advertising with us or partnering on future events, please email hillaryowickline@gmail.com.

story:
A CEREMONY TO RENEW THE WORLD

December 21st 2012, marks the end of of the Mayan calendar's 5,125-year ‘Thirteen Baktun’ cycle. On this date, Peace 2012 and an alliance of many other organizations will gather globally in a unified ‘Moment of Peace’.

These events will bring together spiritual leaders and indigenous elders from many traditions to be part of a 'Universal Declaration of Peace', a multicultural statement that incorporates affirmations of peace from all the world's great spiritual traditions and cultures. The Declaration will then lead into a simple moment of silence, a universal moment of reflection that anyone and everyone can participate in globally.

The purpose of this campaign is to create a global ceremony to give birth to the Sixth Sun on December 21st 2012. This announces the beginning of new World Age and the renewal and transformation of humanity.

A GLOBAL MOMENT OF PEACE

Through a globally synchronized ‘Moment of Peace’ at the exact point of Solstice at 11:11 UT, we will make a worldwide call for the protection of all Sacred Sites and World Heritage Sites. This will be anchored with ceremonies and meditations at a number of these sites, inlcuding Stonehenge, Teotihuacan, Uxmal, The Pyramids of Giza, Chichen Itza, Lake Titicaca and many other locations.

Peace 2012 provides a simple, yet effective, template that invites people from all cultures to celebrate this singular moment in time, in any way that they choose. Events of any size and scale can be synchronized around the Peace 2012 'Moment of Peace'.

RECLAIMING CEREMONY AND SACRED SITES

Since ancient times people from all over the globe have gathered at sacred sites to honor their ancestors and thank the Earth in sacred ceremony. In this way, many indigenous people believe, stability and harmony are maintained on Earth. Sacred sites are places of power and importance because of their geographic relevance, or because temples and sanctuaries have been built as places to hold ceremony and prayer. Many sacred sites are recognized today as cultural heritage sites by UNESCO for their historical and cultural importance.

December 21st is an opportunity for all these cultures to join together in one unique moment in time. An important goal of Peace2012 is to support this and provide assistance in accessing these World Heritage sites for peaceful assembly and worship at this time.


THE CAMPAIGN:

The focus of this campaign is to create a global ceremony to give birth to the Sixth Sun, This announces the beginning of new World Age and the renewal and transformation of  humanity as planetary caretakers. Through a worldwide synchronized  “Moment of Peace”, at the exact point of Solstice, we will collectively focus our intentions at a single moment globally. At the same time, we recognize the underlying unity of humanity and all of the diverse lineages that make up the indigenous peoples of Earth. We will call for the protection of Sacred Sites and World Heritage Sites worldwide and universal access for ceremony and spiritual practise at these sites.

Among others, celebrations will take place in:

Teotihuacán, Mexico;
Palenque, Mexico ;
Chichen Itza, Mexico,
Uxmal, Mexico
Tikal, Guatemala;
Island of the Sun, Bolivia
Stonehenge, England,
Uluru, Australia,  
Mount Fuji in Japan 

Many of these are considered World Heritage sites for the UNESCO.

WHAT YOU CAN DO TO HELP MAKE THIS HAPPEN:

DONATE!

The funds raised from this campaign will support the preparations and planning to  allow elders and leaders access to their heritage sites, as well as website development and campaign organization towards creating accompanying worldwide internet broadcast . This is a not for profit event.

VOLUNTEER!

We are looking for this to be a volunteer-led event and welcome the input, presence and energy of those who would like to join us for this unique moment in time and contribute to it’s co-creation. We are also looking for volunteers who can help around the world, by spreading the word, by making connections and by supporting us both energetically and financially, Please get involved!
story_txt:
A CEREMONY TO RENEW THE WORLD
December 21st 2012, marks the end of of the Mayan calendar's 5,125-year ‘Thirteen Baktun’ cycle. On this date, Peace 2012 and an alliance of many other organizations will gather globally in a unified ‘Moment of Peace’.
These events will bring together spiritual leaders and indigenous elders from many traditions to be part of a 'Universal Declaration of Peace', a multicultural statement that incorporates affirmations of peace from all the world's great spiritual traditions and cultures. The Declaration will then lead into a simple moment of silence, a universal moment of reflection that anyone and everyone can participate in globally.
The purpose of this campaign is to create a global ceremony to give birth to the Sixth Sun on December 21st 2012. This announces the beginning of new World Age and the renewal and transformation of humanity.
A GLOBAL MOMENT OF PEACE
Through a globally synchronized ‘Moment of Peace’ at the exact point of Solstice at 11:11 UT, we will make a worldwide call for the protection of all Sacred Sites and World Heritage Sites. This will be anchored with ceremonies and meditations at a number of these sites, inlcuding Stonehenge, Teotihuacan, Uxmal, The Pyramids of Giza, Chichen Itza, Lake Titicaca and many other locations.
Peace 2012 provides a simple, yet effective, template that invites people from all cultures to celebrate this singular moment in time, in any way that they choose. Events of any size and scale can be synchronized around the Peace 2012 'Moment of Peace'.
RECLAIMING CEREMONY AND SACRED SITES
Since ancient times people from all over the globe have gathered at sacred sites to honor their ancestors and thank the Earth in sacred ceremony. In this way, many indigenous people believe, stability and harmony are maintained on Earth. Sacred sites are places of power and importance because of their geographic relevance, or because temples and sanctuaries have been built as places to hold ceremony and prayer. Many sacred sites are recognized today as cultural heritage sites by UNESCO for their historical and cultural importance.
December 21st is an opportunity for all these cultures to join together in one unique moment in time. An important goal of Peace2012 is to support this and provide assistance in accessing these World Heritage sites for peaceful assembly and worship at this time.

THE CAMPAIGN:
The focus of this campaign is to create a global ceremony to give birth to the Sixth Sun, This announces the beginning of new World Age and the renewal and transformation of  humanity as planetary caretakers. Through a worldwide synchronized  “Moment of Peace”, at the exact point of Solstice, we will collectively focus our intentions at a single moment globally. At the same time, we recognize the underlying unity of humanity and all of the diverse lineages that make up the indigenous peoples of Earth. We will call for the protection of Sacred Sites and World Heritage Sites worldwide and universal access for ceremony and spiritual practise at these sites.
Among others, celebrations will take place in:
Teotihuacán, Mexico;Palenque, Mexico ;Chichen Itza, Mexico,Uxmal, MexicoTikal, Guatemala;Island of the Sun, BoliviaStonehenge, England,Uluru, Australia,  Mount Fuji in Japan 
Many of these are considered World Heritage sites for the UNESCO.
WHAT YOU CAN DO TO HELP MAKE THIS HAPPEN:
DONATE!
The funds raised from this campaign will support the preparations and planning to  allow elders and leaders access to their heritage sites, as well as website development and campaign organization towards creating accompanying worldwide internet broadcast . This is a not for profit event.
VOLUNTEER!
We are looking for this to be a volunteer-led event and welcome the input, presence and energy of those who would like to join us for this unique moment in time and contribute to it’s co-creation. We are also looking for volunteers who can help around the world, by spreading the word, by making connections and by supporting us both energetically and financially, Please get involved!

story:
Your Words Matter is a literary and multimedia arts project founded in 2009. The project puts professional writers in classrooms as writers-in-residence and publishes anthologies of student work.

This year Your Words Matter has held two 12-week residencies, working with students from Parkview and Ridgeline Alternative High Schools in Nampa, Idaho. The residencies at each school are wrapping up, and this dedicated and talented group of young writers will, with the help of your tax-deductible donation, be published in the end-of-the-year anthology.

We believe that each student’s writing efforts deserve to be recognized by inclusion in a professionally published book. All of our residencies include publication as an integral part of the writing experience. Each student is responsible for revising and polishing at least one poem or story for the program-wide anthology. The anthology helps each student in each residency realize he or she is part of a larger ongoing program of writing and reading. 

Teachers and students have been working hard to complete their pieces to submit for the fourth annual publication of the anthology. Much of the time spent editing, proofing and formatting the final galley proof will happen over the next month as we prepare the finished revision for publication. 

The anthology will be published in May, and each residency student, teacher and school library will receive the perfect bound book.

The Campaign
We're asking you to help fund the publication of the anthology with your tax-deductible donations. The printing and shipping costs alone are $500.  

Your donation will support the publication of student work and the continuation of the program's writing residencies and workshops that develop and support students’ imaginative writing of poetry, fiction and non-fiction. Through weekly or daily instruction, we encourage students to challenge themselves to live deliberately and to create and write their stories in words that matter.

story:
Short Summary

Eric O'Rear.  Writer extraordinaire.  Passionate about people, and hopeless adrenaline junkie.  My dreams stretch from the core of the Earth to distant, glittering galaxies.  I am trying to raise money to move to Yangshuo, China this June--and from there wherever the wind and imagination takes me.  I want to capture in words what adventure means on the other side of the world.  This is an exercise in turning dreams to reality, and like most things, is better done with the support of the tribe.  

With your help, whatever the amount, my goal of spreading love, light, and myriad tales of adventure through my writing is a definite possibility.  China offers some of the richest and most diverse history, geography, and culture available on the planet.  I want to witness firsthand the adventures China has to offer.  Help me be a vehicle for these stories.

What I Need & What You Get

I am asking for $5,000.00.  This is to help with the costs of travel, food, and a warm place to rest my head.  With this help I will be able to be mobile, meeting hundreds of people and learning their stories.  This money will translate directly into being able to focus on working out my writing muscles through experience, practice, and real life adventure; backpacking, climbing, and otherwise exploring the cities and countryside of China.

I am moving even if this goal is not met; even if I don't receive a penny--but as you can imagine, I will have a tough time of getting out there and capturing what adventure in China means without it!  The crux of this move is adventure, both my own and that of the many ways people in China interact with and experience adventure in their own lives.

The Impact

Stories enrich the imagination of the world, expand empathy, and stretch the limits of what we know to be possible.  My aim is to explore adventure and imagination, and the beautiful ways that the two interweave in Chinese society and experience.    

Exciting tales of the Himalayas!  Thirst and heat in the Gobi!  The massive mastery of human construction at the Three Gorges Dam!  Smog so thick one expects fire breathing dragons at work!  Forests of stone and towers of bamboo!  

Help me experience the adventure that is China, so that you can, too.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help monetarily, please help by boosting this to friends, family, and (if possible) any outrageously wealthy people who can't wait to help support a dream chaser!

story:
Short Summary

My names Edward J Rathke and I'm a freelance writer/reviewer/interviewer/editor with a few novels coming out next year. 

As many of you may already know, I've been defrauded. It was a simple scam which resulted in me losing all the money I have and being thrown into debt. Essentially, a man who we'll call James Xavier Reed hired me to write him a book and offered to pay me in advance. Unfortunately for me, the cheque he sent was fraudulent. It gets complicated from here, but my bank, Wells Fargo, took all my money and closed my account.

I spent the next week becoming my own PI, talking to bankers and the police and the company whose cheques were forged. The police told me there was nothing they could do. The bank told me they'll allow me to have a new account but that the money lost is my fault and they're not responsible, and they won't do anything to help. By endorsing a fraudulent cheque, I became responsible for the authenticity of that cheque. The company was happy that this got caught but there's not much more that they cared about.

Unfortunately, I'm out $2,000 with no legal recourse.

That's where Bartleby Snopes comes in. My good friend Nathaniel Tower, managing editor of Bartleby Snopes Literary Magazine and Press, is putting together The Revenge of the Scammed Anthology to help me raise money to recoup my losses. In addition, Ryan W Bradley, JA Tyler, Ben Tanzer, Broken River Books and many others are providing unique rewards for backers. And then I'll be providing you with a lot of different rewards for helping me out in this difficult time.

This campaign is to help me recover from my losses during the holiday seasons. Right now I have no money, no bank account, and no legal recourse. More than just helping me out, it's to provide you with some very cool things. And I've tried to collect some really awesome rewards for you.

I may have lost everything I have, but I'm very excited to generate content specifically for all of you.

Anthology Contributors

This list is subject to change but I'm both honored and proud to have such great writers lend their talent for this project. Without their help and generosity, this couldn't happen.

  • Jesus Angel Garcia
  • David S. Atkinson 
  • Allie Marini Batts
  • Ryan W Bradley
  • Paul D Brazil 
  • Darlene Campos 
  • Garrett Cook
  • Rory Fleming 
  • Gloria Garfunkel
  • Susan Gibb 
  • Michael Gonzalez
  • Amanda Gowin 
  • Douglas Hackle 
  • Sally Heymann 
  • Don Lawson 
  • William Lemon
  • h. l. nelson 
  • J David Osborne
  • Alex Pruteanu
  • Stephen V Ramey 
  • Matt Rowan 
  • Robyn Ryle 
  • Michael J. Seidlinger 
  • Grergory Sherl 
  • Ryan Shoemaker 
  • Sam Snoek-Brown
  • Ben Tanzer
  • Susan Tepper 
  • Refe Tuma 
  • Richard Thomas
  • Nathaniel Tower 
  • Robert Vaughan

What We Need & What You Get

I'm hoping to raise $3,000. This will be a great benefit to me, but it's also to make the anthology happen and give you as many perks as I can:

  • At least $500 will go straight into the making and printing of the anthology. Regardless of how much gets funded, this will be set aside so the anthology can happen.
  • I want money to go to those who are helping me out as well. The writers and artists who are helping me make this campaign happen deserve something more than just my gratitude, which they will have forever.
  • If we're fully funded, $2,000 will go to erase my debt with Wells Fargo. Once that's solved, I intend to never have contact with them again.
  • Any money made past the goal will go to the contributors and to further printings of the anthology.
  • If we don't make the goal, the money will be split between me, the anthology, and the contributors so that we can get you all of the perks.

So let's talk about your rewards for helping fund this campaign:

  • The Revenge of the Scammed Anthology in either an ebook, or Print edition.
  • Nathaniel Tower is donating a package of the Bartleby Snopes Flash Novels: The Rink by Matthew Ankeny, The Louisville Problem by CS DeWildt, and The Monster Opera by Nancy Stohlman. He is also donating issues 2-10 of Bartleby Snopes, along with the critically acclaimed Post-Experimental Issue.
  • Ryan W Bradley is creating original artwork for the cover of the anthology, which will be available to one backer. In addition, he's going to provide five cartoon face notebooks.
  • Phil Jourdan, great friend, genius, and benefactor is donating 8 books: 4 from Perfect Edge Books and 4 from Zero Books.
  • Broken River Books, the brain child of J David Osborne, is offering a bundle of their first five titles: The Least of My Scars by Stephen Graham Jones, Peckerwood by Jedidiah Ayres, Street Raised by Pearce Hansen, Gravesend by William Boyle, and XXX Shamus by Red Hammond. You want these books. Trust me.
  • Original artwork and writing by me, as well as offering my editorial skills to a few backers. In addition, all backers will receive an ebook copy of my first novel, Ash Cinema.
  • JA Tyler is donating signed copies of his novels Water and No One Told Me I Was Going To Disappear, which is an illustrated novel with John Dermot Woods. JA Tyler's one of my favorite writers and these are two of my favorite books by him.
  • The prolific Alex S Johnson is donating a signed copy of his novel Bad Sunset.
  • The always awesome Ben Tanzer is donating a signed copy of his just released novel, Orphans.
  • Susan Tepper is generously donating 5 signed copies of her novel The Merrill Diaries.
  • The beautiful Gregory Sherl is donating a signed copy of Monogamy Songs and The Oregon Trail is the Oregon Trail.
  • Alex Pruteanu is donating a signed copy of his giant and awesome collection Gears.
  • Every backer's name will be on the Thank You page of the anthology. In addition, if we reach our goal, I'll send a personal thank you to every backer and their name will appear on my website, unless they choose to remain anonymous.

The Impact

The main impact here is that you'll allow my life to return to normal. More than that, you'll be supporting some very cool independent artists in creating awesome content for you. 

I will be eternally grateful to you for your generosity and I'll work hard to create amazing content for you. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Just spread the word. 

Or, the next time you see me, buy me a beer.

story:
Over the course of 4 days, Dustin Barca sails Na Pali Coast and runs nearly 100 miles around Kaua'i to rally the community in his first political campaign to run for Mayor of the County of Kaua'i & Ni'ihau.

(Barca's opening pule (Hawaiian prayer) is the start of his journey and you can see the start of the canoe launch halfway through this video.)

“I was so lucky to grow up on Kauaʻi, learning from my elders about our sacred and unique ʻaina (land, “that which feeds us”). When I returned home from a traveling surf career, I started becoming aware of the issues our island is facing, and how they are compromising the health of our community and land. It’s time to move in a different direction, we can’t let things continue as they are.”

Dustin Barca is a professional surfer, environmental activist, MMA fighter, father and Kaua’i Boy who attended Hanalei School and Kapaʻa High School. 

While this is Barca’s first bid at political office he has been involved in local politics for much of his young adult life. Driven by a strong sense of kuleana (responsibility and privilege) to Kauaʻi and its people, he sees local government as a way to deepen his service.

Barca may be best known for his activism related to environmental justice and the impacts of the agrochemical industry on Kauaʻi, however, he is also passionately committed to: 

  • Democratic participation
  • Local agricultural food production and access to healthy foods
  • Cultural revival
  • Protecting Kauaʻi’s most vital water resources
  • Sustainable energy and transportation
  • Waste reduction
  • Better solutions to address crystal meth and illegal pharmaceutical drugs

“We need innovative ideas, rooted in our historical and cultural knowledge, to ensure that our economy is delivering a high quality of life and not compromising the things we value. We need to bring tourism and development into alignment with the values and priorities of residents, ensuring that tourism serves Kauaʻi instead of Kauaʻi serving tourism. ”

For Barca, this means moving towards greater economic self-reliance and regenerative agriculture especially; addressing land-use policies that have driven kama`aina families from their homes and blocked local access to important cultural and recreational areas; as well as policies to stabilize growth while ensuring that Government dollars are spent wisely to benefit local families. Barca emphasizes that the true wealth of Kauaʻi lies in our water, land and people, and that we are stewards of this `aina for many generations to come.

story:
I'd like to introduce myself and my project. 

Unashamed. A memoir by Aziza Kibibi

Hello, my name is Aziza Kibibi. I am a single mom of five beautiful children that I am very proud of. But from ten years old, I was raised as my father’s (Aswad Ayinde) sex slave. And the first four of my five children, are also my brother and sisters.

Unashamed is the true story of my life; a tale of how surviving my childhood, adolescence and young adulthood, has shaped me into the woman I am today.

I am the eldest of 9 children by my mother, and including my children whom he fathered, the eldest of over twenty-five by my dad. Using events from the present as a vehicle,  history of my life unfolds. I take the reader on a journey through my sheltered life in a polygamous family where I was home schooled, molested, beaten and trained to satisfy my father’s every sexual desire. In addition, I invite the reader into my present life where I've triumphed over the setbacks and challenges from my upbringing.  

I describe how while growing up I watched my father turn from a loving, talented respected member of the community, into the abusive monster that God spared my own children from growing up with. Via my transition through adolescence the reader witnesses my failed attempts at protecting my younger siblings from the fate I had befallen; my father’s video directing career where we interacted with popular ’90’s music artists such as Lauryn Hill and Wyclef Jean of the music group The Fugees, and the events that led to the unveiling of our family secret. 

UNASHAMED is a tale of tragedy, growth, resilience, survival, faith and forgiveness.  


According to the CDC, 1 in 4 girls will be molested by the time they are 18. 

I want to share my story with the public because I feel I have a moral responsibility to other men, women and children (both victims and victimizers) that may be affected by child molestation and incest, to raise awareness and lend a voice to those that are and have been abused. Unlike the safety mechanism that other victims utilize, I have not repressed the torture that my father inflicted on me, yet I function normally in life love and relationships. I consider this unique because I believe that through my writing it is important to convey to the reader the thoughts and feelings of a victim while being abused. This is also what makes my memoir stand out from other books that have been published with this theme.

As for my personal successes in life; despite my limited homeschooled education, I am currently  pursuing my associates in Liberal Arts - Communications with a 3.7 GPA (my first classroom experience) at Essex County College. I have won three Woman’s Opportunity awards from Soroptamist International for my writing. I currently administrate two blogs and, I run a catering and dessert company called Sincerely, Z. I am also raising, and have wonderful relationships with my four talented children whom I love more than anything. 

Children of all ages, races, ethnicities, cultures, and  economic backgrounds are vulnerable to sexual abuse.


Unlike what is and was available to me and countless others, my book will provide insight, support and inspiration to victims, survivors and those that love us via my voice shamelessly sharing the perils of  my victimization, as well as my triumphs as an overcomer. But this book is not only for those connected to incest or sexual child abuse.  I hope that my tales will encourage and motivate anyone going through troublesome times, to push forward and stay strong no matter what challenges life presents one with. Though themed in struggle, Unashamed is a beautiful tragedy filled with provocative scenarios, funny moments, exciting journeys and insightful thought provoking ideas. 

The unequaled story of my life caught the attention of renowned journalist, Katie Couric and I was ask to appear on her talk show Katie! on ABC, to share my story. She also featured an excerpt of my manuscript on her website.

 

What We Need  

At 35 years in the making and 3 years in the writing, Unashamed the 410 page manuscript is complete. And now I need your help to get it published. 

The initial publication will be in ever popular e-book format. Once edited and formatted, Unashamed will be available for download through Amazon, Barnes & Noble and the Aziza Kibibi website. 

Your gracious contributions will transform this project from something I am doing, to something WE are doing together. Our goal of $2600 will help prepare the manuscript for publishing.  

Funds will go towards the following:

  • Editing for grammar
  • Editing for content and continuity
  • Book cover and jacket design

What You Get

Because there is no other piece of literature of this nature on the market, you are helping to make history. I want to offer you the opportunity to prevent pain and suffering in others, and even help save a few lives. In addition I will include you in the journey of realizing this project by acknowledging your kindness on my Facebook and Twitter, keep you updated on the project and for a specific contribution, enjoy a free download of Unashamed before anyone else. 

Support comes in all forms

Don't let lack of funds stop you from showing support. There are other ways you can help.

  1. Spread the word. Share my campaign on your Facebook and/or Twitter
  2. Suggest my speaking perk or catered event to your church, synagog, temple, business or other organization.
  3. Go to my blog, Unashamed An Open Book, and cheer me on. 
  4. Like my Facebook page and/or follow me on twitter

[img src="http://d2oadd98wnjs7n.cloudfront.net/file_attac..." >

The Impact

We did not reach our goal for the first campaign but all contributions have been put aside for editing.  In addition, through this process any extended goal contributions (along with some of the proceeds from book sales) will contribute to the development of my non profit organization Precious Little Ladies. 

The purpose of this organization is to strengthen the bond between mothers and daughters through information, education, empowerment, support and understanding. 

With these tools a family could better prevent, cope and recover from incidents of child sexual abuse. 

Unashamed is not just a book, and I am not just a victim of child molestation. 

What we are creating here is a movement that will invite change. Unashamed will provide something that I never had. A map to healing, encouragement to forge on and strength to make a change; from someone who understands. 

Join me in impacting the world and making a change. Join me in saving lives. Join me in inspiring over 3 million children and 76 million adults to be UNASHAMED.
story_txt:
I'd like to introduce myself and my project. Unashamed. A memoir by Aziza KibibiHello, my name is Aziza Kibibi. I am a single mom of five beautiful children that I am very proud of. But from ten years old, I was raised as my father’s (Aswad Ayinde) sex slave. And the first four of my five children, are also my brother and sisters.Unashamed is the true story of my life; a tale of how surviving my childhood, adolescence and young adulthood, has shaped me into the woman I am today.I am the eldest of 9 children by my mother, and including my children whom he fathered, the eldest of over twenty-five by my dad. Using events from the present as a vehicle,  history of my life unfolds. I take the reader on a journey through my sheltered life in a polygamous family where I was home schooled, molested, beaten and trained to satisfy my father’s every sexual desire. In addition, I invite the reader into my present life where I've triumphed over the setbacks and challenges from my upbringing.  I describe how while growing up I watched my father turn from a loving, talented respected member of the community, into the abusive monster that God spared my own children from growing up with. Via my transition through adolescence the reader witnesses my failed attempts at protecting my younger siblings from the fate I had befallen; my father’s video directing career where we interacted with popular ’90’s music artists such as Lauryn Hill and Wyclef Jean of the music group The Fugees, and the events that led to the unveiling of our family secret. UNASHAMED is a tale of tragedy, growth, resilience, survival, faith and forgiveness.  
According to the CDC, 1 in 4 girls will be molested by the time they are 18. I want to share my story with the public because I feel I have a moral responsibility to other men, women and children (both victims and victimizers) that may be affected by child molestation and incest, to raise awareness and lend a voice to those that are and have been abused. Unlike the safety mechanism that other victims utilize, I have not repressed the torture that my father inflicted on me, yet I function normally in life love and relationships. I consider this unique because I believe that through my writing it is important to convey to the reader the thoughts and feelings of a victim while being abused. This is also what makes my memoir stand out from other books that have been published with this theme.As for my personal successes in life; despite my limited homeschooled education, I am currently  pursuing my associates in Liberal Arts - Communications with a 3.7 GPA (my first classroom experience) at Essex County College. Though themed in struggle, Unashamed is a beautiful tragedy filled with provocative scenarios, funny moments, exciting journeys and insightful thought provoking ideas. The unequaled story of my life caught the attention of renowned journalist, Katie Couric and I was ask to appear on her talk show Katie! on ABC, to share my story. She also featured an excerpt of my manuscript on her website. What We Need  At 35 years in the making and 3 years in the writing, Unashamed the 410 page manuscript is complete. And now I need your help to get it published. The initial publication will be in ever popular e-book format. Once edited and formatted, Unashamed will be available for download through Amazon, Barnes & Noble and the Aziza Kibibi website. Your gracious contributions will transform this project from something I am doing, to something WE are doing together. Our goal of $2600 will help prepare the manuscript for publishing.  Funds will go towards the following:
Editing for grammar
Editing for content and continuity
Book cover and jacket design
What You GetBecause there is no other piece of literature of this nature on the market, you are helping to make history. I want to offer you the opportunity to prevent pain and suffering in others, and even help save a few lives. In addition I will include you in the journey of realizing this project by acknowledging your kindness on my Facebook and Twitter, keep you updated on the project and for a specific contribution, enjoy a free download of Unashamed before anyone else. Support comes in all formsDon't let lack of funds stop you from showing support. There are other ways you can help.

story:
Why?

Help me make my dream a reality!

My dream is to become an author by the age of 30 (on September 24, 2014) and help make a difference to abandoned dogs, by writing a book that encourages fostering.

About me:

My name is Jadi Kindred and I started fostering dogs who were on death row a couple of years ago. When I first moved to the beautiful province of Québec, I soon learned the heart-breaking stories of overcrowded shelters, euthanization and being the puppy-mill capital of North America.

http://www.examiner.com/article/take-action-against-puppy-mills-quebec

This inspired me to volunteer with an amazing non-profit organization based in Montréal, called Paws for Life. http://pawsforlifemtl.com/


About the book:

Over the years I have been writing inspiring stories about the abandoned dogs I have saved, or rather the dogs that saved me. I would like to complete and publish my book about these beautiful souls and how they have touched my life.

Funding:

I will self-publish my first book through FriesenPress.com because it is an award-winning North American leader in the book industry.  It was also recognized as one of Canada’s Top 50 Best Managed Companies (2010).


FriesenPress Bestseller Package includes = $2199

  • 100% of Copyright & Creative Control
  • Editorial Evaluation (up to 70,000 words)

  • Custom Layout (inside, front and back covers)

  • Revision Rounds (2)

  • ISBN (3)

  • Full Colour Book Cover

  • Amazon Distribution

  • Ingram Wholesale ordering

  • FriesenPress Online Bookstore

  • Online PDF Distribution

  • Amazon Kindle Distribution

  • eBook Distribution (FriesenPress, Google Play, Barnes & Noble Nook, Kindle)

  • Look Inside (Amazon.ca, Google Books, Barnes & Noble)

  • Non-Fiction Image Insertions

  • Design Time (8 hours)


FriesenPress Extras =  $2426

  • Copy Editing ($0.02/word) 70k words = $1400

  • Premium Cover Design = $249

  • Express Layout = $329

  • Copyright Registration = $149

  • Back Cover Copy Writing = $299


Marketing & Advertising Start-up =  $375 (purchase printed books to distribute)

* Any donations over my goal will go towards marketing, advertising and book copies.


Other ways you can help:

    Please use the Indiegogo share tools to help me get the word out about my campaign.


My sincerest gratitude,

Jadi Kindred

story:
Thank you so much to everyone who made our first campaign so successful! I am now fundraising for the final month of writing--as well as the editorial phase and book tour.

Please share this with a short personal message via Facebook and email even if you can't contribute. Each person who has shared it so far has led to someone I don't know giving a donation!

My Story:

I've been running an innovative clinic in Vermont since 1995, providing sliding-scale alternative and traditional medicine to a wide variety of patients, teaching peer counseling, and helping people to remember how to get close to other people and look out for each other without fear of becoming a bother to each other. When I became involved in the sustainability movement, I realized no one was talking about how to make our health care system more resilient, even though my own practice seemed like a good model of what small scale, local, low-carbon, non-polluting medicine might look like.  I set out to explore what post-oil medicine might look like on a larger scale.

This book, which will be published by Chelsea Green, specifically addresses the question of how to reclaim and revive our whole health-care system—from how we care for each other in a community, to how our hospitals will function in the age of dwindling resources—in a connected, loving, and powerful way. Using real life examples from places that are already starting to make changes, this book will teach you how to turn your own community into a place that is actively producing healthy people, and how to turn your local hospital or clinic into a place that functions as a community--growing its own food, powered by solar, wind, and geothermal, providing low-cost housing nearby for staff, and providing ways for patients to deepen their connection to each other and to the earth.

Why do I need you?

I am the single mother of two fabulous boys. Most of my patients are rural low-income people and my annual net income is between $18,000 and $24,000--and has been for years. In order to finish writing this book, I need to take some time off before April and I need to hire someone to help with research. 

The first campaign raised over $8,000 and allowed me to take several months off of work this past winter. Then I had to return to work. The manuscript is nearly finished. The deadline is September 1st. If I can take off another month this summer I will be in good shape to have it in by the deadline.

The book is going to be published, no matter what. Chelsea Green (they publish all your favorite books on permaculture, renewable energy, green architecture, sustainable communities, and local economies) has already signed a contract with me. They are a small publisher and they give small advances, and I have already been working on this book for four years! I have two more months to go, and although I am close to finished, there is plenty of writing and research still to do! 

What will the money be used for?

If I raise the minimum of $2,000, that will allow me to take off most of the month of July, rather than squeezing my writing in after hours between work and my boys’ saxophone concerts and baseball games.

Additional funds will allow me to cover my writing expenses during the editorial period of 6-9 months, when I will be working with editors at Chelsea Green to rewrite sections and add in additional chapters as they see fit, and help to pay for me to go on a book tour when the book comes out (it's not like the old days when publishers paid for these things!).

Any funds raised above and beyond that will help this project to have a greater impact than the book alone. It will allow me to travel and speak at conferences, hospitals, and retreat centers after the book is published and to truly focus on implementing and sharing this model of health care on a larger scale by working with town and city planning commissions, hospital and medical school administrators, and Transition Town initiatives to develop health-care resiliency plans, as well as developing curriculum for a training program for community healers.

You can give any amount, it doesn't have to fit neatly into one of the perks, and you are free to choose any perk up to the amount you have contributed. 

If you would like to give a larger amount, and would like it to be tax-deductible, please contact me at sustainablemedicine@gmail.com, as there are several non-profits who have offered to be an umbrella for this project.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to help but can't afford to contribute, that's fine! There are things you can do that may be even more important, for example, click on the heart button below the video, (so that I know you like it, and I can communicate with you) and use the other buttons to share it on Facebook or via email, word of mouth, or any other way you can get the word out to people you think might be interested.

Writing a short personal note  to a few key people is the absolute best approach (far better than sending it as a "forward" to thousands of people). It is also really helpful  when you do post it on Facebook, if you can say why you support this, and suggest  that people actually watch the video.. Passing it along via word of mouth and personal messages rather than just "liking" something helps us all maintain our human dignity. Keeping our communication human and personal is one of the most important things we can do in the world right now.  Thank you for keeping that tradition alive as you share this.

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
SUMMARY

I'm Mark Coburn and I recently did a 1500-mile cycling trip from Rome to Glasgow, raising just over £14,000 for local yes groups. After a multitude of requests I have decided to do another trip, this time here in Scotland. This one will see me do 500 miles in just 5 days to raise £5,350 for 10 local campaign bases (see map above for route). Experienced campaigners will know that a base can make such a difference to a local campaign. 

Should I be fortunate enough to break my target I will donate any excess to the Maryhill Foodbank. (Please read here: http://www.eveningtimes.co.uk/news/food-bank-is...)

Here's a video of me explaining the route, the groups and a bit about the Foodbank: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KaJgaBBseOk

What We Need & What You Get

The purpose of this 500 mile bike run is to set up 10 campaign bases.

The target of £5,350 can be broken down as follows: each Yes group nominated below will receive £500 each to open premises (10x£500 = £5,000) and the £350 will cover the indiegogo fee (5% if target is met. 9% if not!)

I have also decided to make this a dual-purpose fundraiser. Initially it started off as a fundraiser for 10 local yes campaign bases but, as I've said above, any excess funds will go directly to the Maryhill Foodbank.

NB There's no Paypal facility as that requires another fee and a business account which I don't have. Plus, fees, fees, fees. No. Let's keep it minimal.

And, if you're donating from outside the UK we ask you don't exceed £500 in total as that wouldn't be a 'permissable donation'.


The Yes groups and dates are as follows:


Day 1: Thursday 10/07/2014

Route: Glasgow - Galashiels - Edinburgh (100 miles)


1) Yes Hawick  (whose campaign base will also serve local yes groups in Galashiels, Kelso, Jedburgh).

2) Yes Edinburgh East (this campaign base will cover areas including Burdiehouse, Craigmillar and Niddrie)

3) Yes Edinburgh Southern (this campaign base will also cover areas such as Newington, Prestonfields, The Inch and Shandon).



Day 2: Friday 11/07/2014

Glasgow - Rosyth - Burntisland - Cardenden - Forfar (100 miles)


4) Yes Rosyth (this campaign base will also cover Inverkeithing, Dalgety Bay and North Queensferry).

5) Yes Burntisland (this campaign base will also cover Kinghorn, Auchtertool, Seafield, Invertiel and Raith)

6) Yes Cardenden (this campaign base will also cover Lochgelly, Kinglassie, Ballingarry and Cowdenbeath).


Day 3: Saturday 12/07/2014

Forfar - Aberdeen - Huntly


7) Yes Aberdeen


Day 4: Sunday 13/07/2014

Huntly - Inverness - Fort William


Day 5: Monday 14/7/2014

Fort William  - Glasgow


8) Yes West Dunbartonshire (the base will be in Clydebank and will cover Ballock, Dumbarton and the outer lying villages).

9) Yes Renfrew (the base will also cover Inchinnan, Erskine, Bishopton, Houston & Bridge of Weir)

10) Yes Provan (Provan requires a base specifically to be set up in Easterhouse to cover Easterhouse itself, Garthamlock, Ruchazie, Cranhill and Wellhouse). I have a particular desire to see this happen because Provan is Scotland's (and perhaps Britain's) poorest constituency.

I will finish my tour here.

Perks? The only perk I'm interested in is independence. How's that for a perk!


The Impact

For those who are already involved in the campaign I really don't need to explain how much of an impact a campaign base can have. They already know.

For those who don't, having a campaign base means that there is a central hub from which activists can operate especially in the last 6 weeks of the campaign. Bases/Shops can be used as: a meeting point for activists; an organisational base for planned canvass sessions; a focal point for the general public to drop in to ask questions and even (if large enough) somewhere to hold public events.

The Maryhill Foodbank was a late addition to this cause as I am disgusted by the fact that foodbanks actually exist.

Risks & Challenges

Risks? Injuries.

Challenges? Never done over 100 miles in a day but I am going to do 500 in 5 days. It will be hell but, legs and lungs must burn.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute then please at least tweet, re-tweet, share, share and share again this fundraiser all over social media, especially on Facebook and Twitter. Tell everyone about it. This target needs to be broken.

We. Will. Win!

Initially it started off as a fundraiser for 10 local yes campaign bases but, as I've said above, any excess funds will go directly to the Maryhill Foodbank.NB There's no Paypal facility as that requires another fee and a business account which I don't have. Plus, fees, fees, fees. No. Let's keep it minimal. And, if you're donating from outside the UK we ask you don't exceed £500 in total as that wouldn't be a 'permissable donation'.The Yes groups and dates are as follows:Day 1: Thursday 10/07/2014 Route: Glasgow - Galashiels - Edinburgh (100 miles)1) Yes Hawick  (whose campaign base will also serve local yes groups in Galashiels, Kelso, Jedburgh).2) Yes Edinburgh East (this campaign base will cover areas including Burdiehouse, Craigmillar and Niddrie)3) Yes Edinburgh Southern (this campaign base will also cover areas such as Newington, Prestonfields, The Inch and Shandon).Day 2: Friday 11/07/2014Glasgow - Rosyth - Burntisland - Cardenden - Forfar (100 miles)4) Yes Rosyth (this campaign base will also cover Inverkeithing, Dalgety Bay and North Queensferry).5) Yes Burntisland (this campaign base will also cover Kinghorn, Auchtertool, Seafield, Invertiel and Raith) 6) Yes Cardenden (this campaign base will also cover Lochgelly, Kinglassie, Ballingarry and Cowdenbeath).Day 3: Saturday 12/07/2014Forfar - Aberdeen - Huntly7) Yes AberdeenDay 4: Sunday 13/07/2014Huntly - Inverness - Fort WilliamDay 5: Monday 14/7/2014Fort William  - Glasgow8) Yes West Dunbartonshire (the base will be in Clydebank and will cover Ballock, Dumbarton and the outer lying villages).9) Yes Renfrew (the base will also cover Inchinnan, Erskine, Bishopton, Houston & Bridge of Weir)10) Yes Provan (Provan requires a base specifically to be set up in Easterhouse to cover Easterhouse itself, Garthamlock, Ruchazie, Cranhill and Wellhouse). I have a particular desire to see this happen because Provan is Scotland's (and perhaps Britain's) poorest constituency. I will finish my tour here. Perks? The only perk I'm interested in is independence. How's that for a perk!The ImpactFor those who are already involved in the campaign I really don't need to explain how much of an impact a campaign base can have. They already know.For those who don't, having a campaign base means that there is a central hub from which activists can operate especially in the last 6 weeks of the campaign. Bases/Shops can be used as: a meeting point for activists; an organisational base for planned canvass sessions; a focal point for the general public to drop in to ask questions and even (if large enough) somewhere to hold public events.The Maryhill Foodbank was a late addition to this cause as I am disgusted by the fact that foodbanks actually exist.  Risks & ChallengesRisks? Injuries.Challenges? Never done over 100 miles in a day but I am going to do 500 in 5 days. It will be hell but, legs and lungs must burn.  Other Ways You Can Help If you cannot contribute then please at least tweet, re-tweet, share, share and share again this fundraiser all over social media, especially on Facebook and Twitter. Tell everyone about it. This target needs to be broken. We. Will. Win!

story:
Dear friends,

I've been writing poetry for some time now, and I've been reading it for much longer.  In all those years, I've put a lot of thought into what I do, and why I do it.  Why does anyone write poetry, much less read it?  

For me, poetry is all about understanding: understanding different ways of seeing the world, understanding others, understanding yourself.  Poetry makes life elemental: in all its mystery, it makes life more understandable. It enables you to taste untastables, feel intangibles, see invisibles.  It's magic, absolute wizardry.

Of course, some exposure is necessary for any of this to occur, and I'm so fortunate to have the opportunity to share my work on a larger scale.

That opportunity comes to me in the form of VERONICA, DAUGHTER -- my first professionally published collection of prose and poetry.  Thirty-three pieces over sixty pages of copy.  It's ready for production via a company called AuthorHouse, and when it arrives it'll be available through several channels of distribution, including Amazon.

However, in order for this to come to fruition, I need to raise a small payment that will pay for the production services offered, in the amount of $500 total.

That's where you come in.  Any nominal donation you might make to the effort is a welcome dent in the cost.  Every dollar is a great green stamp of support.  Everything you come up with is for the good of giving people a chance to sit down for a minute away from their day and see things differently through a few careful words.

I thank you for reading this.  I thank you for reading at all.  That's communication.  That's what we exist on.  That's how we get through the day.  Thanks for it all, and I encourage you to consider this modest cause as one worth a few of your spare dollars.

Yours,

Robert S. Hummel

story:
During the Qing dynasty China prevented foreigners from laying railway tracks for fear awaking deceased ancestors. In 2003 China still had steam engines in commercial use. By 2007 it launched its first high-speed train. There is now 7500 miles of high-speed track alone. The innovation and development has been extraordinary. China has been condensed; provinces brought closer together, the experience of crossing the ancient Middle Kingdom changed forever. There are even plans afoot to build a high-speed line to Singapore, and elsewhere abroad. But many questions are also being raised. How much is big infrastructure being built at the expense of poverty alleviation? How much are overseas tracks, or tracks cutting through disputed territories like Tibet and Xinjiang, mechanisms of soft imperialism? How can the new railway be deemed green when the electricity plants still fire coal? And from an aesthetic perspective, is the new, sleek and sanitised experience of high-speed rail travel comparable with the gentle rolling of a slow locomotive that drove the stories through the golden days of rail travel (and travel literature)?

Travel by train is one of the great romances of the travel literature genre and in a vast, complex and diverse place like China, still the best way to get around and see the country. Indeed, it was the veteran travel writer Paul Theroux’s Riding the Iron Rooster (published in 1989) that inspired me to visit, live in and travel China. Though it is from this vantage point I propose to document China, the nation is no longer the one Theroux wrote about. And while Theroux rode the functional, comfortless railway of Red China – one that still very much exists – I will be transferring between the old, new, fast and slow, as well as the light and underground rail, to try and tell the tail both of China, and its trains. For they both are moving, and at greater speed.

Having lived and worked for the best part of ten years in China I think I can offer a unique telling of this narrative. I’ve contributed to three guidebooks about various Chinese locales, and my articles and travel features have appeared in CNN Travel, SCMP, Destinasian, Geographical Magazine, Macau Closer, City Weekend and many other international publications. Thus I’m an experienced, published writer, as well as something of an old China hand. 

Alas, we live in an age where publishing, particularly one's first book, is increasingly difficult. According to the BBC “The top 5% of authors earned 42% of all income received by professional writers in 2013.” Though a Hong Kong-based publisher, with strong distribution networks in Asia, Europe and the US, has expressed interest in publishing the book, the company cannot afford to offer an advance, which I’ll need if I’m to spend upwards of four months train hopping in China. 

To my mind, the subject and concept captures the zeitgeist of our age, and the book could prove an important component in future discourse about China, and more broadly about global transport development. But most of all it proposes to be an lyrical and personal read, one that will document the China I see as I hop on and off the rails. 

If this sounds like something that might interest you, please know that every penny, dime or jiao will help make this book become a reality.


What's more, you'll be able to follow its development (and your investment) via blog postings on www.thomasbird.info

story:
¿Qué queremos conseguir?

Somos un grupo de moteras españolas y queremos promover el que cada día semos más las mujeres moteras, ya que actualmente sólo somos un 7% de los motoristas.
Para conseguirlo asistiremos a multitud de eventos y concentraciones, haciendo diferentes actividades con las mujeres asistentes como charlas, talleres, clases, ...

El punto fuerte de la campaña será el asistir a todos estos eventos con una moto única y original, pintada completamente con los nombres de todos los participantes. Será el símbolo del apoyo global que tenemos y captará la atención del público interactuando con ella en las actividades.

El dinero recaudado será destinado a los gastos de la campaña y de ser suficiente a la adquisición de una moto. Si no consiguiéramos llegar al objetivo económico pondremos los nombres en una de nuestras propias motos y realizaremos la campaña de la misma forma.

 

¿Cómo lo haremos?

El dinero recaudado será destinado a cubrir los siguientes gastos:

  • Recompensas para los colaboradores (camisetas, impresiones, parches, ...)
  • Tasas para la creación de una asociación sin ánimo de lucro.
  • Gastos en transporte y medios físicos (panfletos, pósters, guías, ...)
  • Gastos en actividades para los eventos (talleres, clases, sorteos, ...)
  • Gastos en pintura/vinilo para plasmar todos los nombres y logos en la moto final.
  • (Si se superan los 4.000€) Gastos para la adquisición y mantenimiento de una moto, nueva o de segunda mano. El modelo será elegido mediante votación a través de las redes sociales de la campaña.


Recompensas

Como agradecimiento por hacer posible esta iniciativa hemos creado una tabla de recompensas para los participantes:

Entre 1 y 5 euros: Tu nombre en la moto virtual

Hemos creado una moto virtual a la que cada Domingo añadimos los nombres de las pequeñas adquisiciones. En caso de que al acabar la campaña quedara sitio en la moto real también los añadiríamos a ella.

Más de 25€ : Tu nombre en la moto final

Tu nombre aparecerá en la moto final. Te enviaremos fotografías en alta resolución de la moto completa y del detalle donde aparezca tu nombre.

El tamaño dependerá de la cantidad aportada pero siempre será fácilmente visible.

 Más de 100€ : Tu nombre en la moto final + camisetas

Además de lo anterior recibirás una camiseta con un diseño exclusivo de la campaña y todas las fotografías firmadas con un agradecimiento personal.

Más de 1000€ : Nombre en zona exclusiva + dibujo a lápiz

Como uno de nuestros colaboradores más especiales tu nombre aparecerá en una zona exclusiva de la moto a elegir (tubo de escape, frontal, toma de aire, embellecedor, ... variable según el modelo final de la moto), tu nombre aparecerá en todos los medios de la campaña como fundador de la misma, con acceso prioritario a todo el futuro merchandising (parches, pósters, pegatinas, ...) además de todo lo anterior recibirás un pack completo de fundador que incluye: 2 camisetas, dibujo a lápiz de la moto final con dedicatoria, acceso especial a las redes sociales y web de la iniciativa y fotografías impresas en alta calidad de las sesiones fotográficas.

Más de 2500€ : Nombre en zona exclusiva + Guía ruta por España 

Como fundador honorífico recibirás todo lo anterior y además te invitamos a acompañarnos en una ruta por las ciudades más emblemáticas de España para que vivas de cerca la campaña que has hecho posible acudiendo con nosotros a los eventos.

 

Nota: Los gastos de transporte y manutención no están incluidos, nosotros nos encargamos de hacer de guías durante el viaje y sólo podremos cubrir los gastos que nos permita el presupuesto general de la iniciativa.

Pase lo que pase SIEMPRE otorgaremos las recompensas, si no conseguimos la cantidad suficiente para una moto usaremos una particular y la pintaremos de la misma forma: la campaña siempre se llevará a cabo y ajustaremos su alcance al presupuesto conseguido.

Los nombres deberán de ser de un máximo de 20 caracteres con total libertad por parte del contribuidor de ser un eslogan, sobrenombre o nombre real.

En caso de superar la cifra estimada se irán añadiendo regalos para todo el que ya haya participado como pueden ser parches, pulseras, llaveros, pósters, sorteos, ...


*Las imágenes que aparecen están editadas digital-mente para simular cómo quedaría la moto. El modelo y color será elegido por votación popular en Facebook una vez terminada la recaudación y será pintada por profesionales.

 

Objetivos

Nuestro objetivo principal siempre será el mismo: promover el uso de las motos por parte de las mujeres. Para conseguirlo una vez terminada la moto llevaremos a cabo las siguientes acciones:

  • Asistir a los eventos y concentraciones organizando actividades.
  • Escribir artículos y publicaciones relacionadas en diferentes revistas, blogs y páginas web.
  • Creación de una página web para recopilar toda la documentación de la campaña y de los eventos según se lleven a cabo con imágenes, vídeos, crónicas etc.
  • (opcional) Crear un club de moteras afines a la iniciativa con sus respectivos parches.
  • (opcional) De realizarse una segunda edición el año que viene la moto conseguida en esta se sorteará entre todos los que hayan participado.


Patrocinadores

Si eres dueño de una empresa o asociación y quieres apoyar nuestra iniciativa póngase en contacto con nosotros y le haremos un análisis completo del alcance de la publicidad que podemos aportar a su negocio. Contamos con una gran comunidad de seguidores en las redes sociales y tenemos previsto un gran alcance mediático en todos los eventos.


Otras formas de ayudarnos

No todo es cuestión de dinero, esta es una iniciativa abierta a la colaboración popular, cualquier crítica, comentario o sugerencia será bien recibida. 

Si vives en Madrid y quieres formar parte del equipo de organizadores no dudes en ponerte en contacto con nosotros, ¡cuantos más seamos a más llegaremos!.

Gracias a todos por hacer este proyecto posible,

¡Nos vemos en la carretera!
