story:
Short Summary

Hi there. I'm Mordechai Luchins, known to my readers as Typo Lad. I've spent the last few years blogging about technology at techcitement.com (as Modechai Osdoby) and before that weird old comics via Luchins.com (popularly known as "What Were They Thinking?!" I’m also working on my first novel and a few other projects. Or I was, before Life Happened. The last few years have been a bit chaotic. Had a son (hooray!) who had some medical issues (boo!). Had insurance (yay!) who didn’t want to pay for some things (jerks!). Lots of other drama, including moving halfway across the country only for my wife to lose the job promised to her and the state of NY deciding that I owe them quite a bit of tax money. In short, I’ve been so busy dealing with fiscal matters that I have almost no time to create.

 

I’ve been lucky in that people have helped me with quick loans. I’m lucky - I have friends, family, and a job. My wife is starting a new job as well. But right now we’re running a Red Queen’s Race, not getting anywhere. Those loans are mounting and I’m tired of being a burden. I want to clear my personal ledger and be able to move forward. Microdonations would help me move on and get back to actual writing.

 

What We Need & What You Get

I’m trying to raise enough money to pay back those who have helped me over the years, plus the state taxes I owe.

 

I’ve several personal loans of about a thousand each, owe NY state about the same, and owe back tuition to my daughter’s old Hebrew school and new one. Additionally, I have borrowed against my retirement fund, life insurance, and my folks. I’m really quite pathetic, actually.

 

Perks will include: Random tech from about my house, prints and postcards based on the photos my wife and daughter take as well as content from Luchins.com, random comics, an exclusive look at scripts and stories, and being an official “reader” for my novel. I’ll be adding more as time goes on.

 

Should I not reach my total (rather large and scary) goal, I’ll still be keeping the money, and you’ll still get your reward. As they say, every bit helps. Should I reach it, I will pay off my debt and return to writing. Lucky you.

The Impact

Let’s be honest: donating to this project isn’t going to help the world. Even if my 12 year old reaches her stated goal of being a neonatologist (she’s wanted to be one since she was six. I didn’t know six year olds knew what a neonatologist *was*), my impact on the universe will likely be minimal. I just want my kids to grow up happy, and not have to worry that I’m worried. They’re my world, you see.

 

I also want to be able to write. I’m really not a bad writer, though you’d never know from this. I spent several years writing “What Were They Thinking?!” and would love to have the time and energy to post again. WWTT averaged a thousand readers a day, and my current site Techcitement does that on a slow day. I miss mocking panels like the below:




I have no way to prove to you that I won’t waste this money. There’s absolutely no reason to give me, some stranger who probably is far better off than people in your own community. This is a shot in the dark, to take advantage of the tools available to change my children’s life for the better. I thank you for even reading this.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If this interests you, or you know someone it might interest, please share this.

In short, I’ve been so busy dealing with fiscal matters that I have almost no time to create.
 
I’ve been lucky in that people have helped me with quick loans. I’m lucky - I have friends, family, and a job. My wife is starting a new job as well. But right now we’re running a Red Queen’s Race, not getting anywhere. Those loans are mounting and I’m tired of being a burden. I want to clear my personal ledger and be able to move forward. Microdonations would help me move on and get back to actual writing.
 
What We Need & What You Get
I’m trying to raise enough money to pay back those who have helped me over the years, plus the state taxes I owe.
 
I’ve several personal loans of about a thousand each, owe NY state about the same, and owe back tuition to my daughter’s old Hebrew school and new one. Additionally, I have borrowed against my retirement fund, life insurance, and my folks. I’m really quite pathetic, actually.
 
Perks will include: Random tech from about my house, prints and postcards based on the photos my wife and daughter take as well as content from Luchins.com, random comics, an exclusive look at scripts and stories, and being an official “reader” for my novel. I’ll be adding more as time goes on.
 
Should I not reach my total (rather large and scary) goal, I’ll still be keeping the money, and you’ll still get your reward. As they say, every bit helps. Should I reach it, I will pay off my debt and return to writing. Lucky you.
The Impact
Let’s be honest: donating to this project isn’t going to help the world. Even if my 12 year old reaches her stated goal of being a neonatologist (she’s wanted to be one since she was six. I didn’t know six year olds knew what a neonatologist *was*), my impact on the universe will likely be minimal. I just want my kids to grow up happy, and not have to worry that I’m worried. They’re my world, you see.
 
I also want to be able to write. I’m really not a bad writer, though you’d never know from this. I spent several years writing “What Were They Thinking?!” and would love to have the time and energy to post again. WWTT averaged a thousand readers a day, and my current site Techcitement does that on a slow day. I miss mocking panels like the below:


I have no way to prove to you that I won’t waste this money. There’s absolutely no reason to give me, some stranger who probably is far better off than people in your own community. This is a shot in the dark, to take advantage of the tools available to change my children’s life for the better. I thank you for even reading this.
 
Other Ways You Can Help
If this interests you, or you know someone it might interest, please share this.

story:
Kort sagt

Jag är född på Gotland där jag växte upp bland raukar och troll. Som barn lekte jag på magiska platser bland trojaborgar och rotvältor. Efter en längre tids sjukdom tillfrisknade jag med hjälp av healing och andligt uppvaknande. Jag har sedan dess vigt mitt liv åt att hjälpa andra genom medial vägledning och healing. 

Min intention med boken är att väcka upp och starta helande processer. Tiden är nu inne för ett uppvaknande. Genom att ta till sig budskapen i min bok kommer man närmare sin själs sanning och energierna kommer att höja frekvensen för välmående. Har din andliga guide lett dig hit?

Nu när du donerar så öppnar du dörren till magin. Genom att boken blir manifesterad så sprids goda energier. När du väljer att donera och att läsa boken väljer du samtidigt ljuset inom dig. 

Vad jag behöver 

Det finns e-böker men det kan aldrig slå känslan av att ha en riktig bok i handen. Vad är bättre än att ligga i hängmattan och läsa en bok, och att slå upp en sida i boken och läsa budskapet som visar sig? Den här boken kan du ta med ut i hängmattan år efter år ...

  • Lektörsläsning och korrektursläsning 9000:-
  • Illustration 5500:- 
  • Tryck 30 500:-

Risker och Problem

Jag vill ge ut min bok utan ett förlag då jag kan ha full kontroll över processen och boken. För att finansiera boken behöver jag din hjälp att täcka kostnaderna för lektör, illustratör och tryckning. Även om inte summan uppnås kommer boken att ges ut. Det kommer inte ske lika snabbt eftersom jag behöver just denna summan. 

Hjälp till att sprida budskapet

Berätta för dina vänner, och dela på facebook!

Gilla Den Blå Lågan på facebook

story:
Joyrider the Children's Book

Beyond taking kids for the cycling ride of a lifetime, Joyrider is about taking on challenges, discovering unfathomable potential, learning more about the world, and having some fun along the way.

Joyrider shares the incredible journey of racing nonstop across the USA, covering its many landscapes. It's both a battle against the elements and the mind. More importantly, it is a story about the incredible human potential to overcome obstacles and shows the reader that they can do more than they ever imagined. In a fun and kid friendly way, the book introduces "mindset" - what it means and how it can impact one's journey. As the wise owl we meet high in the Appalachians, says, "You do what you think and you think what you choose".

For many kids it may also serve as a first introduction to a person that uses a wheelchair, or is a bit different than what they know.  Besides being a good opportunity to give a positive introduction, it shows that nothing needs to get in the way of a dream.

What you are Funding: 

The money raised through book sales and purchase of all other perks, will be used to pay the illustrator for painting the 32 scenes + book cover and to order books, fulfilling preorders and creating inventory to get this book to more kids.

About André Kajlich

In 2017, I became the first handcyclist to solo Race Across America - a bike race from Oceanside to California. I completed the 3,100 mile race in 12 days and 16 hours. It was really hard. I had headaches for a month and numb hands for closer to 6 months.

On the drive back home, crossing the country, I decided I wanted to create a children's book. My goal was to show kids a little of what they are capable of, to encourage them to take on any challenge, and to try and show that the single most important thing, is to figure out how best to mentally approach it.

What's next?
Maybe more races, maybe more books...

About Jackson Mauzé

Jackson was on the support crew of Race Across America and was eager to bring this story to life from the start. A teacher, writer and coach, Jackson specializes these talents with his focus in elementary education. He has written and pitched multiple spec scripts for children’s animation, has served as an AmeriCorps volunteer at an elementary school in Alaska, and beginning in the Fall of 2018 will travel to serve in the Peace Corps in Samoa as an English Literacy Teacher.

Also, he is quite a proud ginger.

About Nestor Xouranis
(ΞΟΥΡΗΣ ΝΕΣΤΟΡΑΣ ΚΩΝ)

Nestor has been illustrating children’s books since 2004 and has illustrated nearly 50 books so far. He works mainly with watercolors and other water based mediums.

When illustrating a book, he says: "My goal is to create an atmosphere that will help the viewer enter the story, without having to depend on the text. Sometimes this can be achieved with a few brush strokes, some other times it needs a little more effort, but in the end, if the fire that gave birth to the painting is still present, then I'm happy. And that’s why I paint."

Nestor lives in Athens, Greece.

Risks & Challenges

I am trying to deliver these books and packages in time for Christmas. Painting the 33 pieces will be the most difficult challenge, the schedule will be tight. Nestor will work diligently and I will have everything else ready to publish and ship. Painting will take 4-5 months. The sooner  we get funded, the better the chance that we will make it.

I pledge to do everything in my power to have these books in your hands by December 21st

story:
Story of My Book

No One Will Marry You - The unique experience of growing up Asian, conflicting cultural expectations that challenge personal ambitions.

My name is Tram Nguyen and I am the Author of No One Will Marry You. I wrote this book because I wanted to give shape to the voice of many of us who were raised Asian, especially to those of us who needs that push to be rebellious, follow our dreams and stop living our lives for someone else.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will find yourself in me, and find the courage to do that one thing or many things that you never dared to do because you were afraid your mom would chase you down with the broom. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion, excitement and courage that I found to realize my dream so that you can realize yours too. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you be the person you want to be, not the person society wants you to be.

In this book, you'll hear about my experiences growing up; my mom's hand ready to whoop me at any moment, and how my experiences while growing up has changed me:

  • An open letter to all the Asian parents out there, speaking aloud the things we, as the younger generation, were always too afraid to say - Chapter 1: To mom: an open letter
  • How my mom deems me undesirable and no one would marry me because I’m being non-traditional - Chapter 6: No one will marry you!
  • How facing a life and death situation had changed my thinking - Chapter 13.1: A Life Worth Living

You will love this book if you understand the pain of being hit by a broom, or were being constantly compared to the neighbor’s kid because you were never enough for your parents.

No One Will Marry You is a non-fiction book that speaks to people of Asian origins and were raised with Asian parents who are looking for the courage to speak out of line and live life for themselves not their parents for the first time.

The Book - No One Will Marry You

The book is written in 4 Parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction and the how to use my book guide.

Part 2 contains Chapters 1-5. This part talks about my childhood and how my unique childhood experiences have affected a lot of my world views today.

Part 3 contains Chapters 6-10. This part discusses some struggles I faced as I grew up, as well as highlighting stories of others in the same predicament.

Part 4 contains Chapters 11-15. This part wraps up the book with the lessons and revelations I learnt throughout my life.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2019
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Winter 2019

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author

Tram is a Vietnamese (to-be) Biomedical Engineer studying in the US raised by a mother who was raised in the Soviet Union. Despite studying linguistics the majority of her precollege education, she is passionate about and is pursing a career in Engineering.

She had been passionate about science and the STEM field in general since she was a kid, with her dream job in the future to be a scientist, which she has realized today.

Tram started writing this book because she wanted to write an open letter to her mother. Being raised by Asian Parents (or Parent in her case) is an experience in itself, and it is sometimes very hard for the children to speak our mind for fear of being hit by our parents with a broom.

Tram is crazy about robotics, mechatronics as well as building things in general as a Maker. She spends her weekends practicing Kendo with a teacher who had trained in the mountains in Japan. When she is not beating people with sticks or making something, she curls up in a blanket watching Anime like every other Asian kid.

For more information, you can connect with me at nnguy22@u.rochester.edu, my FaceBook at https://www.facebook.com/srm.325 or my website at allaboutsora.wordpress.com

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #NoOneWillMarryYou and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!


Thanks again,
Tram Nguyen

story:
Update 05/07!!

We have hit our £600 goal!! Hurray! But if we can stretch that goal and raise even more that would be a huge help; let's go for £700! Why?? See below:

Update 04/07!! 

My application to Arts Council England for a grant to put on the show has been unsuccessful. The goal of this crowdfunder was originally to match the 10% of the overall budget required to make that application... now it's been unsuccessful, it means that this fund is all we've got. 

Therefore, it's more important than ever to reach the £600 (or more!!) now, and we've only got until tomorrow. I cannot ask or beg you enough - please donate anything you can afford, please share, please shout about this project from the rooftops if you care about supporting emerging (marginalised) artists, diversifying literary history, and inciting climate action. 

Read the full update on the updates tab.

"Sweet Thames, run softly til I end my song"

I am Izzy Inkpen, an emerging, inter-disciplinary artist, and last year I wrote, produced, and performed a promenade spoken word show called Run Softly, as part of Totally Thames 2018. It received glowing reviews and had no rating below 8/10. This year, I am seeking funds to make it even better by involving other early-career artists to reflect the breadth of experiences and identities in London.

Run Softly responds to and re-imagines pieces of literature about the Thames, from Old English to contemporary writing, and focuses on celebrating marginalised voices and forgotten history. It also tracks how human habitation has changed the river's landscape over time and addresses the threats it faces due to climate change.

Your generous donations will go towards preserving the fascinating, diverse history of London’s ancient river, and inspiring the readers and audience to protect its future.

The Vision

Currently, when you search for “literature about the Thames”, you get Edmund Spenser, Charles Dickens, and T.S Eliot. They're great writers, but poetry has been reduced to an exam-tested canon of mostly white, straight, male writers; it's time to make poetry accessible, engaging, and showcase the beautifully diverse writers of London. Plus, given the current public attention to the climate crisis and the society we want to build, I believe now is the perfect time to cultivate a dialogue around the history and future of the Thames.

My key priorities are for Run Softly to be:

  • Supportive: a development opportunity for early-career writers, with personal mentoring and a printed anthology of their work.
  • Diverse: honour the cultural heritage of the Thames and diversify the literary canon.
  • Urgent: incite the audience and readers to environmental action with specific information about the affect of climate change on the Thames.
  • Accessible: the performance area is wheelchair accessible, and tickets are just £4.

What I Need

The primary goal of this fundraiser is to match 10% of the total project budget, which is necessary for an Arts Council England Grant. Since my proposed budget is £5600, the goal of £600 is therefore a safe 10%, and shows ACE that people are keen to see Run Softly happen. The main bulk of this funding will go towards paying the artists fairly for their writing and performances. The remaining goes towards publicity photos, props, and printing the zine of the work (hopefully on recycled paper!).

That said, it would be great to exceed the goal. In the event I do not achieve ACE funding, all the money from this crowdfunder will go directly towards the artists’ fees, so the more the better!

The Impact

I feel Run Softly has real potential for being an eye-opening, educational, engaging work, and you don’t just have to take my word for it: in 2018 on the feedback cards given to the audience, there was no rating below an 8/10! (eleven people gave it 10/10!)  Here are some of the reviews:

  • “it's one of a kind and a must see” - twitter
  • “You can really see the amount of creative spirit and thought that was put into this show!” - twitter
  •  “Excellent; making the familiar new” – feedback card
  • “Really thoughtful, social, democratic, stimulating” – feedback card
  • “in einer anderen Zeit versetz (puts you in another time)” – feedback card

The Perks!

Whether you're more about the poetry, or more about saving the environment, I've got the perks for you. They include:

  • The original Run Softly zine - limited edition!
  • Cleaning up the Thames after each show
  • Personal feedback on you poetry
  • A full summary report on how climate change is affecting the Thames

And many more!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share with your book-nerd, theatre-nerd, and environmentalist friends!
  • Sign up to the newsletter tracking the process of Run Softly 
  • Come along to the show in September, or buy the zine when it comes out!

What if the money isn't raised?

Even if this funder does not reach its entire goal, it is still a big boost to my ACE grant. Run Softly will happen regardless if I get full funding – but this means I will struggle to pay the artists properly, so if I can raise more here, that is a greater safety net.

My application to Arts Council England for a grant to put on the show has been unsuccessful. The goal of this crowdfunder was originally to match the 10% of the overall budget required to make that application... now it's been unsuccessful, it means that this fund is all we've got. 
Therefore, it's more important than ever to reach the £600 (or more!!) now, and we've only got until tomorrow. I cannot ask or beg you enough - please donate anything you can afford, please share, please shout about this project from the rooftops if you care about supporting emerging (marginalised) artists, diversifying literary history, and inciting climate action. 
Read the full update on the updates tab.
"Sweet Thames, run softly til I end my song"
I am Izzy Inkpen, an emerging, inter-disciplinary artist, and last year I wrote, produced, and performed a promenade spoken word show called Run Softly, as part of Totally Thames 2018. It received glowing reviews and had no rating below 8/10. This year, I am seeking funds to make it even better by involving other early-career artists to reflect the breadth of experiences and identities in London.
Run Softly responds to and re-imagines pieces of literature about the Thames, from Old English to contemporary writing, and focuses on celebrating marginalised voices and forgotten history. It also tracks how human habitation has changed the river's landscape over time and addresses the threats it faces due to climate change.
Your generous donations will go towards preserving the fascinating, diverse history of London’s ancient river, and inspiring the readers and audience to protect its future.

The Vision
Currently, when you search for “literature about the Thames”, you get Edmund Spenser, Charles Dickens, and T.S Eliot. They're great writers, but poetry has been reduced to an exam-tested canon of mostly white, straight, male writers; it's time to make poetry accessible, engaging, and showcase the beautifully diverse writers of London. Plus, given the current public attention to the climate crisis and the society we want to build, I believe now is the perfect time to cultivate a dialogue around the history and future of the Thames.
My key priorities are for Run Softly to be:


Supportive: a development opportunity for early-career writers, with personal mentoring and a printed anthology of their work.

Diverse: honour the cultural heritage of the Thames and diversify the literary canon.

Urgent: incite the audience and readers to environmental action with specific information about the affect of climate change on the Thames.

Accessible: the performance area is wheelchair accessible, and tickets are just £4.

What I Need
The primary goal of this fundraiser is to match 10% of the total project budget, which is necessary for an Arts Council England Grant. Since my proposed budget is £5600, the goal of £600 is therefore a safe 10%, and shows ACE that people are keen to see Run Softly happen. The main bulk of this funding will go towards paying the artists fairly for their writing and performances. The remaining goes towards publicity photos, props, and printing the zine of the work (hopefully on recycled paper!).
That said, it would be great to exceed the goal. In the event I do not achieve ACE funding, all the money from this crowdfunder will go directly towards the artists’ fees, so the more the better!

The Impact
I feel Run Softly has real potential for being an eye-opening, educational, engaging work, and you don’t just have to take my word for it: in 2018 on the feedback cards given to the audience, there was no rating below an 8/10! (eleven people gave it 10/10!)  Here are some of the reviews:

“it's one of a kind and a must see” - twitter
“You can really see the amount of creative spirit and thought that was put into this show!” - twitter
 “Excellent; making the familiar new” – feedback card
“Really thoughtful, social, democratic, stimulating” – feedback card
“in einer anderen Zeit versetz (puts you in another time)” – feedback card

The Perks!
Whether you're more about the poetry, or more about saving the environment, I've got the perks for you. They include:

The original Run Softly zine - limited edition!
Cleaning up the Thames after each show
Personal feedback on you poetry
A full summary report on how climate change is affecting the Thames

And many more!

Other Ways You Can Help

Share with your book-nerd, theatre-nerd, and environmentalist friends!

Sign up to the newsletter tracking the process of Run Softly 
Come along to the show in September, or buy the zine when it comes out!

What if the money isn't raised?
Even if this funder does not reach its entire goal, it is still a big boost to my ACE grant. Run Softly will happen regardless if I get full funding – but this means I will struggle to pay the artists properly, so if I can raise more here, that is a greater safety net.

story:
My name is Todd Brown and I served in the US Army Infantry from 1993-1997.  I spent 1 year in Korea and 3 years @ Fort Bragg in the 82nd Airborne Infantry division.  While @ Fort Bragg my unit was sent to Porta Prince Haiti for 2 weeks to break up gang activity but was stranded for 4 weeks due to aircraft failure.  During that time I saw things that are too grafice to describe.  Due to this and things that happened in Korea I now suffer from PTSD.  I also have many medical issues that have caused the rehabilitation program of the VA to deem me unemployable.  I have been fighting the VA for over 3 years for full disability benefits.  This is causing severe depression because I feel like I cant even support my family.  My wife is currently working 2 jobs trying to support our family.  She is currently suffering from severe anxiety and stress because of all this.  A few months ago she found a program in Peachtree City called Healing4Heros.  They help veterans with service dogs to help with PTSD and tramatic brain injuries.  They rescue dogs from local shelters to train.  There is no cost to the veteran but they need donations to help with supplies and training for them.  It costs $6000.00 to train 25 dogs with their veteran & supplies donate to healing4heroes.org.  They are also requiring me to have a fence around our back yard do to neighbors that dont obay leash laws and wild dogs ect.  This is why I need to raise funds.  It is going to cost about $8000.00 for 800 linear feet of fence (and this isnt fencing my entire back yard).  Any remaining funds I raise be donated back to Healing4Heros for dog food, leashes and other supplies needed for the dogs.  Please help my family bring our dog home.   Thanks in advance for ANY help you can give us and Healing4Heros.  If you need to reach me please call me @ 404-910-6388.

 I only need $8000.00 for fence donate to healing4heroes.org for for them please

story:
Hi! Thanks for visiting my book fundraising page!

A little bit about me and my project:

My name is Jason Anthony and it has been a long held dream of mine to write a book.  "Amsterdam Angel" is my debut autobiographical novel and I am very proud to announce its arrival at the end of 2012!

It is a dream that has refused to let go of me and me of it for 17 years.

My book, "Amsterdam Angel", covers my expereince of losing my brother at 21-years-old. It depicts my personal journey of weathering loss, the lessons life taught as a result and my realization that we only have one precious life and need to live it to its fullest.

In the book I also share my personal experience of coming out as a gay man and how my religious upbringing and societal stigmas effected my process. I also cover how I used travel to help me cope with everything I was going through and what helped me to come out the other side a changed man.   

This book campaign is important to me becasue I wanted to share my story and help  anyone who has experienced the death of a loved one and/or who struggles with their sexual identity. In a society that is still saturated with homophobic attitudes no one should have to suffer needlessly if those of us who have gone before can extend a hand backwards in kind. My intention and hope is that my story will show that life does and can go on and that dreams can and really do come true.  

Your contributions will help me to help others and accomplish my dream to be a published author. Any support you can provide would be greatly appreciated and mean the world to me.  

To give you a better sense of where your contribution funds are being allocated:

$1200 for editing

$825 for publishing

Approximately $2500 will go toward a first run printing of 250 copies. 

$500 will go towards website creating, marketing and book launch. 

I would like to extend a special thanks for contributing to my campaign in the form of a few gift offerings: 

1. For $25 you will receive a copy of the book itself.

2. For $50 in additon to the book you will receive a limited edition photo of the cover.

3. For $100 you will receive both 1 & 2, plus VIP status to one of the book signings to     take place in New York, California, London and Amsterdam over the next year.

4. For $500 you will receive all of the above plus special mention in the book

5. Finally $1000 will get you everything stated thus far, pluse a dinner party with me to answer all your book club questions!

In closing, beyond supporting this project financially I would greatly appreciate ANY help you can provide. You can also support me by posting a link to this campaign and my book on your facebook pages and share it with your family and friends. Every little bit adds up to a lot and I am eternally grateful for whatever you can give so that I may in turn give back in this way.    

Thank You!

story:
To clarify any confusions over shipping costs -
How To Calculate Shipping:

The Trade Paperbacks ($15-Vol One & $20-Vol Two) - Postage is Included unless you have a SOUTH AFRICAN address. ONLY South Africans need to add $10 Shipping to the purchase.

The VOL TWO LTD EDITION ($25) ships from South Africa; postage is included for SOUTH AFRICAN ADDRESSES ONLY - ROW addresses needs to add $10 Shipping to the purchase.

All Hardcover orders need to add $10 for shipping.

Welcome to Volume Two - 27 New Stories - Available to Pre-Order

Something Wicked is an annual anthology of Science Fiction and Horror, edited by Joe Vaz and Vianne Venter.

Known as the godparent of South African genre fic, Something Wicked has been around in several different formats for nearly seven years.
This is the publication that first published Sarah Lotz; over the years Something Wicked has featured stories by authors such as Lauren Beukes, Richard Kunzmann, Sam Wilson, Abi Godsell and Cat Hellisen, to name just the South Africans.

We're delighted to announce that Something Wicked Anthology of Speculative Fiction, Volume Two, our second annual anthology, is being co-published by eKhaya, who will be handling the digital release and distribution of eBooks.
Volume Two is bursting at the seams with 27 awesome new stories from both established and brand new authors from all over the world. Volume Two features a brain-meltingly beautiful cover illustration by the amazing Vincent Sammy, and interior illustrations for every story by Pierre Smit.

"Joe and Vianne are talent-spotters of writers and illustrators par excellence, and superb editors. Definite recommend!"
- Lauren Beukes

Volume Two marks the official transition of Something Wicked from magazine to annual anthology, featuring brand new stories by writers from South Africa and abroad; seasoned veterens and first-timers brought together in a single book containing tales of post-apocolyptic dystopias, alternate realities, far-future science fiction and good old-fashioned blood-chilling horror.

Let your mind wander across distant galaxies, down darkened alleys, and across oceans of floating cities and let Something Wicked be your guide.
Let the journey begin.

We are thoroughly excited to bring you Volume Two.
Spread The Word. Tell Your Friends!

Volume Two is completed and waiting to go to the printers, all we need is to cover some of the set-up fees to get this sucker on the road to you!

This campaign is basically a pre-order system for Volume Two and an attempt to cover the book setup, proofs and distribution costs.
If you intend to buy Vol Two at some point, you might as well pre-order it from here as you will get major rewards and discounts, including hardcovers which will only be available through this campaign.

In return for your awesomeness we have some pre-order specials, including book bundles, ebook bundles and extremely limted edition hardcovers.

We've also sorted out our shipping fiasco from the Volume One campaign, so this time around Pre-order customers will actually receive their books before they go on sale. Promise :D

  • Bundle Packs: - Buy Bulk and Save! Volume One and Two for a 30% less than cover price (excluding postage)
  • Extremely Limited Edition Hardcovers: - get either or both anthologies in an extremely limited edition hardcover, with dust jacket.
    Hardcovers are ONLY available to backers of this campaign.
  • Entire Something Wicked Magazine digital back-catalague: - Get every single eBook issue of Something Wicked (19 in total) in the format of your choice. (Issues 2, 3 and 9 only available as PDFs)

A bit skint right now? We get it, we're broke too.
Once the book is released The Book Lounge in Cape Town will have copies of the Limited Editions which you'll be able to order.
In the meantime hit those share buttons and spread the word of the Book. Make it so, minions... I mean friends.

story:
Justiz belohnt Polizeigewalt – Engagement gegen Sexismus wird gebüsst


Zwei Dutzend Aktivist_innen protestierten bei der Miss Schweiz Wahl 2014 auf dem Bundesplatz friedlich gegen die sexistische Kommerzshow und die Privatisierung des öffentlichen Raumes. Die Polizei stoppte die Aktion mit Gewalt, transportierten die Aktivist_innen in Handschellen auf den Polizeiposten, wo sie sich – auch die Minderjährigen – nackt ausziehen mussten. Einigen von ihnen wurde ein DNA-Abstrich abgenommen. Zwar hat dieser Polizeieinsatz medial viel zu reden gegeben, doch die Staatsanwalt zog die Möglichkeit, dass die Polizei nicht richtig gehandelt hätte, offenbar nicht mal in Betracht. Während das Verfahren gegen die beteiligten Polizist_innen eingestellt wurde (die Polizist_innen hätten rechtens gehandelt), wurden die volljährigen Aktivist_innen zu einer bedingten Geldstrafe und hohen Gebühren wegen „Hinderung einer Amtshandlung“ verurteilt.

Das lose Bündnis gegen sexistische Kackscheisse sammet nun, um die Busse gegen die Aktivist_innen zu bezahlen. Kein Mensch sollte verurteilt oder gebüsst werden auf Grund eines friedlichen Protestes gegen Sexismus!

story:
¿Qué?

El Capitán Berenjena y los héroes de Alegoría os transportará a mundos mágicos muy parecidos a este.

El reino de Alegoría está a punto de desaparecer de la forma más horrible. La reina, desesperada, ha tratado por todos los medios de localizar a la única persona capaz de ayudarles, pero el Capitán Berenjena ha desaparecido sin dejar rastro y nadie sabe su paradero.

Ante esta terrible situación, y temiendo que algo malo haya podido sucederle, la reina envía a tres extraordinarios jóvenes a buscarle, con la intención de salvar su reino de los diabólicos planes del malvado duque de Morton, un despiadado brujo famoso por su crueldad.

A través de mares, océanos, planetas y galaxias, estos tres maravillosos héroes conocerán a increíbles personajes y vivirán su aventura más épica, unidos por su gran sentido del honor, su lealtad y su amor por Alegoría.

¿Lograrán encontrar al Capitán Berenjena? ¿Conseguirán salvar al reino de Alegoría? En esta nueva aventura, el mayor secreto del famoso capitán pirata será desvelado para siempre. ¿Te atreves a embarcar con nuestros héroes en este fantástico viaje?

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para valorar la aceptación y viabilidad de cada título.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy os presentamos a José Miguel Moras.

Nacido en 1974 en Barcelona, estudió Ingeniería Informática y ha dedicado su carrera profesional a las Tecnologías de la Información y Comunicaciones desde hace más de veinte años. Sin embargo, el título que con mayor ilusión ostenta, es el de ser padre de familia numerosa.

Con su esposa y sus tres pequeños, vive momentos mágicos en el salón de su casa, explicándoles cuentos que hacen volar su imaginación y que les transportan a mundos de fantasía e ilusión. En cierta ocasión, a la hora de la cena, una de aquellas historias les encantó. Se trataba de las hazañas de un extraordinario capitán pirata que tenía un barco mágico con forma de berenjena y que surcaba el espacio infinito. Al comprobar el enorme impacto que las historias del bravo capitán tenían en sus hijos, decidió publicar su primer libro, El Capitán Berenjena, cosechando un gran éxito y reconocimiento por parte del público, y donando todo lo recaudado a una entidad benéfica.

A raíz de aquella maravillosa experiencia, y animado por sus lectores, José Miguel Moras vuelve con esta mágica aventura, que hará las delicias de niños y mayores.

Una vez más, el objetivo del proyecto es totalmente solidario, y todo lo recaudado por el autor será donado íntegramente a una entidad benéfica, porque eso, querido lector, es exactamente lo que haría El Capitán Berenjena.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«Esa noche, tras la enorme explosión, el Capitán Berenjena cayó al mar desde una gran altura. Inmovilizado por el dolor, mientras se hundía en aquellas frías aguas, sintió como si millones de agujas se le clavaran por todo el cuerpo y supo que aquel era el fin. No temía a la muerte, pues no era el final del camino, sino una puerta que se abría ahora ante él. Al otro lado le esperaba su padre y, con tan magnífica compañía, no tenía nada que temer. El silencio y la oscuridad del fondo del mar le transmitían mucha paz. Cerró los ojos y, poco a poco, su corazón dejó de latir»

«Todo comenzó unos días antes, cuando, al alba, la reina Lydia subió las escaleras de la torre más alta del palacio real. Desde allí, entre las almenas, vio partir a tres jinetes que cabalgaban al galope. Al llegar al cruce de la vega, cada uno de ellos tomó una dirección diferente y se alejaron por el horizonte.
            La reina Lydia, muy triste, pensó:
            —Cabalgad, mis queridos heraldos. Encontradlos y transmitidles el mensaje. El reino de Alegoría está en peligro y el destino de todos nosotros está ahora en vuestras manos.
            Después, agarró fuertemente el colgante de su pecho y, mirando al cielo, dijo:
            —Capitán Berenjena, ¿por qué no vienes a ayudarnos? —y se puso a llorar amargamente, para dar salida al inmenso dolor que sentía en su corazón»

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 840€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de El Capitán Berenjena y los héroes de Alegoría que saldría después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y José Miguel Moras vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

El reino de Alegoría está a punto de desaparecer de la forma más horrible. La reina, desesperada, ha tratado por todos los medios de localizar a la única persona capaz de ayudarles, pero el Capitán Berenjena ha desaparecido sin dejar rastro y nadie sabe su paradero.
Ante esta terrible situación, y temiendo que algo malo haya podido sucederle, la reina envía a tres extraordinarios jóvenes a buscarle, con la intención de salvar su reino de los diabólicos planes del malvado duque de Morton, un despiadado brujo famoso por su crueldad.
A través de mares, océanos, planetas y galaxias, estos tres maravillosos héroes conocerán a increíbles personajes y vivirán su aventura más épica, unidos por su gran sentido del honor, su lealtad y su amor por Alegoría.
¿Lograrán encontrar al Capitán Berenjena? ¿Conseguirán salvar al reino de Alegoría? En esta nueva aventura, el mayor secreto del famoso capitán pirata será desvelado para siempre. ¿Te atreves a embarcar con nuestros héroes en este fantástico viaje?
¿Quiénes?
Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para valorar la aceptación y viabilidad de cada título.
De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.
Hoy os presentamos a José Miguel Moras.
Nacido en 1974 en Barcelona, estudió Ingeniería Informática y ha dedicado su carrera profesional a las Tecnologías de la Información y Comunicaciones desde hace más de veinte años. Sin embargo, el título que con mayor ilusión ostenta, es el de ser padre de familia numerosa.
Con su esposa y sus tres pequeños, vive momentos mágicos en el salón de su casa, explicándoles cuentos que hacen volar su imaginación y que les transportan a mundos de fantasía e ilusión. En cierta ocasión, a la hora de la cena, una de aquellas historias les encantó. Se trataba de las hazañas de un extraordinario capitán pirata que tenía un barco mágico con forma de berenjena y que surcaba el espacio infinito. Al comprobar el enorme impacto que las historias del bravo capitán tenían en sus hijos, decidió publicar su primer libro, El Capitán Berenjena, cosechando un gran éxito y reconocimiento por parte del público, y donando todo lo recaudado a una entidad benéfica.
A raíz de aquella maravillosa experiencia, y animado por sus lectores, José Miguel Moras vuelve con esta mágica aventura, que hará las delicias de niños y mayores.
Una vez más, el objetivo del proyecto es totalmente solidario, y todo lo recaudado por el autor será donado íntegramente a una entidad benéfica, porque eso, querido lector, es exactamente lo que haría El Capitán Berenjena.
¿Por qué?
Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:
«Esa noche, tras la enorme explosión, el Capitán Berenjena cayó al mar desde una gran altura. Inmovilizado por el dolor, mientras se hundía en aquellas frías aguas, sintió como si millones de agujas se le clavaran por todo el cuerpo y supo que aquel era el fin. No temía a la muerte, pues no era el final del camino, sino una puerta que se abría ahora ante él. Al otro lado le esperaba su padre y, con tan magnífica compañía, no tenía nada que temer. El silencio y la oscuridad del fondo del mar le transmitían mucha paz. Cerró los ojos y, poco a poco, su corazón dejó de latir»
«Todo comenzó unos días antes, cuando, al alba, la reina Lydia subió las escaleras de la torre más alta del palacio real. Desde allí, entre las almenas, vio partir a tres jinetes que cabalgaban al galope. Al llegar al cruce de la vega, cada uno de ellos tomó una dirección diferente y se alejaron por el horizonte.            La reina Lydia, muy triste, pensó:            —Cabalgad, mis queridos heraldos. Encontradlos y transmitidles el mensaje. El reino de Alegoría está en peligro y el destino de todos nosotros está ahora en vuestras manos.            Después, agarró fuertemente el colgante de su pecho y, mirando al cielo, dijo:            —Capitán Berenjena, ¿por qué no vienes a ayudarnos? —y se puso a llorar amargamente, para dar salida al inmenso dolor que sentía en su corazón»
¿Cómo?
Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 840€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de El Capitán Berenjena y los héroes de Alegoría que saldría después a la venta.
Además...
Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y José Miguel Moras vea publicada su obra.
Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
About the Book

In their first book, siblings Abby and Jamie uncovered a long-lost treasure and earned themselves the title of "The Delaware Detectives."  Now, the brother and sister are back, and they've been charged with the task of finding a missing person.  Utilizing every tool at their disposal, including their newfound teamwork, Abby and Jamie work hard to find and decipher the clues, but the trail doesn't lead where they expect, and before long, the siblings despair of ever solving the mystery.

 

About the Author

My name is Dana Rongione, and I am the author of four Christian Living titles, three children's books and two self-help titles.  Additionally, I have written hundreds of articles and devotionals and am the creator and author of three blogs.  Before becoming a writer, I spent nine years as a teacher of kindergarten and lower elementary.  In addition to my writing, I currently teach a few Elementary Education classes at a local Bible college as well as the ladies' Sunday School class at my church, Bible Baptist Church in Pickens, SC.
 
On a more personal note, I am a chocoholic and a worry wart.  I love to read and to learn new things.  I enjoy hiking with my husband of 16 years and our two dogs.  I also have a great appreciation for music and try to express that appreciation by implementing my skills at the piano.
 
You can find out more about me and my work by visiting my website, www.DanaRongione.com.
 

Why Am I Writing This Book?

As an avid reader, it didn't take me long to notice a gap in good literature for children between the ages of 8 and 14.  Many of the works that are available are either goofy and lack any real plot (i.e. they are "dumbed down") or are filled with negative aspects such as foul language, violence, disrespect and other poor behavior.  When I decided to write the first Delaware Detectives novel, I wanted to fill that literary void with a book that would engage middle-grade readers while instilling a peace of mind in their parents about their child's choice of reading material.
 
At the end of the first novel, I left the story open to the possibility of a sequel, but to be honest, I had little intention of creating a mystery series.  However, the success of the first novel and the subsequent requests for a sequel caused me to re-evaluate my plans.  And that, my friends, is where you come in.  I'm ready to write the next book, but I need your help.
 

How Far Along Are You?

I have recently finished my fifth Christian Living book and am now ready to turn my full attention to this second book in The Delaware Detectives series.  The book has been plotted and researched, but I have not yet written a word.  I hope to spend the next few months writing and re-writing this compelling story that is bound to have readers on the edge of their seats.  My goal is to have the book finished and available for purchase by the end of the year, but only the Lord knows what the future holds and whether or not I'll be able to meet that deadline.  Still, I plan to give it my all!

 

Why Do You Need Money?

To write a book, all I need is my computer, a word-processing program, time and a few energy drinks here and there. . . oh, and chocolate.  To publish a book, on the other hand, can get very expensive.  First, I need to hire an editor to make sure the book is error free and doesn't possess logic gaps and plot holes.  Second, I need to hire an illustrator for the interior drawings and the cover.  Third, I'll need to have the book formatted for paperback, ePub and Kindle.  Fourth, I need money to market the book once it's available, as well as to purchase copies of the book to take to book signings, workshops and the like.  As you can see, the cost adds up quickly, and that's why I'm asking for your help.  I promise you that every dime you donate will go toward the production and/or marketing of this book.  And if, by God's grace, I'm able to raise above and beyond my goal, the additional funds will allow me to take the research trip I long to take to Delaware to make sure all my facts are accurate and that I have a firsthand view of the layout of the land for a very special scene toward the end of the story.  You can help make this possible!
 

What If I Can't Afford to Donate?

I understand that some of you may not be able to help financially.  That's fine.  Times are hard, and I truly understand that.  We've searched through the couch cushions for spare change a few times ourselves.  But if you can't afford to give anything, would you please consider helping in one of these other ways:

Pray for me - Your prayers mean the world to me, and they may mean the difference between failure and success in this campaign.

Spread the word - You have friends, and they have friends.  Will you help spread the word about this campaign and the book I'm writing?  Tell the guys at work.  Mention it to the kids at school.  Paste a link or two on your favorite social media platform.  Please just help me get the word out.  Indiegogo has some awesome share tools you can use to making sharing that much easier.

 

What Do I Get Out of All This?


First off, you get the knowledge that you are taking part in providing good literature for boys and girls who deserve to have something worth reading.  Second, I am offering a variety of gifts at different donation levels.  To see a detailed listing, view the "Perks" section to the right.  All donors will have their names listed in the acknowledgment section of the book.

First off, you get the knowledge that you are taking part in providing good literature for boys and girls who deserve to have something worth reading.  Second, I am offering a variety of gifts at different donation levels.  To see a detailed listing, view the "Perks" section to the right.  All donors will have their names listed in the acknowledgment section of the book.

story:
What is it?

"Sayings of a Wise Man" is a collection of life sayings and explanations that brings a new, honest, funny, and raw take on various subjects ranging from religion to success to relationships and just general life and wisdom.  Every saying, from proverbs to guidelines, are layered (meanning they have more than one meaning), and this has been designed and written with psychology in mind to inspire people to think and develop a different perspective...

 

What's Different About It?

First, it is honest.  From the funny sayings to the ones more controversial, this book is honest and hard to argue with.  

Second, we say what others are afraid to.  This book hasn't really been edited so much as it's been organized.  The sayings were written, whenever they hit, then reorganized by subject (that's it - raw).  We hit people with the cold, hard truth, because "Ignorance is always bliss, until we wish we knew the truth."

Third, we like to laugh! :-)  Some sayings are blatantly funny; some are subtle (wait 10 seconds, then crack a smile kind of humor).  This is loaded and layered with all brands of humor (witticism, satire, innuendo, wordplay, etc.).  A few examples are:  "People may say, 'You're a trip...  Personally, I prefer 'vacation"  and  "I relate the truth to great sex...  sometimes it hurts."

Fourth, these sayings are hard to argue with.  Some may not win us any friends, but they're honest and accurate (to anyone who does their research or puts any serious thought in).

 

What Do You Get?

First and foremost, you'll feel better!  Followed by the satisfaction that you helped bring knowledge and wisdom to the masses (we're being optimists here...  they have to pick up a book first).

Second, you will get an e-mail copy of the eBook, including illustrations.

You will also gain access to the sayings we knew would cause some havoc (we're edgy; however, we're not suicidal).  If you donate high enough, you will also be offered the opportunity of sending us a "Your Review" (up to 30 words) and finding your name under the list of contributors (we say "offer", because some people aren't bold enough to have their name in this book... but we can always see about adding it later, if you like :-).  

 

Risks & Challenges

The greatest challenge for any author is people.  The goal for authors is to gain enough popularity for a publisher to want to pick up their book and put it on bookshelves, after which the author needs to maintain the momentum with interviews, radio shows, and online SEO and marketing, including social media.  We have a team with a strategy to overcome all of these obstacles, but we need capital to pull it off.

 

 

** FREE Stuff **

Below is a free sample of the boot, and if you check the gallery, you will find Facebook-ready quotes.  Just "right click" and "copy link URL" then paste... OR click the button below and SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN!!!

 

 

Sample of Book

Check out a sample of the book at the bottom of the "Gallery" section or just click http://d2oadd98wnjs7n.cloudfront.net/medias/493122/files/20121016140310-Sample_Book_IndieGoGo.pdf?1350421390 

Help us make this happen!

 

 

Contact:

You can find and "friend" me on Facebook (Sean Heupel) or visit my blog at www.DateDoctorSean.com.  I accept all friend requests, and you can message me directly.

story:
YouTube info video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_QxeBfU-Brk

Perk spotlight: What is the Love Beyond Life soundtrack? http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TTbhoOlUmi0&noredirect=1  
   * the Love Beyond Life soundtrack goes for FREE to the first 10 pledgers, no matter what package they select


Perk spotlight: Valentine's Day card http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=U9dEagjsayU&feature=youtu.be

 

Short Summary

Even though the new Acclaimed Apocalypse edition of Love Beyond Life was ready on December 21st, 2012, I thought it would be a great idea to pair it with a brand new AVA-themed Valentine's Day card and Written in the Stars t-shirt, and release all of this 3 weeks before Valentine's Day, letting people get the perfect gift for their boyfriend, girlfriend, fiance, spouse, dog, what have you. Anyone who loves AVA and Love Beyond Life will surely treasure this unique Valentine's Day gift, and the greeting card with an AVA themed poem that ends with the line "I love you beyond life" will surely win you over in their hearts. Don't miss out!

Also, this campaign will feature the release of our new Call to Arms / Love Beyond Life themed zip hoodie. Perfect for this chilly winter weather and the on-coming spring season!

Most of you know me, the author Jeffrey A Brown through the facebook page, but if by the grace of God you just happen to have stumbled upon this campaign, allow me to introduce myself and my work. I wrote Love Beyond Life, a novel, as my honor's thesis to graduate from UMass Dartmouth. It was my attempt to blend the fields of Psychology and Quantum Physics in a universe of adventure, exploration and excitement that takes you along a reality-shifting journey, all the while plugging my research into the narrative to make the read both an enjoyable time and enriching, learning experience as well.

Since Love Beyond Life involves the 2012 Apocalypse, I decided to make a special Apocalypse edition. We call this the Acclaimed Apocalypse edition because it features commentary and reveiws from people all over the world. Also, now that Love Beyond Life is a 4 part novel series, this new edition of book one features an all new excerpt in the back of Love Beyond Life book two, which will not be available until 2014. That's more than 10 pages of all new content!

 

What We Need & What You Get

I am using this campaign for several purposes:

  • to get a bulk order of new edition books placed
  • feature special Valentine's Day packages
  • introduce the new Call to Arms themed zip-hoodie
  • give you the chance to get hard to find, out of production Merch as well!

There are a lot of perks listed below, as well as a graph to help you decide which package is best for you. The goal is to get $777, mostly because that is a cool number, but also because it will get a lot of books out there and produced as well. If, in the sad event, we do not reach $777, you will still get what you pledge for, as a lot of bulk orders are customizable. However, in all honestly I hope we go above and beyond $777. With your help, this can be possible!

See this chart to help you find which package is best for you:

 

 Shipping

Please be aware that perk prices do not include shipping. To make sure that no one overpays for shipping, we will be doing shipping charges as a separate transaction when your package is bundled, weighed in exact amount and ready to go out to you. Everything will be shipping from Rhode Island, but international shipping is still possible. If you would like to know what you are looking at for shipping to your area before pledging, please just message me, either through here or on the facebook Love Beyond Life page, what package you would like and where you are located. I will get an estimate cost out to you so you can know what to expect before pledging. Thanks! 

 


The Impact

This book, and these items, will have a great impact on the world. As you will tell by reading the commentary from various readers throughout the world in the opening pages, this book has a tremendous impact and changes lives forever on after reading.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute? No problem, there are still ways to help: 

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about this coampaign! the more exposure this gets, the better! Facebook, twitter, email, whatever you can do to share the link!

This book, and these items, will have a great impact on the world. As you will tell by reading the commentary from various readers throughout the world in the opening pages, this book has a tremendous impact and changes lives forever on after reading.
 


Other Ways You Can Help
Can't contribute? No problem, there are still ways to help: 

Please get the word out and make some noise about this coampaign! the more exposure this gets, the better! Facebook, twitter, email, whatever you can do to share the link!

story:
My book was written primarily for three reasons:

a. I have terminal cancer and need better insurance-I also need an income to carry me through the rough times

b. My share of the profits from the book upon my demise will be set up in a Trust for the College Education for my four grandsons (that has already been created by Steve Carvel, Esq.)

c. Percentages of my book will be allocated to the character Angela and some friends who have basically assisted me in business and provided supportive friendships during my lifetime

Lady On Top

My book, entitled “Lady on Top” is an unapologetic perspective into the transitioning world from innocence, prostitution, high end call girl and finally a highly reputed Madam in Las Vegas. The story is a glimpse into the world of Angela and the motivation that propels her into the world of prostitution, drugs, and murder. The character Angela is a composite character based on a Madam who has been my client and friend for over twenty years. You watch her travel from anonymity to being renowned in her society. You feel her agony, ambition, and fiery passion reserved for her family. Angela, like all prostitutes, did not wake up in the morning at 4 years old and decide to become the most sought after Madame/Call Girl in Vegas for 20 plus years. It was an evolution of self, in response to abuse, exploitation, and rape. Yet she survived, proud and unashamed of the path she chose. It was a response and a choice to end the ongoing misery of being powerless in her world.

The real Angela catered to the Hollywood Elite, Politicians, a President, and CEO’s, from all over the world. There is an EU rating system and she was at the top. One might ponder the question, “what sequence of events would project beautiful and talented women into this role?” This book removes the veil. Due to my friendship with the character Angela, I have had many clients who were prostitutes. Our relationship provided me with a great deal of insight which I am sharing with you, the reader. I will say, I cared about all of them. In their own ways they were quite fragile. If you consider the trepidation and timidity that most women experience in their first encounter with their lovers, you will appreciate that they have to numb themselves or have become numb through life experiences to be capable of this service in the nude.

Self motivation propelled my proactive approach to my dilemma 

My reason for pursuing the avenue of crowdfunding is that I believed I had a reliable publisher and her company bankrupted. I do not have time to start over seeking a publisher, literary agent, and wait. My time is limited as well as my choices. This is not a story about cancer, nor is it a story about me. It is a vehicle which I knew would be marketable and sustain me, as well as serve a greater purpose for my grandsons. 

Do I lay down and die or stand up and finish the race running?

This book depicts the tenacity of a relentless spirit. The commonality, between the character Angela and I, is a dogged determination to survive. She rose above the shackles of victimization and I above the cancer. We both ran our race to the end…Like the character Angela, I have made a choice to be proactive on my journey and do the best I can to be self-sustaining.

Again, any income generated from this website will be utilized to sustain me in my effort to self-market, self –publish, and document my journey as I interface with my readers across the country. I will need to update my Hyundai Sonata, a videographer, and funds for the process because I am driving from Los Angeles all the way to New York, Florida and Washington. I am on a mission to make this work. For any contributor of $5,000 or more, I will personally drive to your city, at my expense. I will take you to dinner and have a book signing for your friends. The book has been completed. The objective on this site is to support publishing, marketing, and documentation.

Life is about taking a bushel of lemons and making the best lemonade

In conclusion, I am willing to prove to any interested party, that there is indeed a book and I am terminal. I have managed to survive without chemotherapy and radiation, by utilizing a holistic approach to my illness, a regimen that I have designed. My oncologist recently told me that she never believed I would survive after the surgery without chemo for more than six months. It has been 2 ½ years. She calls me her miracle patient. Like I said, I am on a mission! Thank you for your interest!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about your my campaign.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!
All people involved with this book welcome the presence of a Literary Agent or Publisher. As stipulated in the introduction, the Publisher originally involved with the project, who loved the book, went bankrupt. The urgency is due to my health issues.

Thank you for your interest!!
