story:
Help us make a full-color pre-school book that children gravitate to read about making new friends; in addition, each page teaches them a real-life lesson in playing safely. Our kids play at their own risk, but we can help alleviate unnecessary injuries by giving them examples through full-color illustrations they can see for themselves.  We are all protectors of children.  How far would you go to protect your toddler?  See how one Chinese father leaps out of a moving car to save his daughter: http://tinyurl.com/kju6v42  Could an illustrated child’s book teaching the child not to travel from the back seat to the front while the car is in motion have helped to prevent this accident?

 

The Why:

 

This proposed project came about due to my observation and study of pre-schooler’s injuries while playing.  Initially I felt like writing a fun book with lots of smiles and good times and then it occurred to me how many children when playing get hurt so I began to see that I wanted to present a colorful fun book that taught young children about being safe while playing.  Why shouldn’t children have fun and at the same time learn how to prevent injuries?

 

In just four areas, drowning, falls, impact and bites there are thousands injured each year.  The CDC, Center for Disease Control and Prevention, according to a 2008 estimate of nonfatal injuries treated in emergency rooms, an estimated 878,000 children between ages 1 and 4 were admitted as a result of falling.

 

Impact injuries occur by a child being struck by something or having a disagreement with another child.  Over 371,000 children were admitted in 2008 due to impact injuries.  This book depicts children playing with one another, learning that friends have fun sharing toys not using them as a weapon to hit.  Another example is drowning.  Children can have fun with friends but in this colorful book they’ll actually see their friends wearing safety jackets around water and never going into the water without an adult around.

 

What Is The Book About?

 

‘Making Friends Is Fun – Play and Be Safe’ shows the children in the book addressing each other on how to be safe, rather than hearing it from their parents or another adult.  This way, the parent can read the book to the child and not be the bad guy, giving orders on staying away from bee hives and not playing too close to the fire pit.  Children love to learn from other children as well as discover things on their own.  They like to see and do what other children do.

 

Like all picture books ‘Making Friends Is Fun-Play and Be Safe’ is meant to be read to a child and give the adult reader the opportunity to fill in as much detail as you would like about staying safe while having fun.  So as a parent you and your child or grandchild can enjoy this book together and you know they are getting more than just fun from the read.  They’ll want to read it over and over again and each time building the safety concept in their little minds.  You will experience them sharing this book with other children and explaining to them what they learned about being safe.

 

Why Me?

 

Can I produce this, am I capable?  Yes.  The text is almost complete.  I majored in Child Psychology and Child Development in college, but more than that I’m a certified life coach with many years of mentoring and coaching behind me.  So, I’m one who believes experience plus wisdom and common sense is the best teacher, not just book knowledge.  I’ve worked with young children, young adults as well as coached individuals and groups for over 25 years.  In a couple of bonuses check out the coaching reward I’ve included for your child or a child of your choice.  I’ve authored two eBooks, but this project must be more than an eBook, children need to place this in their hands and turn the pages and feel the words as well as see them.  Simply because the message contained within the pages is a universal one.  It’s an awareness journey driven by the passion that unites us all; love, commitment, and protection along with adventure.  It’s about safety and comfort and it’s about the greatest gift of all, our children.

 

I’m a writer at heart and second I’m an advocate for what’s right; but this is more than just a book.  I could take the easy route and just leave it as an eBook, but how many children would see it, read it, experience it?  Let me level with you.  My children are grown.  My grandchildren are too.  This isn’t about me, this book is about your children and your grandchildren and all those children out there who are going to read the books.  Why not give them one that lights up their face as well as keep them safer?

 

I’m going down the harder and more rewarding route.  I’m taking a raw manuscript through the various stages of editing, design, illustration and development or publishing. But I don’t want to do it alone.  Insider access and input is important to me and this project.  Even though the format of the book has been decided, I am open to additional feedback so share your child activity/safety scenarios with me and let’s do this project for the little ones.

 

Oh, and one more thing, I don’t believe we’re limited to reaching children with just one model of service. We believe adding a one-on-one personal coaching model means we can, together, reach more children, including troubled, abused and bullied little ones. We have then an opportunity to build their self-esteem while eliminating old patterns of verbal and/or physical destruction.  This is why I’ve added the personal coaching reward to a couple of tiers because I feel your child can add his or her strength to this book with their own words of encouragement.  Who knows which child will eventually read this book and gain strength and purpose because your child dropped a nugget of truth for another child in the pages reserved for these important thoughts?   

 

Why Indiegogo?

 

People are busy mainly in 3 areas:

  • Living their lives
  • Investing time in their families
  • Contributing to society

 

The challenge is getting this book on paper and in the hands of as many children as possible.  Indiegogo is our way to organize the contributors who also feel this book will benefit the young children who play daily somewhere and need to incorporate safety with fun.  Indiegogo is a way for us to take hands together and contribute to society while benefiting your own family with rewards at the same time.  Indiegogo coordinates and it amplifies.  Partner with us to get this project out and when we do, our children prosper as well as our neighbors children.   I am so incredibly grateful for you. Every dollar you give will make this happen.

 

 

A Peek at Rewards :

 

The fun part of giving for me is to see contributors receiving rewards for their heartfelt partnership.  So we’ve compiled some rewards we feel will please you as well as your children. If you live outside the US/Canada please add $25 for shipping cost to your pledge, that would help us alot to get things to you. Thank you.

 

eBooks:

 

Rewards will begin at the lower level and receive an eBook copy of ‘Making Friends Is Fun-Play and Be Safe.’

 

Full Color soft-bound book:

 

We will send soft-cover books

 

T-Shirts:

 

The T-shirts will be full-color printed shirts with the ‘Making Friends Is Fun’ book cover illustration on the front. Your pre-schooler will love wearing this shirt to play or even to sleep in.

 

Soft-Cover Books:

 

Autographed books by the author.   Many perks are addressed to your child by name

 

Soft-Cover Books with your child’s name:

 

Autographed books by the author addressed to the child by name, plus you will have your child’s name, or child of your choice, in the ‘Thank You’ section of the book.

 

Soft Cover with bonuses:

 

Soft-Cover books with child’s name, plus his /her name in the ‘Thank You’ section, plus an audio CD of the entire book narrated by the author.  Limited edition, not available to the public.

 

The Platinum Rewards- Personal Coaching:

 

With these rewards you will receive a coaching session by the author, Susan David, for your child or child of your choice. Coaching will be achieved through Skype or by phone. The amount of time depends on the perk you choose.  Coaching can be about fun things, playing safe or anything the child chooses to talk about.  Also there is one super bonus reward where your child could actually have an interview with the author about what’s special to him/her and that will be included in the book.  Check it out!

 

Combo Rewards:

 

Take a look at the rewards section to see how you can receive several different rewards in one package.

What We Will Do With the Funds:

If we meet our goal, we will cover all the basic expenses to get this book out: If we go over the goal we will begin Series 2 and do our best to continue each series up to 5 safety books.

·Book Layout and Cover Design – Mickey Root

·Illustrator- I’ve used 3 illustrators/  we’re  hoping for a 24 page illustrated book

·Editor-

- ISBN #'s -

·Publisher–Susan David through Amazon

·Printer– Create Space does soft-cover books, standard color

Business filings:

·Updating the website- to include the new children's book + videos

·eBooks– we will send gift copies

·CD’s (audio of the entire book, including the children’s voices of higher tiers) Susan will narrate the entire book- CD's and CD covers vary in cost. We will go with standard pricing.

·T-shirts– printed by Vistaprint.com and/or other online artist

·Shipping charges- vary depending on weight and size

SPECIAL NOTE:  Quite frankly with everything we need to cover it may take more than the $6000 we’re asking in the Indiegogo goal.   We’re trying to be realistic and at the same time not exaggerate.  One thought that is exciting is, if we go over the goal, the more the better because the funds available can now be used to produce the second volume, Series 2 of the fun and safety read for young children.  Our long-term goal of course is to see a series of 3-5 books available since there is much to cover in illustrating this need.  Fund raising and outreach will help secure the long-term viability of the project and that aspect always consumes more money. Remember, the more safety children’s books we can get out with numerous illustrations the greater picture we create in the minds of our children toward a safer environment.  So, know that the desire of this project is to over-fund in order to accomplish just that.  

 

Risks and Challenges:

 

If we reach our goal we will certainly have a lot of packages to send to you.   The greatest challenge would be to get the illustrator to deliver the rest of the illustrations in a timely manner.  I do have a commitment and we are on schedule thus far with several illustrations delivered. J The text itself has been completed and ready for editing. So this is looking good!

 

With respect to rewards fulfillment, we will be working with professional fulfillment partners such as Create Space for the printed book copies; they are owned by Amazon and their children’s books are of high quality.  A T-shirt and CD company and for the digital downloads.  I will personally email to gather T-shirt sizes and schedule all coaching sessions to coordinate with your schedule so your time slot is convenient and timely.

 

I’ll be sending regular updates about our progress to all backers, so you’ll be the first to know about what’s going on.  We will make sure all rewards are delivered safely and on schedule.

 

Important Information About Rewards:

 

Distribution schedule is not finalized; once we’re funded I will keep all backers in the loop about the book and the rewards, we promise to keep you posted by email and will work diligently to see that all rewards are delivered as soon as we can after the close of the project.

 

The End Result:

 

The end result of this adventure will be creating and featuring a fun time for young children through a reading experience that will give us safer kids as they engage. We are not limited to reaching children with just one model of service, that’s why we’ve added a one-on-one personal coaching model to some of our rewards.  This means we can, together, reach more children, including troubled, abused and bullied little ones.  We have then an opportunity to build their self-esteem while eliminating old patterns of verbal and/or physical destruction.   How many children would you like to reach?  Anything you can kick-in helps make this happen. Yes, we need the money, but we also need your energy and enthusiasm, your thoughts and ideas.  Help us get this out and known by posting this campaign on Facebook and Twitter as well as to your email list.  We promise you this: every dollar you give us will be put to work crafting a unique children’s book you’ll be proud you were a part of.  Thank you for making it happen and for spreading the word.  Please check out the awesome rewards we have for you as our thank you.

With respect to rewards fulfillment, we will be working with professional fulfillment partners such as Create Space for the printed book copies; they are owned by Amazon and their children’s books are of high quality.  A T-shirt and CD company and for the digital downloads.  I will personally email to gather T-shirt sizes and schedule all coaching sessions to coordinate with your schedule so your time slot is convenient and timely.
 
I’ll be sending regular updates about our progress to all backers, so you’ll be the first to know about what’s going on.  We will make sure all rewards are delivered safely and on schedule.
 
Important Information About Rewards:
 
Distribution schedule is not finalized; once we’re funded I will keep all backers in the loop about the book and the rewards, we promise to keep you posted by email and will work diligently to see that all rewards are delivered as soon as we can after the close of the project.
 
The End Result:
 
The end result of this adventure will be creating and featuring a fun time for young children through a reading experience that will give us safer kids as they engage. We are not limited to reaching children with just one model of service, that’s why we’ve added a one-on-one personal coaching model to some of our rewards.  This means we can, together, reach more children, including troubled, abused and bullied little ones.  We have then an opportunity to build their self-esteem while eliminating old patterns of verbal and/or physical destruction.   How many children would you like to reach?  Anything you can kick-in helps make this happen. Yes, we need the money, but we also need your energy and enthusiasm, your thoughts and ideas.  Help us get this out and known by posting this campaign on Facebook and Twitter as well as to your email list.  We promise you this: every dollar you give us will be put to work crafting a unique children’s book you’ll be proud you were a part of.  Thank you for making it happen and for spreading the word.  Please check out the awesome rewards we have for you as our thank you.

story:
Contribute to the Publication of an Amazing Endeavor: "Lessons from a Southern Mother"

When my mother passed away earlier this year, I was left with a huge void in my personal life. I've found the best way to fill that void is through creativity and especially by reflecting artistically the importance the person who once occupied that emotional spot carried. I began bouncing around ideas for a children's book that would list all of the great lessons a mother would teach to a son growing up in the South and within a few weeks, the project took off.

"Lessons from a Southern Mother" is scheduled for a release in Fall 2014. The book is written by yours' truly, Alex Beene, and is illustrated by Danny Martin. Oxford University Press will be publishing the book, and, I'm happy to announce, a copy will be among one of a handful of children's books to be officially registered in Oxford University's historic and prestigious campus library in 2014. We're extremely excited about this endeavor and wanted to be able to include our family, friends and really anyone with a passion for the South in on this project. That's why this funding initiative was launched.

"Lessons from a Southern Mother" will be available for sale through Amazon, Barnes & Noble, Books-a-Million, and various local bookstores throughout the South this fall. The book will also be available for digital purchase through Amazon Kindle and iBooks on the iTunes store.


Why we're raising funds & how you're rewarded

The idea for seeking financial backing for this project came not just out of a monetary need to cover publishing and marketing costs. We wanted family, friends and anyone with a love for all things Southern to have the opportunity to contribute to the making of the book. All funds raised will go toward the initial printing and marketing fees associated with the project. What do you get for your support? Some really amazing things, including :

  • Recognition in the book itself in our "Special Thanks" section. Get your name immortalized in print for supporting our project. This reward is given to all those that contribute at the Silver, Gold and Platinum levels!
  • All levels will also receive a special personal message of thanks from the book's writer Alex Beene, as well as two tickets to the launch party of the book to be held in Tennessee in fall 2014.
  • Gold sponsors will receive one of the first printed copies of the book, to be shipped this fall.
  • Platinum sponsors are in for a real treat: a personal self-portrait drawn by our illustrator, Danny Martin! Check for more details in the "Perks" section.



Meet Our Team!

Alex Beene is an author, journalist and college mentor from Tennessee. A constant traveler and advocate for global human rights, he's been to over 20 countries and has a degree in TESL from the University of California, Los Angeles. His work has been featured in various publications throughout the Southeastern United States, where he received his B.A. and M.A. in Journalism from the University of Mississippi.

Danny Martin is an artist and graphic designer for Bramblett Group. Originally from Tampa, Florida, Martin graduated from Freed-Hardeman University in Henderson, Tenn. Heavily praised for his unique artwork style, his work has been featured in various galleries and advertisements. 

Dr. Charlotte Fisher is the assistant Superintendent for Tipton County Schools in Tennessee. An advocate for education and economic development, she has received numerous awards for her work, including the 2012 Keepers of the Dream Award and the Outstanding African American Educator Award.

Joshua Sells is a photographer based in Henderson, Tenn. Known as one of the best young photographers in the South, he has won numerous photography contests and has had his work featured publicly within West Tennessee. He currently attends Freed-Hardeman University.

story:
Breaking up is hard to do...

But we're doing it anyway! 

In 2014, Big Pulp - the magazine of SF, fantasy, mystery, horror, and romance - is breaking out into three new publications! We're still publishing the high-quality fantastic fiction you've come to expect under the Big Pulp banner, but now it will be easier to find your favorites! 


In March, we'll debut the first issue of Child of Words, our science fiction and fantasy magazine, featuring work by Michael Andre-Druissi; Betsy Dornbusch; Adele Gardner; Fi Mitchell; DeAnna Knippling; Charles Leggett; WC Roberts; Selina Rosen; Stephen Ross; Ian Smith; Bonnie Jo Stufflebeam; John F.D. Taff; and Neil Weston.

Then in May, we'll have the premiere of M - the magazine of murder and the macabre, with work by Steve Passey; Helen Wurthman; Robert Laughlin; Shannon Schuren; Don Norum; Simon Perchik; Jake Walters; Ron Larson; Ellen Larson; Katrina Ray-Saulis; Stephen Rogers; Philip Roberts; and Wolf Hartman. 

Finally, in July, we'll turn up the heat with Thirst, our magazine of dark romance and obsession, featuring the passions of Virgina Aronson; Bruce Golden; Gerri Leen; Charles Leggett; Lyn Lifshin; Chris Longhurst;Jennifer Povey; Terrie Leigh Relf; Wayne Scheer; Karissa Sluss; Gene Stewart; J.S. Watts; and Nu Yang.

Our second issues of Child of Words and M will follow in September and November, respectively, SF&F by Alexander Burns; Willis Couvillier; Mira Desai; Conda Douglas; Daniel Galef; Shane Gavin; Tony Haynes; Shaun McCoy; Robert Quinlivan; L.B. Sedlacek; and Clay Waters; and horror and mystery from John Bruni; David Hagerty; Terrie Leigh Relf; F.J. Bergmann; Joanna Weston; Dean Blanchard; Holly Day; Meghan Carter; James Reed; Brian Leopold; and Joseph Tomaras.

Child of Words, M, and Thirst are published in magazine format (approx 7x10), with 48 pages of great fiction and poetry in each issue! 

About Big Pulp

For five years, Big Pulp has been carving out an independent niche in the publishing world, where story matters and writers get paid for their work. Since we launched in 2008, we've dreamed of having enough different publications to fill an entire newsstand, and representing the widest possible selection of fiction, from SF and fantasy, to horror and mystery, true crime, jungle tales, super-heroes, romance, weird western, and on and on. 

In 2014, we're taking the next steps to making that dream a reality. 

Do you like stories? Got 10 or 20 or 40 bucks? You're halfway there! 

What it means to us

Without you, we're nothing. 

Without subscribers, Big Pulp is just a pile of books in a box. Without readers, our writers are…well, they're still writers, but I'm sure they'd agree it's a lot more fun with readers than without. 

Sales are our lifeline. Period. Every perk gets a magazine or a collection of publications. Every dollar goes to paying our writers and artists and printing the magazine.

What We Need & What You Get

$2000 buys a lot for a small press, including dozens of writer payments and a healthy print run for our magazines. 

All our editorial work - site maintenance, editing and proofreading, sales & events - is done pro bono. Every dollar raised through the campaign will go back into running the website, publishing the magazine, and paying contributors. No exceptions. 

Every perk has a publication attached! None of that "eternal gratitude" stuff, although we'll give you that, too. But our goal is to put a magazine or three into your hands. 

Stretch goals

  • If we make $4,000, every backer will receive a back issue of Big Pulp! 
  • If we make $6,000, we'll announce a new anthology for 2014 and open up submissions! 
  • If we make $10,000, we'll flee to Mexico…I mean…announce another big project or two…probably. From Mexico. 

FAQ:

Do you ship outside the USA or Canada?

Yes! Please add $10 to cover all shipments outside the USA and Canada.

Do you have any information about your currently available titles?

Yes! Click on each title for more information: Clones, Fairies & Monsters in the Closet; APESHIT; and The Kennedy Curse.

When will I get my rewards?

Subscribers will receive issues as they are published - Child of Words in March and September; M in May and November; and Thirst in July. If you purchase the Christmas gift set, the anthology of your choice will be mailed in time for the holidays.

No $$$? We're cool. 

We know that not everyone has dough to throw around. We've been there. But, it doesn't cost a dime to help spread the word! 

Can you help us find 50 new readers? Tell your friends! 

If you're a writer and want to help keep a paying market in print, make some noise! 

The sharing tools make it easy to help spread the word through e-mail, Facebook, Twitter or your own web site. Tell your friends!

story:
Visit:Ricardo Galvez Photography

For more information about the project, visit: University of Southern California ASB El Salvador

Short Summary

I am a conceptual portrait artist and wedding photographer based in Los Angeles, CA. I have been doing photography for about three years, and throughout those three years, I did nothing but searched for opportunities to grow--learning things from the "trial and error" process and developing accordingly. I have fortunately been published in: VOGUE Italia, Arizona Foothills Magazine, Discover the Region Magazine, azTeen Magazine, and featured as a rising Entrepreneur at the University of Southern California Marshall School of Business. And I continue to seek for more opportunities to grow. 


I was recently accepted to USC's Alternative Spring Break Program to go to El Salvador and focus on the notion of social entrepreneurship, such as the coffee industry and trade, along with helping local farmers with their land, visiting women shelter and helping them with any necessary needs, and, most importantly, reaching out to the community to help local kids feel that individuals like us--through a global perspective--are willing to help out because regardless of where we are, we are all a family. Throughout this week-long trip, I hope to document the rawness of the people, the environment and the culture, and share it with everyone in the U.S--hopefully building a gallery with these images and constructing a documentary film. But I need YOUR HELP!

With my journey, I want to craft a book that will translate my testimonial experience into a story. Implementing my images into an organized template--such as this book--will function as a way to showcase the rawness of El Salvador's culture and people more effectively in a realistic manner. 

The book will include: striking emotional images, body text along with the images to give background and tell the photograph's story.


What We Need & What You Get

My dreams are bigger than my wallet, and with the help and support of anyone, it would definitely be helping out a kid with big, artistic dreams, and helping out someone that wants to only share knowledge with the world through artistic mediums. 

I will not be able to accomplish this goal without your help! As a reward for your courteous support, there are some perks--EXCLUSIVE INEXPENSIVE photo sessions that I am offering. GO! GO! GO! DONATE! DONATE! Donate to some inexpensive photographic services, or you can always donate without expecting anything in return--if you wish! :)

THANK YOU GUYS SO MUCH!!! <3

The Impact

The USC's Alternative Spring Break Program to El Salvador will help me gain a global perspective of the world, but also allow me the opportunity to serve as the liaison in terms of being able to bridge El Salvador's environment and culture with the U.S--in fact, even the world-- through artistic mediums such as photography. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Do feel free to share and tell everyone and everyone about this campaign. 

***Use the Indiegogo's sharing tools to let everyone know about this campaign***

My artistic statement:

I have been an artist of many kinds: a drawer, a painter, and a photographer. It’s sort of the idea of a chameleon, trying to find its place, a place where they feel comfortable enough to express themselves without fear. unknowingly, by picking up that one camera, I was able to feel that special spark that kindled it all—the connection I was waiting for. i believe photography is one of the most powerful ways to express yourself—see or be yourself. As we grow older, we mold and shape ourselves in infinite ways, unknowingly predicting what’s to become of the future and who we, ultimately, will be. That’s the beauty of it all—how things are so border-less, so limitless. Intrinsically, photography captures and externalizes real moments—real people. you look back at old pictures your grandparents stored years and years ago, and you see nothing but the truest form of your ancestors; you look at the time you were first able to breathe and see, or the time your family first carried you in their arms; you see nothing but the most intimate forms of their emotions, whether it is happiness or sadness. I find nothing more magical than taking these moments, and these people, and transforming them into something that I feel. Just this very possibility, combining elements of reality with imagination, makes photography so magnetic. It is the part that allows us to look past what we have been told is our reality, and understand the reality our soul is truly living in. and this, is where my photographs come from, and hopefully reflect one day. I find many inspirations in this world we live in together, and they can be found in the way I challenge the human form, the thematic use of water, motion, and forms of transportation, and in symbols of preservation—to name a few. Each piece is a story, window into the place I live and envision, and I want nothing more than to bring you there with me.

I have been working in the field for the past three years. My passion and dedication have landed me in VOGUE Italia, as well as in front of the likes of Raina Hein (ANTM Cycle 14), Jo Lance, designers for Katy Perry and Nicki Minaj, and Phoenix Fashion Week. My love for photography shines through in my work, and I always deliver my best to my clients. Whatever the project may be, I look forward to joining our creative efforts in the future.

"Legacy"

"Sink beneath the golden surface"

story:
Short Summary

HI I'm Mark. I Write books. I have published one book already. I want  to publish market and sell two more completed books. The profits from two books will fund more of those books I have almost ready. I write fiction and I write "self help" (hate that phrase :)) informative books. My goal is to spread empower people to have fun and happiness and entertainment. 10% of all profits are going to a Suicide Awareness/Mental Health Charity

What We Need & What You Get

I need to Raise $5500(€4200) to print/market and sell these two books. What you get are up to two signed books, one which will inform and one which will entertain and potential discounts on further books I publish (of which there will be many). You can get both copies with a special thank you message hand written to you. You can also get your name printed in the acknowledgement page in the book. Also there is a potential to gain assistance publishing your own book.

    The Impact

    The impact of this campaign being successful means that many more positive books will be printed and read worldwide. There will also be a positive effect on the disease of mental health albeit a small donation but it all helps. This snowball rolling will eventually lead to films, more books and a publishing company which all in all will benefit all of us who support it

      Risks & Challenges

      YOU Decide what you would like to contribute, I will sell the books and though it might be tough, with all my sales experience I can sell these books. Contributing will mean you have already done something nice :)

        Other Ways You Can Help

        If you do not want to contribute then simply share a smile, share a hug or do a random act of kindness. Tell the people that you love that YOU DO LOVE them and spend some quality time with them. This way you are making our world brighter

          And that's all there is to it.

  Other Ways You Can Help If you do not want to contribute then simply share a smile, share a hug or do a random act of kindness. Tell the people that you love that YOU DO LOVE them and spend some quality time with them. This way you are making our world brighter

 And that's all there is to it.

story:
Our Story

Before you decide to donate to my project please let me explain my reason for reaching out on indiegogo. First, before you lay down any of your hard earned cash, I want you to know I have invested over $10,000 thousand dollars of my own money into my project. I have spent hundreds of hours writing draft after draft of my manuscript over the last six months. I hired a self-publishing firm at significant cost. I hired a graphic designer to make my Book cover. I have hired a professional editor to go over my work for two more re-writes. I have attended an expensive seminar to learn about book publicity and book promotion. These are just a few of the major expenses I have incurred in the creation this project. I have chosen to spend all the funds I have including going into dreaded credit card debt to make this project come to life.

 

The Impact

I am dedicating my life to saving other lives from the kind of heart-break and sorrow I experienced becoming an alcoholic at age 19 and age 23 when I hit bottom and found myself in AA. If I can save one young person from going down the path I took it will all be worth it. I was quarterback of the football team, I was an A student, but the use and abuse - drinking alcohol and doing some drugs turned me into a full-time alcoholic by age 19. I would like to help other teens and colege age young people from making the same mistake. I hope to save a life. All funds will go to helping me finish the book and promoting the it through the proper publicity channels.

What We Need & What You Get

SIX reasons your donation is so important:

  • You will be the reason why my story reaches that one young person living on the edge and saves a life.
  • You will be part of fostering greater awareness regarding the perils of teenage and college age drinking.
  • You will be the reason my story will make a social difference in the lives of young people starting to use alcohol.
  • You will be facilitating the promotion of my book through publicity channels so my story reaches those who need it most.
  • You will be securing me the time I need to focus on perfecting the final draft of my story.

 

I am writing my story because it is my most sincere hope that my story will save one life. That will make it all worth it. I am aware this maybe a grandiose desire for an indie writer. But I believe my story is powerful and dramatic. I have been working on this book at the expense of my family, my children, my wife, possibly my marriage and my personal finances. To make the attempt at writing a book that will make a social difference in the lives of other people has a financial cost much greater than I had estimated. As I near the finish-line, I do not want financial issues to compromise my book being publicized professionally. I believe deeply in the importance of my story as a warning and as an example. I believe my story will effect the lives of young people, high school and college age. And the book is for parents who may not be aware of the real-life dangers that alcohol that poses to the lives of their children. My story also offers hope to those suffering alcoholics who are trying hard to get sober and all the family members that live with an alcoholic in their life.

 

Autors note :  I am not being dramatic when I say that Alcoholism is a Life and Death issue. I have buried loved ones to the disease of Alcoholism and if you are still reading, chances are you have too. I will be forever grateful for your support.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Helping me by posting to your social network the Link to my indiegogo page, /    http://igg.me/p/48655?a=246059    /    so many thanks in advance ......

Please Share with your :

  1. Facebook friends
  2. Facebook fans
  3. Twitter followers
  4. YouTube followers
  5. StumbleUpon friends
  6. Linkedin Friends
  7. MySpace friends

---------------------------------------

  • Help me get this book in schools and recovery centers, your AA group.
  • Helping me to find a good book agent. 
  • Book stores help my by offering this book.
  • Helping me to setup book signings.
  • Helping me with press or publicity releases and campaigns. 
  • Connect me with professionals in the industry who want to help.

story:
WHERE 

I've been accepted and given a partial fellowship to the Vermont Studio Center (VSC), the largest international artists' and writers' Residency Program in the United States.

WHY 

I require $2,950 to fund the portion of tuition (and room and board) which my partial fellowship does not cover. This is an opportunity for my professional development and my focus on creative goals. Any funds over my goal will be applied to the book's publication.

 

With your $10 donation, you'll recieve this Whoopie Pie, PLUS a lot of other cool things! Look to the right of this page for all the extra perks ...

 

 

BIG DEAL 

As a stroke survivor, the time away will be invaluable to me. My brain goes "haywire" when faced with sensory overload: noise, chatter, stimulation, etc.. For me, this equals an exacerbation of my symptoms, which include having no sense of time, no sense of hunger, disorientation, high anxiety, and aphasia.

 

Here's the peanut butter cookie you'll recieve for a $20 donation [plus a lot of other cool things!]. I'll make sure to send you a whole one!

 

WHO

I live in Conway, Massachusetts and am the author of the poetry chapbook, All of Me (Booksmyth Press, 2008).  I attended New England College's MFA program and facilitated stroke survivors' writing workshops. I also founded the nationally known Collective Poets Series in Shelburne Falls, MA. I live with my partner John and unabashedly adore my puppy, Ida Red. I also feel an affinity for baked goods. Especially cupcakes. Ok, not exactly an affinity, but not exactly an obsession. The baked goods are just a little extra added something that I can give you!

 

With your $25 donation, you'll recieve this Chocolate Chip Cookie, PLUS a lot of other cool things! Look to the right of this page for all the extra perks ... I PROMISE it'll be a whole one!

PAST 

"All of Me," and "Hallelujah," have been nominated for a Pushcart Prize. I was a finalist for the Pavel Srut fellowship in Prague. In addition, I won fellowships with Philanthropic Education Organization, American Association of University Women, and the Yellow Fox Foundation. I've been published in many journals including American Poetry Journal, Boiling River, The Columbia Granger's World of Poetry, Diner, The Equinox, Poetry Northwest, The Recorder, Slipstream, Survivor's Review, Sweet, Tattoosday, and Connotation Press.

 


With your $50 donation, you'll recieve this Brownie, PLUS a lot of other cool things! Look to the right of this page for all the extra perks ...

 

 

 

SETTING 

The environment at VSC assures the ability to focus on my work in a nurtured, structured setting. Attending this residency would let me improve my manuscript and develop other works in progress, surrounded by fellow fiction writers, poets, sculptors, painters, and other visual artists. 

 


With your $100 donation, you'll recieve My Famous-Better-Than-Nigella's-Banana-Bread, PLUS a lot of other seriously cool things! Look to the right of this page for all the extra perks ...

 

 

THE IMPACT 

The narrative poems, which will be the bulk of my work at VSC, are poems of witness. They are also about hope and desire, expectation and self-invention.

The play is set deep in Southern Appalachia and in part, written in dialect. Bearing witness by necessity, the verses are about ambition and striving, repression, faith and spirituality. And it’s about music, beautiful Old Time music ... a music that demands revival.


With your $200 donation, you'll recieve an Amy Sedaris cupcake, AND a bunch of other seriously cool things! Look to the right of this page for all the extra perks ...

 

 

 

THE FEEL GOOD PART 

Remember, you’re helping an income-reduced poet realize one of my dreams. Please give what you can … lovely little perks are to the right of this page.

 

With your $500 donation, you'll recieve a Dulce de Leche Cheesecale, AND a bunch of other wonderfully cool things! Look to the right of this page for all the extra perks ...

 

OTHER WAYS YOU COULD HELP

Can you help make noise about this campaign? Please re-Tweet it, share on Facebook, on your email lists, or word-of-mouth it! Some people just can't contribute and that is OKAY!

Remember, funding can continue even if the goal is reached, so please don't be afraid to pledge "too much." Don't be afraid to pledge too little, either. Everything helps. Thank you, thank you, thank you, in advance!

 

With your $1000 donation, you'll recieve a a superior Red Velvet Cake, PLUS every other cool perk to the right of the page!

With your $1000 donation, you'll recieve a a superior Red Velvet Cake, PLUS every other cool perk to the right of the page!

story:
Short Summary

Alafia (Peace) I am Khafre K. Abif, AIDS Activist and I have been thriving with HIV for 23 years. I have compiled an anthology of inspirational prayers, poems and affirmations to support the souls and uplift the spirits of People Living with HIV/AIDS. For the last eighteen month the submissions have touched my soul, made me cry, filled me with hope, and connected me to an international community of compassionate contributors who have shared their work to empower my world. Your Sponsorship will bring a healing word to those who are infected and affected by HIV/AIDS.

I believe that there is healing in prayer. I know that words have power. I needed to provide this collection of words that will combat the words that are so often hear spoken to someone with HIV. This is my effort to help combat HIV-related stigma. AIDS-related stigma and discrimination refers to prejudice, negative attitudes, abuse and maltreatment directed at people living with HIV and AIDS. The consequences of stigma and discrimination are wide-ranging: being shunned by family, peers and the wider community, poor treatment in healthcare and education settings, an erosion of rights, psychological damage, and a negative effect on the success of HIV testing and treatment. The idea for the anthology grew out of my work as an HIV Test Counselor. Each time I had to share with someone that they tested positive for HIV one of the first issues for them was disclosure.

Cornbread, Fish and Collard Greens: Prayers, Poems & Affirmation for People Living with HIV/AIDS has received submission from Africa, America, Europe, and South America. Contributors have provided their work in their indigenous language with an English translation. I want to shares this anthology with the international community who created it. As you are reading this it is quite possible that you know someone living with HIV/AIDS. If you do then they have shared their status with you. Let us consider all of those who still haven’t disclosed to their mother, father, sister/brother or even their faith community. What place to they go to as a source of support and inspiration?

Poets featured in the forthcoming anthology include: Nikki Grimes, Serena T. Wills, Reginald T. Jackson, Sharaledon D. Brave, r. witherspoon, Samiya Bashir, Storme Webber, Carl Hancock Rux, Tim’m T. West, Mose Xavier Hardin, Jr., Lady Vee DaPoet, Victor R. Pond, Catherine Zickgraf, Temujin Ekunfeo, Alfreda Lanoix. Maria Hiv Mejia, Tony Medina, Sandy Rodgers, W. Travis Wright, Vanessa German, Mary Bowman and avery r. young and more. 

The Impact

Stigma is a three-dollar word that affects millions of Americans in different ways. Defining stigma as simply "a mark of shame or discredit" doesn't sound very impactful, and yet communities around the globe are paralyzed by it every day. I know this firsthand because I am HIV-positive. I have personally experienced the ignorance and discrimination faced by those of us who live with HIV.

HIV/AIDS stigma is rampant in American society. It started in the 1980s when the disease was termed GRID (Gay Related Immune Deficiency); President Reagan refused to even say the word AIDS for four years and the epidemic decimated entire communities in this country all the while. There is not one person living with HIV that I know of who has not suffered at some point due to stigma. In my case, due to my chosen profession, as a children’s librarian, stigma kept me silent for almost 15years.

The information about how to guard against HIV is out there, but people aren't educated, or don't think that they are at risk. People aren't getting tested (or even treated if they test positive) because they are afraid of the consequences of their loved ones finding out they are HIV-positive. Ignorance begets ignorance, and the silence of those of us who know better hinders the cause: we need to speak up.

We cannot end the AIDS epidemic without fighting the stigma, silence and fear associated with it. Your sponsorship for this campaign and its successful publishing will to the tool box of the infected community as each take a daily read to arm themselves before leaving their home and entering into a world that STILL hold stigma, shame and silence for the lives WE live each day.

  • Although the fight against HIV/AIDS is more than thirty years old and many victories have been won, the fact remains that every nine and a half minutes someone is infected with HIV
  • 2011 UNAIDS reports, number of people living with HIV/AIDS are 34.2 million and 8 million PLWHA received ARV, 330 000 children who acquired HIV infection, 2.5 million people acquired HIV infected, 1.7 million died of AIDS related illness.
  • 34.2 million People are living with HIV/AIDS worldwide.
  • 30 million people have died from AIDS-related complications worldwide.
  • 18 million children have been orphaned from AIDS-related complications worldwide.
  • 5,000 people die each day from AIDS before we are too busy with other priorities.

Yours sponsorship will provide new voices to the long silence of AIDS literary. It will provide for hope, strength and words that affirm, heal, and lift those who are infected as well as those who are marginalized such as commercial sex workers, gay, substance users, and those who are simply afraid to share with their family and church that they are gay much less that they are living with HIV 

What We Need & What You Get

Yours sponsorship will support the cost of self publishing this anthology project delivering a High Quality Eco-Friendly Printing of Cornbread, Fish and Collard Greens: Prayers, Poems & Affirmation for People Living with HIV/AIDS .

Sponsorship will ensure this anthology is presented in the spirit in which it has been compiled, a quilt of words that heal and affirm the soul. Sponsorship ensures the delivery of an aesthetically attractive book that is produced, designed and printed on quality paper. Sponsorship will ensure that each contributor that lives in the United States and does not live in the United States receives one free copy. 

Yours (Giving Back) sponsorship you will receive a thank-you on the project website, and I will donate one copy of the book to an AIDS Service Organization in your city. Check out the $250 (Name In Print) sponsorship will include your name in the acknowledgments of the anthology. Sponsorship of $500 and we will arrange a Skype reading and discussion for you and your friends/community, your sponsorship of $1,000 and I will travel to your city to share my story of living with HIV for 23 years and you can host a private book signing.

In addition, sponsorship will provide for the projects ability to contract the cover art to be design by Javaka Steptoe. Javaka is an eclectic young artist, designer, and illustrator, building a national reputation as an outstanding contributor to the genre of children’s literature. His debut work, In Daddy’s Arms I Am Tall: African Americans Celebrating Fathers, earned him the Coretta Scott King Illustrator Award, a nomination for Outstanding Children’s Literature Work at the 1998 NAACP Image Awards, a finalist ranking for the Bluebonnet Award for Excellence in Children’s Books, and countless other honors. His books, Do You Know What I’ll Do? authored by Charlotte Zolotow and A Pocketful of Poems authored by Nikki Grimes, received starred reviews from both Publishers Weekly and the ALA Booklist. Hot Day on Abbott Avenue, written by Karen English, received the 2005 Jane Addams Children’s Book Award. Steptoe is also the author/illustrator of The Jones Family Express. His most recent illustration projects include Rain Play by Cynthia Cotten, published in 2008 and Amiri and Odette: A Love Story by multi award winning author Walter Dean Myers, forthcoming in January 2009. http://www.javaka.com/bio.html

Your sponsorship will provide the resources secure editor photo head shot be international creative artist and photographer Duane Cramer http://www.duanecramer.com/start.html http://www.greaterthan.org/heroes/year-2006/dua...

Other Ways You Can Help

You can post the campaign link of your Facebook page, send emails to your social network, log on the campaign link and post comments. You can spread the word about this project and share it with your social network on Twitter and raise the GoGo Factor for Cornbread, Fish and Collard Greens: Prayers, Poems & Affirmation for People Living with HIV/AIDS. Use the share tools to push this project out to your community.

His books, Do You Know What I’ll Do? authored by Charlotte Zolotow and A Pocketful of Poems authored by Nikki Grimes, received starred reviews from both Publishers Weekly and the ALA Booklist. Hot Day on Abbott Avenue, written by Karen English, received the 2005 Jane Addams Children’s Book Award. Steptoe is also the author/illustrator of The Jones Family Express. His most recent illustration projects include Rain Play by Cynthia Cotten, published in 2008 and Amiri and Odette: A Love Story by multi award winning author Walter Dean Myers, forthcoming in January 2009. http://www.javaka.com/bio.html
Your sponsorship will provide the resources secure editor photo head shot be international creative artist and photographer Duane Cramer http://www.duanecramer.com/start.html http://www.greaterthan.org/heroes/year-2006/dua...
Other Ways You Can Help
You can post the campaign link of your Facebook page, send emails to your social network, log on the campaign link and post comments. You can spread the word about this project and share it with your social network on Twitter and raise the GoGo Factor for Cornbread, Fish and Collard Greens: Prayers, Poems & Affirmation for People Living with HIV/AIDS. Use the share tools to push this project out to your community.

story:
UPDATE: Thanks to our incredible contributors, we reached our original goal of $1,100 in a mere seven days. With 23 days left, we'd like to extend the goal to $1,500, to spent on additional advertising and a limited amount of merchandise.

In order to reach this new goal, a new perk is being offered. If HULL DAMAGE can raise $1,500 by May 2nd, everyone who's donated over the course of the campaign will receive exclusive access to a brand new three minute short film, similar to the Book Teaser, starring Steven Molony and Scott McClure!

"It seemed as if, against all sanity, bloodthirsty buccaneers, eyes blackened by patches and daggers clutched in wicked smiles, had clawed their way out of storybooks and sea shanties to scuttle his spaceship."

ABOUT THE BOOK:

HULL DAMAGE is a spacepunk crime caper about a daredevil pirate captain and his crew of interstellar buccaneers who find themselves caught in the crossfire of a bidding war between three of the galaxy's most ruthless and powerful crime lords.

Earning a decent living as an interstellar pirate has never exactly been easy, especially not in rough-and-tumble Bad Space, the lawless region at the fringes of the civilized galaxy, where there's a fight in every bar, a gun on every belt and a chip on everyone's shoulder, but the crew of The Unconstant Lover has got it particularly raw. Contending daily with the mechanical failures of their haggard spaceship and the best efforts of bounty hunters to collect the growing price on their heads, this crew of cutthroats, buccaneers and scofflaws use wits, weapons and wisecracks to make off with as much booty as they can, with the forces of law and order never more than one step behind.

The only impediment between them and a quiet criminal career is their blowhard of a captain. Ace pilot, megalomaniac and hell-bent on becoming the most fearsome dread pirate this galaxy has ever seen, Captain Nemo leads his motley crew with bluster and bravado through planetary blockades, space station shootouts and a bidding war between three of the galaxy's preeminent gangsters and, when push comes to shove, they'll need every trick in the space pirate code to see it through to the other side.

Fans of Firefly, Star Wars and the works of Quentin Tarantino will find HULL DAMAGE to be a thrilling science fiction romp, blending the genres of space opera and crime comedy. If you like snappy dialogue, unscrupulous rogues, laser gun shoot-outs and perpetually malfunctioning spaceships, HULL DAMAGE should be just your brand of poison.

"A ragtag cadre of aromas – cheap booze, fight sweat, imported tobacco, spilled blood and forty-five years of the galaxy's dried semen – vanguard an assault on Moira Quicksilver's nose as she strides into the Astrobounce Gentlemen's Club."

ABOUT THE CAMPAIGN:

Rather than seeking more traditional methods through a large corporate publishing house, I've decided to make an attempt at self-publishing HULL DAMAGE. This allows me to retain full ownership of the book, its contents and my intellectual property, without having to sell my soul for a lucrative book deal.

As a result, this IndieGoGo campaign is aimed towards raising the funds I need for the book's effective post-production; printing hard copies, buying Internet domains, raising awareness, design costs, those sorts of expenses. Assuming I can raise the full amount, I should be able to offer HULL DAMAGE as a free download.

Part of the decision to offer the book for free was based in the belief that free content will always raise one's readership higher than anything you charge for, but the majority of the reason stemmed from a harkening back to the original podcast. In podcasting, material is almost universally offered for free and something about charging money for the adventures of Nemo and the Lover simply didn't sit right with me.

Assuming all goes according to plan, HULL DAMAGE will be released on June 1st, our current website's address will officially change to "www.hulldamage2012.com" and the novel will hopefully be available for download from Smashwords, our website and hopefully Amazon, Barnes & Noble and the Apple iBookstore shortly following. In the meantime, tune in to www.whoisnemo.com each Monday for more free promotional content until the novel's release, including character profiles, free music downloads and excerpts from the novel itself.

"Bellowing partially in panic, partially in elation, Nemo pitches The Unconstant Lover brutally to starboard, boosters careening drunkenly and navigational instruments scrambling to ascertain their surroundings."

ABOUT THE AUTHOR:

Timothy J. Meyer is a Minnesota-born screenwriter, actor and novelist who began his career as a playwright for the Minneapolis Fringe Festival, penning BURNING BRIDGES (2006) and ADJECTIVE (2008).  His screenplay credits include HADES (2010), PETTY CRIMES (2010) and THE WRITING (2010). He also produced the popular sci-fi podcast THE ENDLESS NIGHT (2009) for which HULL DAMAGE serves as a prequel. HULL DAMAGE marks his first novel and he hopes to develop a series of sequels, assuming the fundraising and release both go well.

"The Captain, however, is all arrogance; thumbs cocked into his broad black belt and face plastered with that excessive expression that suggests he's about to start whistling."

(Music in the video is "In Case of Trouble" by Darren Korb off the Bastion soundtrack.)

story:
Short Summary

Greetings! 

Im Jeff. Pretty much just a guy experiencing life in this world. Ive been through some great experiences, down to some pretty horrific stuff. Enough to learn that at the end of the day, the most important experiences are the ones Ive shared with living things.

One day I looked around and realized I didnt have a sunset buddy for this really gorgeous sunset that was happening. Sometimes too, we get too busy to stop and make a sunset date.

So I wrote the framework for Sunset Buddies right then and there, on every piece of paper I had with me, including dollar bills. 

Sunset Buddies follows along as a young person looks for different ones to share a sunset, a sunset 'bucket list'. Family members, friends, neighbors, and definitely pets. (You'll notice on the cover is the dog, cat, bunny and Ralph from Good Midnight Stars), Mrs Butternut, Lisa Shufflekelp, Chen Tugabus, Taquina Bobina, Sandy Wigglesnort, Laura Thundermush, and Sam Tattoome, are just some of the people we meet.

What We Need & What You Get

Bottom Line? Your help to get these printed and into the hands of children. As a thank you for your contribution, we are going to put your name and your favorite Sunset Buddy on pages at the back of the book. So, when you contribute, please let me know who your SBF is (Sunset Buddy Forever) and we'll do the rest.

As a supplement to the Dreamland Explorers series, Sunset Buddies promotes the idea to make sunsets count, for the experiences with other beings. The main character is on a mission to have a sunset buddy as many days as possible. We are taken through a series of seasons, with each experience 4-6 pages long, which ends with turning the page to a two-page spread of a sunset, with our main character and that particular sunset buddy silhouetted against a sunset, as the front cover shows.

So each sunset illustration is one from an artist across the world, all contributed, sharing their concept of a sunset experience. I will then put the sunset in a best match with the sunset experience of the main character.

And like Dreamland Explorers series (Good Midnight Stars (here on indiegogo), Good Morning Sun, and Dreamland Explorers' Adventure Guide), I want to donate the books. Your funding provides the printing, delivery to children in hospitals, libraries with dedicated childrens' reading areas, and basically any child who would like a copy. The cost of printing one book is approximately 4.20/ea. Shipping takes the rest of the funds. For whatever we can raise- that is how many books will be available. Ive decided to use a printer in Germany so we do not have to worry about leadfree testing, which is fairly expensive.

I have secured volunteer translators in Spanish, Portuguese, Polish, Ukrainian, and French. There are so many languages I want to offer: Chinese, Japanese, German, etc.

Then there is the website. I think we need to have a standalone website for Sunset Buddies, with a link to the dreamlandexplorers.com website. Im thinking there might be a need to expand Sunset Buddies to tackle other issues. Maybe just to send a 'share a sunset" invitation. Or, breaking out one of the sunset experiences in the book where the reader (as the main character) finds a person in need, who is in emotional need of a friend to have a sunset with. (teaching to give as well as receive the time and love of others). Id also like to use the website to further develop the thought of the sunset buddy list (bucket list). An interactive platform for them to think about the people and animals in their life that may need their attention as well as the joy of being with that person. Maybe even a whole sunset buddies list or future book, starring mostly different dogs. Of course, a good website alone will take all of the funds requested. So, maybe just have to put that off for some time.

And if there are any funds to provide it, Im in desperate need of an updated wacom Cintiq large format, which is a pretty expensive unit, but has no equal and it will save on art production costs and time.

The Impact

Reinforcing the value of human relationships is something that I hope to reinforce with these stories of each sunset. By helping young ones to value that living contact, I hope that appreciation for life, and positive experiences, will stay with them for life.

One of the aspects of the book is the invitation that has gone out for artists from all over to contribute their sunset to the book. Some are known artists, others are not. Then the other illustrations needed I will fill in. The diversity of the various artists from all over the earth, I believe will help further the impact of the book.

By making it a downloadable pdf/ebook, I believe will also help to support a worldwide audience.

Other Ways You Can Help

Certainly there are so many other ways to help. Make a sunset date today! Teach anyone around you to stop and share a sunset, especially younger ones. Please help us get the word out on this book campaign! There are sharing tools here, and just anything you can do to help.

Above all, please make sure you have a sunset buddy as much as your life will allow. 

If you are an artist and would like to submit your work, please do so at submissions@dreamtodesign.com. No photos, only original artwork by your own hand.

We will contact you with the legal forms to release the work, but all artists will be thanked and credited in the book. If your work has a title, and I hope you care about it enough to do so, please make sure to include that, as it will be used in the workprint process.

story:
Genre Writing Retreats

Hello, I'm Amanda Saint - a fiction writer, Open University student and provider of creative writing services through Retreat West, which I started last year to help develop my own and other people's writing. I also work as a freelance features writer and in order to have more time to work on my novels, which I have an agent interested in, I am launching a series of writing retreats that will all take place in inspirational National Trust holiday cottages.  

If I can raise the funds to help me promote and run these retreats, then I will be able to take on fewer freelance commissions and have the time to work on my fiction and hopefully get a book deal (my lifelong dream!). 

Other writers will also get the chance to work with leading authors in different genres to develop their writing and hopefully get book deals too. Meaning we all get more great books to read.

The genre retreats that I'm running, which are the one's writers most wanted to go on in the survey they completed for me, are:

  • Crime/Thriller Writing - taking place in Agatha Christie's house in Devon with a workshop by Sophie Hannah, who will be taking her new Poirot novel on tour shortly after the retreat runs.
  • Short Story Writing - author of the brilliant book, Short Circuit: A guide to the art of the short story, as well as several novels and short story collections, Vanessa Gebbie will be running the workshop at this retreat. The venue is a Grade II listed farmhouse in Surrey.
  • Historical Fiction Writing - this retreat will take place in an amazing Victorian Carding Mill in the Lake District, with Emma Darwin, author of critically acclaimed bestselling historical novels, running the workshop.
  • Literary Fiction Writing - back by popular demand, Alison Moore will be hosting the workshop at this retreat in one of Devon's most impressive old manor houses.
  • Women's Fiction Writing - bestselling and award-winning author Rowan Coleman will teach writers how to write great Women's Fiction in a house in Cumbria that was built by a suffragette. 

What I Need & What You Get

Here's what I'll do with the funds I raise and what you'll get if you can contribute:

  • I need £2,000 to run advertising campaigns in relevant media: The New Writer, Mslexia and Writing Magazine, as currently the only way I can promote it is on my social media spaces. I need to spread the word further! These funds will enable me to run adverts in the print editions and on the magazines' websites.
  • The other £1,890 goes towards the Indigogo fee and the running costs of the retreats - venues, catering and workshops. 
  • The perks on offer include signed copies of the Stories for Homes anthology, which is raising money for housing and homeless charity, Shelter, and features one of my stories; a copy of the first anthology of winning stories from the Retreat West Short Story Competition (which is being published in March 2014); critiques of your own writing; 6 week online creative writing courses for beginners; and places at the genre writing retreats.
  • Every little helps and if I don't reach my funding goal, whatever funds I do raise will be used to pay for as much advertising as I can get for that amount. 

The Impact

If I can pay for advertising and spread the word further then I'm confident that I can sell all of the spaces on all of the retreats. I ran my first residential retreats in 2013, one of which took place in a National Trust lighthouse cottage. Author, Alison Moore, whose debut novel The Lighthouse was shortlisted for the Booker Prize, ran a workshop at this retreat, which sold out several weeks before it took place. You can see what one of the writers who came on it thought about the retreat here: We all need a lighthouse of our own

The feedback from other writers that came along was also excellent and Cath Barton said: "The writing retreat was special in lots of ways, not least for having Alison Moore as workshop tutor. From the moment we arrived Amanda looked after us so well. Highly recommended."

By raising the profile of Retreat West through advertising and selling all of the spaces on these genre retreats, my working life can be transformed. It would free my time to work on my fiction for at least 3 full days a week, meaning I could really develop my body of work.

You can read some of my short stories that have been published in Number Eleven Magazine and in the anthology, Stories for Homes, which is raising money for the housing and homeless charity, Shelter. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute to my project, you can help by:

  • Telling everyone you know all about it!
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks for reading and I really hope you can help :-)

story:
Hello, everyone...


MY STORY

My name is Predrag Filipović. I have been labeled with many titles, but just recently I realized that I have always been Pedjalaya. Long story short, Pedjalaya is a unique nickname that I gave to myself when I was about two years old. Now, that I'm thirty, I'm beginning to realize that my nickname has a meaning. Not as a name, but as a word that means inspiration and motivation to a lot of people. 

I use my senses and my experience to write. Recently, I published my website (www.pedjalaya.com) containing my stories and some articles about self recognition, along with some other stuff. I'm always trying to give my best to the people, and keep inspiring them, but as you know, seeds of wisdom and light need spreading in order to grow, so I'm trying to do it now, and I need your help.

Publishing a book with all of my stories written so far will help those seeds grow. I will still keep the stories on my website free for everyone to read them, but I really want the true readers to be able to have them before bedtime, or in a train, or on a vacation.

My stories are about everything and anything. Usually placing the main character in a world that can be very much real, then giving the reader a series of strange situations twisting their mind in a certain direction, coquetting with paranormal, magic, bizarre, thrill, murder, etc. Feel free to visit my website and read whatever you like.

FUNDS

As for the money, I'm asking $2300. Any cent is valuable. No personal gain included, except for the satisfaction of holding my own book in my own hands. The money will fund printing, designing and publishing, and the rest of it will cover the costs of sending some of the paperback copies to the biggest supporters of this campaign.

Funding of this project will earn you some thank you notes, some copies in e-book and paperback format, some credits in the book itself, and maybe a little bit extra.

If I don't receive enough funds, though, what I get will still be saved for publishing my book, but it'll just have to wait a bit longer. I can promise one thing, though. I will definitely continue writing and giving myself to the world. 


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you can’t contribute financially, please:

• Share this campaign with your friends and family

• Share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, LinkedIn, etc.

• And please, don’t forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!


THANK YOU!


Special thanks to setuniman from www.freesound.org for the great piano piece used in the video.
story_txt:
Hello, everyone...


MY STORY
My name is Predrag Filipović. I have been labeled with many titles, but just recently I realized that I have always been Pedjalaya. Long story short, Pedjalaya is a unique nickname that I gave to myself when I was about two years old. Now, that I'm thirty, I'm beginning to realize that my nickname has a meaning. Not as a name, but as a word that means inspiration and motivation to a lot of people. 
I use my senses and my experience to write. Recently, I published my website (www.pedjalaya.com) containing my stories and some articles about self recognition, along with some other stuff. I'm always trying to give my best to the people, and keep inspiring them, but as you know, seeds of wisdom and light need spreading in order to grow, so I'm trying to do it now, and I need your help.

Publishing a book with all of my stories written so far will help those seeds grow. I will still keep the stories on my website free for everyone to read them, but I really want the true readers to be able to have them before bedtime, or in a train, or on a vacation.
My stories are about everything and anything. Usually placing the main character in a world that can be very much real, then giving the reader a series of strange situations twisting their mind in a certain direction, coquetting with paranormal, magic, bizarre, thrill, murder, etc. Feel free to visit my website and read whatever you like.
FUNDS
As for the money, I'm asking $2300. Any cent is valuable. No personal gain included, except for the satisfaction of holding my own book in my own hands. The money will fund printing, designing and publishing, and the rest of it will cover the costs of sending some of the paperback copies to the biggest supporters of this campaign.
Funding of this project will earn you some thank you notes, some copies in e-book and paperback format, some credits in the book itself, and maybe a little bit extra.
If I don't receive enough funds, though, what I get will still be saved for publishing my book, but it'll just have to wait a bit longer. I can promise one thing, though. I will definitely continue writing and giving myself to the world. 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you can’t contribute financially, please:
• Share this campaign with your friends and family
• Share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, LinkedIn, etc.
• And please, don’t forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

THANK YOU!

Special thanks to setuniman from www.freesound.org for the great piano piece used in the video.

story:
¿Qué?

Reubicación aborda temas muy actuales, conflictos sociales incluso, apoyándose en una trama de ciencia-ficción.

Dhanu es miembro de un grupo de exploradores, liderado por Abril, que tienen como misión viajar al pasado. Tienen encomendado el objetivo de rescatar a unas personas que viven confinadas en un centro de reubicación. Estos centros son ciudades enteras destinadas a dar asilo centralizado a los inmigrantes y refugiados que entran en masa a Europa. La iniciativa que motiva la creación de estos inmensos centros es el autoabastecimiento de sus habitantes. Aunque la idea inicial era hacer frente, de la manera más humanitaria posible, a la crisis migratoria que se había encrudecido en Europa, lo cierto es que con el tiempo se convirtieron en enormes prisiones donde se veían vulnerados los derechos humanos de las personas que ahí vivían.

Bajo la tutela de Abril, Dhanu y sus compañeros tendrán que sacar de uno de estos centros de reubicación a un grupo heterogéneo de habitantes con el fin de traerlos consigo de vuelta a su tiempo. Dhanu es la encargada de establecer las coordenadas del desplazamiento espacio-temporal que situará al grupo de viajeros en el centro de reubicación en el momento adecuado. Sin embargo, un pequeño error de cálculo parece poner en peligro la enigmática operación.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de publicar obras poco convencionales pero de indudable calidad, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para promocionar cada título cuando esta todavía se encuentra en proceso de edición.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Ramón Ortega (tres).

Ramón Ortega Lozano (México D.F. 11 de agosto de 1979) también conocido por el nombre artístico arriba indicado, es un escritor mexicano, profesor y especialista del mundo de la literatura, la escritura creativa y temas relacionados con las humanidades médicas (antropología de la salud, historia y filosofía de la medicina, comunicación médico-paciente y bioética). Ha colaborado con diversos centros universitarios en España y otros países de Europa, así como México.

En la actualidad es profesor de comunicación humana y técnicas de expresión escrita y de Antropología de la salud en el Centro Universitario San Rafael-Nebrija. Colabora en distintas actividades tanto académicas, divulgativas y de investigación con el Instituto de Ética Clínica Francisco Vallés-Universidad Europea. También es profesor de literatura, y escritura creativa en la Universidad Nebrija. Es doctor en Filosofía de la Ciencia por la Universidad Complutense de Madrid. Licenciado en Comunicación Audiovisual y en Humanidades por la Universidad Europea de Madrid.

Ha publicado artículos de diversos temas (literatura, filosofía, divulgación científica, ficción, etc.) en distintos medios. Ha escrito una compilación de relatos llamada Un gran salto para Gorsky que puede descargarse de internet. Cuenta con un blog llamado Cuando el hoy comienza a ser ayer. Ha escrito una novela fragmentada El anecdotario de un Breaking up que permanece inédita.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«Ha dejado de llover, pero el cielo sigue gris. Salimos los cinco andando a paso decidido, todos vamos callados con nuestros sentidos alerta. Hay grandes charcos por todos lados que a veces nos obligan a tener que rodearlos, haciéndonos perder mucho más tiempo. Las calles están desiertas, pero lo más impresionante es el silencio. Este sector, con toda su magnitud, lleva abandonado unos cuantos años, sólo viven en él unos cientos de inmigrantes. Hay otros sectores más habitados en estas gigantes localidades que suelen ser conocidas en este tiempo bajo el eufemístico título de centros de reubicación. Sin embargo, hemos escogido este sector porque justo se trata de una de las zonas industriales que suministraba productos de toda índole al centro. Fábricas que cerraron sus puertas conforme escasearon los recursos externos que debían proveerse con puntualidad según los acuerdos de la Comisión. Ahora sólo quedan las grandes estructuras que han sido una y cien veces saqueadas. Algunos pocos individuos siguen circundando esta región en busca de materiales útiles o vendibles, pero en un día como hoy quién querría salir a la caza de desperdicios. Alrededor de estos centros de reubicación solo existe campo abierto; se encuentran en un punto muy alejado de cualquiera de las otras regiones habitadas y “civilizadas” de esta nación.
          Me impresiona la soledad y la demacración de las edificaciones de este lugar. Hace menos de diez años todos los sectores del Centro estaban llenos de vida; incluso estas zonas que se encontraban a las afueras por ser espacios industriales. Sin embargo, ahora la mayoría de los pobladores del centro han decidido establecerse en unos cuantos de los sectores principales, lo que ha reducido la población en algunas localidades como ésta. Tenemos que llegar al punto acordado abriéndonos paso por unas cuantas avenidas vacías, edificaciones abandonadas, basura amontonada por todos lados y los incómodos charcos que en algunos puntos son verdaderos pantanos. De vez en cuando se puede apreciar en algún edificio la sombra de alguien que nos observa desde lo alto. Las pocas personas que quedan no suelen ser violentas. La mayoría son miserables que no pueden trabajar y tienen que esperar la ayuda de los familiares que se han desplazado a otros sectores del centro de reubicación para hacerse con algo de dinero. Otros viven de lo que encuentran en las calles. Vamos a paso rápido, ya que la lluvia nos ha retrasado más de una hora y nos deben estar esperando muy inquietos».

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 880€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Aviso para navegantes: La opción BACK IT es únicamente para realizar donaciones a la edición, por lo que no habrá comunicaciones posteriores en busca de datos de envío... cualquiera de las opciones válidas de reserva exige cumplimentar formulario para poder servir el pedido.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Ramón Ortega (tres) vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

Política de Privacidad
