story:
¿Qué?

El frailuco es una novela esperanzadora con un mensaje muy importante como tema de trasfondo, que sobrepasa incluso a su trama.

Como otros muchos, Poli es víctima de la crisis económica. Como consecuencia de ella, se ve envuelto en las desavenencias de sus padres; siendo un adolescente tiene que abandonar el domicilio familiar y, tras deambular por el Camino de Santiago, es acogido por los monjes de un monasterio. Estos no solo le dan cobijo, sino que a la vez le sufragan los gastos de una carrera universitaria.

Con el paso del tiempo, siendo un arquitecto afamado, Poli les recompensa con la restauración del monasterio gratuitamente, única forma que tiene de pagarle lo que un día por él hicieron los monjes.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para valorar la aceptación y viabilidad de cada título.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Domingo Andrés Miguel.

En la actualidad tiene sesenta y nueve años y se encuentra jubilado, haciendo una vida tranquila en la localidad que se menciona. Desde su prejubilación ha escrito varios libros, ninguno de ellos publicado, (será porque son muy malos), aunque no los ha presentado a ningún concurso literario. Además del actual, destacan Desempeñar su cometido (biografía de su época laboral), Mi agüelo (obseguio para los nietos), El sonido del silencio (la emigración de un joven para abrirse camino en la vida), La viruela de la vejez (peripecias de unos ancianos en una residencia), y El legado que nos dejaron.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«En la paz del interior de la celda recostado sobre su camastro, a su mente fluyeron los recuerdos de cuando de niño llegaba a casa con los pantalones rotos por haber ido al monte con su amigo Tomás a buscar nidos, abriéndose camino por parajes, nunca hollados por ningún otro niño del pueblo, entre matorrales y zarzas.
          Recuerdos de su madre, aquella mujer cariñosa, que solamente le regañaba que tuviera cuidado no le fuera a ocurrir algo. Aquella mujer de ojos negros, algo entrada en carnes, que siempre estaba dispuesta a estrecharlo entre sus brazos y apretándolo contra su corazón le perdonaba todo, hiciera la travesura que fuera. Su cara bondadosa y su alegre sonrisa la delataban. No tenía valor para castigarlo»

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 880€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de El frailuco que saldría después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Domingo Andrés Miguel vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
Each of us had a cherished dream and each of us came across a situation where everything seemed to be against you and your dream. This book is about dreams and about how to reach it no matter what.

Hi everyone! My name is Julia.

Let me present you my project. This is a nice fairy tale about a little penguin and his big dream.

You will find no text in the book, only pictures. Why? I made it this way. so that you could read it no matter the what language you speak: English, Spanish, Russian or Penguinish. Dreams speak the language of inspiration and are clear to everyone!

 

I’ve been dreaming of publishing a book for children for a long time.
And now I'm so close to doing it!

 

 

This little fairy tale has a long story.
It all started in 2014 from a small outline of the penguin in aviator’s spectacles.

 

I drew a picture I forgot about this baby for a while.
A year later I found the penguin, made a couple of sketches and forgot about it again.
Just one year ago I thought about my little fairy tale and decided to finish it no matter what!

After a bunch of sleepless nights and liters of coffee, the story is ready to see the world!

I shared it on social networks and how happy I was to see that the penguin story found its admirers!
I decided not to dwell on plain pictures and created animated versions of each picture.

I found this cute penguin so adorable, that later I created some more funny doodles and illustrations with him.


I really fell in love with this kid and his touching story. It was an exciting and fun trip, but now it's time for my penguin to start an independent life.

Maybe he'll be able to find a new home on your bookshelf?

For any contribution to my project, you will receive a reward - here a full list of cool gifts you can get.

 

 

The book illustrations are ready for printing, the only thing I need is funding for the first print run. Here is my expenses schedule:

As you can see, printing services are quite expensive. It is because the first printed series is limited.
I'm afraid my budget won’t cover these costs; therefore, I need your help!
Any small contribution will help the book to get closer to the paper version. If you cannot help financially – please, share information about the book in social networks or tell your family, friends, and colleagues about this penguin.

I will be so grateful to you! Together we can publish a book!

 

I was born in a small Siberian town in Russia, but for the last 10 years, I’ve been living in the Czech Republic. I graduated from the Art University in the Czech Republic and specialized in animation. Now I work as an illustrator and an entertainer in a gaming company. I enjoy playing computer games and writing tales for kids.
The dream of creating my own fairy tale was with me for a long time. I had many ideas to implement, but in the end, I chose the penguin story.
When I typed the first test copy of this book, I could not believe my eyes. A story that accompanied me during all these days and nights on the screen of a graphic tablet suddenly turned into a real book!

Later, when I started sharing this story, I got even more enthusiastic about it: it's so nice to see and hear feedback from grown-ups and kids. They liked the fairy tale so much and were touched by my story.

I would like to share this little magic with the greatest audience I can!

Why are there two versions of the book, is there any difference between them?

I want to publish two book versions: paperback and hardcover. The books are identical. But I realize that the hardcover version can be too expensive.


Why the hardcover book is a lot more expensive than other hardcover children's books?

Because I publish the book in 100 copies for the first time.


How can we be sure that the book will be published in great quality?

I have been working as an illustrator for more than seven years and I have experience with publishers. So, I will do my best to ensure this book will come to you at its best!

Can I order delivery around the world?

Of course! It doesn’t matter where you are, in the Amazon rainforest or on the snowy peak of the Himalayas, the Penguin Aviation service will deliver your valuable cargo to you!
When choosing a reward, specify the country and the site will automatically add the cost of delivery.


It's all great, but I'm still not sure, I haven’t even seen this fairy tale!

In this case, you can find examples of illustrations and animations on my Instagram, Facebook or Vkontakte or read the entire fairy tale on my blog.
There you can see the story of the fairy tale creation tale and my other works.

I really like the little penguin, but I have no opportunity to help you financially.

Never mind! You can help me by liking the entry or sharing information about the book you’re your friends. I’ll be glad to hear what you think about it. I will be grateful for any help!


Do you have more questions? You can ask me here, on social networks or write me a mail.

Thank you for your attention!

story:
Dear Friends,

I’m launching this Indiegogo campaign to raise funds for publishing my new book, At This Table. I am excited at the prospect of bringing these poems of love and nature to your table.

Please take a look below at the endorsements from Llewellyn Vaughan-Lee, Michael Meade, Maya Khosla, and John Fox.

Perhaps you’ve seen the National Geographic selected 5-minute documentary, At This Table, which tells my story and includes two poems from the new book. You can watch it on my site, raphaelblock.com.

The cost of publication, cover design etc. is $2,500. Whatever donation you feel able to make, I will be most grateful. Starting at $25, you will receive a copy of the new book. If you’re able to give less, I will send you audio poems. For higher donations please see details of perks.

An equally important part of this campaign is to please share it with your friends and communities whether by email, social media, or word of mouth. Thank you so much!

Quite apart from this, I plan to record all the poems in At This Table and make them available to those interested at no cost.

To make this quick and easy, this campaign will wrap up by Winter Solstice on December 21st.

With love and appreciation,
        Raphael

 

Endorsements for At This Table

 

Simple, poignant beauty touches the heart, the soul and the senses. A bowl of oats, the cry of a hawk, human pain and joy, these are the seeds and the fruits that give life its depth and meaning. Here, life is a single tapestry of love, fully felt, in sun and rain. Allow these poems to speak to you, to unravel you, to take you back to what is essential.

Llewellyn Vaughan-Lee, Sufi Teacher and Author,
Editor of Spiritual Ecology—The Cry of the Earth

 

At This Table is a celebration of the gift of life as found in the rising of crocus shoots, in the diving of winged birds, and the whispering of bees. Raphael invites us to the table where great Nature and human nature meet in order to rejoice.  

Michael Meade, author of Awakening the Soul

 

Raphael Block’s lyrical collection invites us to imagine “this table,” as far more than a table – an ecologically expansive structure set to welcome the intricacies of the natural world, and ourselves as an integral part of that whole. His songs of praise are elated with the details. Here is a celebration that dissolves the boundaries between indoor and outdoor spaces and offers us a chance to “flourish and breathe under sun-fog-rain sway.”  

Maya Khosla, Sonoma County Poet Laureate
Author of All the Fires of Wind and Light

 

This gathering of poetry by Raphael Block is in deep spiritual movement.  I can’t tell if it’s one Dervish whirling out all six dimensions of consciousness contained in these pages or rather six Dervishes who, interweaving one another, stir to life all seventy-five poems in their up-turned palms.  

Am I mesmerized by the clear and exquisite detail?   Am I awakened by a profoundly sincere Love?  Are these two seemingly different results serving one another?  I feel the answer is yes, but I encourage you to read At This Table for yourself!  You may be pleased to discover so much more. 

John Fox, Author of The Only Gift to Bring
President, The Institute for Poetic Medicine

story:
Story of My Book

College students have a hard time navigating through their career options because sometimes they get overwhelmed and confused, while some individuals cannot afford education, there are high-quality Bootcamps and expensive resources out there, it is challenging for some people to afford to take the steps toward a tech career. I aim to break the stereotype of having traditional paths for students when they are at college and help instill creativity and learning methods for them and for those who can and cannot afford education. I strive to empower women entrepreneurs and promote the LGBTQ community. I ask you to help me make the tech industry accessible for all!

------------

Breaking Stereotypes: How to break into the tech industry is an accessible guide and self-help book for those who want to learn more about the technology world, from traditional Software Engineering to Machine Learning, Product Management, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Quantum Computing,  initiatives and events from top companies helpful for international and high school students and even MORE. It also explores themes regarding minority groups participating in the tech world; including women and promoting the LGBTQ community. This book is for those who seek to educate themselves on the nature of this industry and even seek to participate in it.

My name is Varun Nair, and I am the author of Breaking Stereotypes. I made the decision while pursuing my master's degree to write a book because I want to make a radical change in the innovation space by ensuring that anyone who aspires can have the confidence to make globally impactful change using their resources, unique skills, and experiences so that they are empowered to dream and fulfill their true potential.

My hope is that, in reading this, you will discover the nuances as well as a brief perspective on the tech industry in one concise resource. I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for the ever-growing world. Ultimately, I want you to see this as a tool to help you to start learning more about this sector and promote diversity and inclusion.

In this book, you'll learn about software engineering, product management, data science, and much more! You'll hear stories such as...

  • What are the different paths to take if you want a career change?
  • Why Quantum Computing is going to shape the world
  • How Computer Science and innovation is more than just coding
  • How women have shaped the avant-garde tech space

You will love this book if you are thinking about entering this space, unclear about the best path you may want to take, or maybe even want to corroborate your existing ideas and approach!

Breaking Stereotypes is a nonfiction book that speaks to aspiring and upcoming students, lateral professionals, parents, and guardians of aspiring next-gen children who would partake and change this sector.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish it.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!
 

About the Author

Varun Nair is currently pursuing a master's in Computer Science. Born in the ever-hustling city Mumbai and raised in Kuwait, Varun considers himself a global citizen and is passionate about learning new languages. He fell in love with computers at the tender age of four when his dad gave him a computer and gave him the opportunity to play a game that had Tony the Tiger. Thus, tinkering turned to passion, when he chose to spend the rest of his life playing and learning about computers.

A short yet brief trek later he came to the realization of the human element in the digital world and since then there's a different wave, a different future he is riding into. Passionate about Product Management, Varun wants to be “the human” at the junction of the human-product world, taking up challenging ideas and delivering a great customer experience.

Seeking the simple yet biggest question in life, Varun has found the answer to his happiness - people. Always happy to help others selflessly, he strongly believes that one day his vision to make an impact in people's lives in a revolutionary manner to change the world shall come forth and, he, is not afraid to admit that. They say the believers are often crazy ones.

Varun wrote this book because he wanted to motivate people regardless of their sex and sexual orientation. He wanted to make people think that they can dream big and they do not need to have a prestigious college degree to get the right knowledge.

Often to unwind at the end of a long day/week, Varun seeks his recreational recharge in his gaming console, reading books, researching, coding, learning about new technologies, and of course trying to pull off pranks that more often than not miscarry.

For more information, you can connect with Varun at nairv1@udayton.edu and at
Linkedin - https://www.linkedin.com/in/varunnair1997/
Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/varuuuuuuunniah/.
Instagram - https://www.instagram.com/varunnair__/?hl=en

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #DreamTech and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.
Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Varun Nair

story:
“TO BE CONTINUED…”   has appeared on every Supernatural script until the last one, and it's the theme for this fundraiser. As the show ends, fandom will continue, and the SupernaturalWiki will be here for you!

The SuperWiki will continue our comprehensive coverage of Supernatural – there is always more to document about each episode, new behind the scenes details and musings on Sam's hair. We will be archiving fandom projects from Tumblr and LiveJournal so they are not lost, and remain a place for new Supernatural fans to discover the show and our fandom.

We will keep you up-to-date with the casts' new projects like Walker, The Boys, and Misha's latest shenanigans and of course the inevitable Supernatural movie!  We’ll continue to cover conventions and music events, update our entries on fandom creative efforts from fanfic to Impala restorations and keep you up to date on the SPNFamily's charity efforts.  

The SuperWiki will continue to welcome any fans who wants to contribute, because you make it as erudite, diverse, and quirky as it is. We support fans in learning how to code on the Wiki, create and edit entries or in host their own projects on the site. Getting involved is a great way to continue your love for Supernatural. 

The SupernaturalWiki will help keep our SPNFamily connected through @SuperWiki on Twitter and our email newsletter Route 66.

We want to give you a super-charged, extra awesome Supernatural Wiki that will be here until the end of days!  100% of the money raised goes directly into the costs of hosting and maintaining the site.

The Supernatural Wiki is a not-for-profit fandom project. We have always been ad-free and independent – run by fans for fans. This means you won’t be bombarded with ads, we won’t change our content to attract advertisers, and we won’t disappear because a corporation sells the site.

Two years and a half years ago fandom raised over $5,000 for the SupernaturalWiki and that money has covered our costs since that time.

Our costs each year include leasing a server and paying IT support for upgrades, maintaining backups and security systems, and trouble-shooting issues such as spam attacks.  The aim is to cover costs for the next two years. Note that the donation levels are shown in Australian dollars.

ITEM

COST 

Lease of dedicated server            

$1,200 p.a.

IT support

$1,000 p.a.

Domain name

$100 p.a.

Indiegogo and transaction fees

$500

In recognition that my work on the SupernaturalWiki takes place on the unceded land of the Kulin Nations,  5% of the funds raised will be donated to Seed, a movement of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander young people for climate justice. Their vision is for a just and sustainable future with strong cultures and communities, powered by renewable energy. 

Based on the theme “To Be Continued…” we have produced enamel pins and silicon wristbands.

The enamel pins are 4 cm or just over 1 ½ inches long, with two pins on the back, so it won’t fall off while you are on a hunt. They feature the words “To Be Continued” topped by the Impala. 

The silicon wristbands are 1.2 cm wide with a circumference of 20cm. They are black with the words “TO BE CONTINUED” and "Supernatural Family" debossed as well as an anti-possession symbol.

Please be aware that due to the pandemic, delivery times outside of Australia are likely to be over four weeks. Cost of shipping is a flat rate of $5 for anywhere in the world, for any level of perks. Unfortunately, the cost of tracking of items is prohibitive.

We will notify you when your item has been sent. We are unable to replace items that you don’t receive. Please consider this when making your donation.  

I will use whatever funds are raised to support the Supernatural Wiki.  Then I’ll try alternative fundraising strategies such as selling t-shirts, hustling pool and dark magic. The SuperWiki will continue because... we got work to do!

“TO BE CONTINUED…”   has appeared on every Supernatural script until the last one, and it's the theme for this fundraiser. As the show ends, fandom will continue, and the SupernaturalWiki will be here for you!The SuperWiki will continue our comprehensive coverage of Supernatural – there is always more to document about each episode, new behind the scenes details and musings on Sam's hair. We will be archiving fandom projects from Tumblr and LiveJournal so they are not lost, and remain a place for new Supernatural fans to discover the show and our fandom.We will keep you up-to-date with the casts' new projects like Walker, The Boys, and Misha's latest shenanigans and of course the inevitable Supernatural movie!  We’ll continue to cover conventions and music events, update our entries on fandom creative efforts from fanfic to Impala restorations and keep you up to date on the SPNFamily's charity efforts.  The SuperWiki will continue to welcome any fans who wants to contribute, because you make it as erudite, diverse, and quirky as it is. We support fans in learning how to code on the Wiki, create and edit entries or in host their own projects on the site. Getting involved is a great way to continue your love for Supernatural. The SupernaturalWiki will help keep our SPNFamily connected through @SuperWiki on Twitter and our email newsletter Route 66.We want to give you a super-charged, extra awesome Supernatural Wiki that will be here until the end of days!  100% of the money raised goes directly into the costs of hosting and maintaining the site.The Supernatural Wiki is a not-for-profit fandom project. We have always been ad-free and independent – run by fans for fans. This means you won’t be bombarded with ads, we won’t change our content to attract advertisers, and we won’t disappear because a corporation sells the site.Two years and a half years ago fandom raised over $5,000 for the SupernaturalWiki and that money has covered our costs since that time.Our costs each year include leasing a server and paying IT support for upgrades, maintaining backups and security systems, and trouble-shooting issues such as spam attacks.  The aim is to cover costs for the next two years. Note that the donation levels are shown in Australian dollars.

ITEM
COST 


Lease of dedicated server            
$1,200 p.a.


IT support
$1,000 p.a.


Domain name
$100 p.a.


Indiegogo and transaction fees
$500

In recognition that my work on the SupernaturalWiki takes place on the unceded land of the Kulin Nations,  5% of the funds raised will be donated to Seed, a movement of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander young people for climate justice. Their vision is for a just and sustainable future with strong cultures and communities, powered by renewable energy. Based on the theme “To Be Continued…” we have produced enamel pins and silicon wristbands.The enamel pins are 4 cm or just over 1 ½ inches long, with two pins on the back, so it won’t fall off while you are on a hunt. They feature the words “To Be Continued” topped by the Impala. The silicon wristbands are 1.2 cm wide with a circumference of 20cm. They are black with the words “TO BE CONTINUED” and "Supernatural Family" debossed as well as an anti-possession symbol.Please be aware that due to the pandemic, delivery times outside of Australia are likely to be over four weeks. Cost of shipping is a flat rate of $5 for anywhere in the world, for any level of perks. Unfortunately, the cost of tracking of items is prohibitive.We will notify you when your item has been sent. We are unable to replace items that you don’t receive. Please consider this when making your donation.  I will use whatever funds are raised to support the Supernatural Wiki.  Then I’ll try alternative fundraising strategies such as selling t-shirts, hustling pool and dark magic. The SuperWiki will continue because... we got work to do!

story:
Love Lottery

With gentle rhyming and fanciful illustrations flowing across the pages, you'll be swept up in the magic of it all, just when we may need it the most.

Love Lottery was fully funding with our crowdfunding platform in less than 24 hours and we were able to unlock 6 stretch goals to make this book come to life in the best possible way!  And we are now moving our pre-orders to Indiegogo!

Don’t buy this book because you need another typical children’s book.  Buy it because you want to share the message of love and show your child that love can conquer all!

For me, my hard times turned to gratitude when I looked at these precious gifts of young innocence and celebrated them- my Love Lotteries.

​I'm confident you will feel my loving intention and connect to this story, as it is now a piece of all of us to share.

Love Lottery:

 

Love Lottery is my heart and soul poured into a book sharing what we can overcome with love, attitudes, wishes, and desires. It demonstrates love conquers all and that no matter what, our children are a blessing that is even greater than winning the lottery...they are our very own Love Lottery!

We have the book completed, and are currently fufilling all orders!  Order your copy today, as this first print run has limited avalability. 

When you read this book alongside your child, my hope is you’ll see how wishes, luck, positivity can offer a glimmer of hope.  You’ll see my vision of how love conquers all.  It is a message we want our children to hear, and for us to be reminded.  It is so important they grow up feeling treasured and there is no greater gift than them being exactly who they are.

This book is beyond beautiful with words, illustrations, and upgrades.

10"x10" hardcover (with a gold foiled title) It's going to be both stunning inside and out!  

Love Lottery will bring a rainbow of warmth and inspiration to your hearts, creating treasured memories that will stand the test of time.

Yes, we love all the stories about Goldilocks and The Three Bears, adventures, unicorns, mysteries, silly, educational, along with the numerous YOU CAN BE ANYTHING books... the Love Lottery offers a tender and welcomed addition to your bookshelf.

This heartfelt book feels like the sunshine of truth flies off every page.  

With a welcoming and calming color palette, the illustrations impart the warmth and positivity of Love Lottery.  It has been wonderful working with her in the creation of this timeless children's book. Watch as Melanie creates some Love Lottery magic before your very eyes…

Dedication

With hopes of honoring everyone and their unique journey, I have made my dedication page heartfelt for everyone to connect to, no matter what you have been through or are going through.  Big hugs and lots of Love. From my heart to yours.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us spread the message of love and Love Lottery.  It would mean the world to us to if you would share this beautiful book with anyone else that you think would love it too.  Indiegogo has great share tools!  We would love for you to use one, or use them all! 
 

Love, hugs, health, and gratitude,

Leigha

story:
11/5/20 Update

Thanks to many wonderful backers, my Kickstarter campaign was successfully funded! Now, I am on a mission to raise additional funds in order to donate as many books as possible to libraries, schools, and children in need. When children and their families face hardship and uncertainty (like so many are today), this book can be a resource that helps them through those struggles. Its messages of perseverance and teamwork encourage readers not to give up and to lean on each other to overcome whatever obstacles they face. Let's share this book and its timely message with as many kids as possible: For every $100 that is pledged beyond $10,000, I will donate 1 additional hardcover book, so please continue to pledge and spread the word about my campaign! Thank you for your support!

 

The Summary

The Train Rolls On is a rhyming children's book that follows a determined train on a wild zoo adventure and teaches kids perseverance and teamwork. The book is illustrated by Christina Wald, and it will be published in the Spring of 2021. 

The Train Approaches The Station To Pick Up Its Passengers

 

The Details

Format: To be available in hardcover, paperback, and eBook versions

Length: 32 pages

Word Count: 469 Words

Recommended Ages: 3+

 

The Story 

In The Train Rolls On, a determined train embarks on a journey to deliver a lively bunch of animals to the zoo for its grand opening.

  The Animals Prepare To Board The Train For The Zoo

 

Excerpt:

Each ticket is checked

and given a punch.

The passengers board-

they're one eager bunch!

 

Each animal’s ready.

The crew is set, too.

The engineer waves.

Next stop:  the ZOO! 

 

The coal has been poured,

so welcome aboard…and THE TRAIN ROLLS ON!

Chugga chugga choo choo!

 

The Animals Board The Train And Depart For The Zoo

 

On its way to the zoo, the train encounters several obstacles: a steep hill, a narrow bridge, and restless, rowdy passengers. Despite feeling tired, scared, and (at times) out of control, the train digs deep and overcomes each obstacle. 

The Train Nervously Crosses A Tall, Narrow Bridge

 

The Restless Passengers Cause Trouble For The Train

 

Just when the train thinks that it’s home-free, an even bigger obstacle stops it in its tracks. The train and its crew are forced to ask an unexpected source for assistance, and they must rely on teamwork to overcome this final challenge. Will they make it to the zoo in time for the animals’ big debut?

The Train Encounters A Fallen Tree On The Track

 

This modern train adventure encourages children to persevere through life’s many challenges and to overcome fatigue, fear, and circumstances beyond their control. It also reminds children that it’s okay to ask for help and celebrates teamwork as a means of accomplishing lofty goals. With its rich vocabulary, catchy refrain, and beautiful illustrations, The Train Rolls On is sure to appeal to children and adults alike.

If you are interested in reading a longer excerpt from the book, sign up to receive my monthly newsletter at www.JodiAdamsAuthor.com. A free excerpt will be emailed to you immediately following sign-up!  

 

The Inspiration

One of my all-time favorite children’s books is The Little Engine That Could. My parents read it to me countless times as a child, and I now enjoy reading it with my daughter, Avery. I love that it combines trains, zoo animals, and toys to teach children about kindness and perseverance. It is an undeniable classic and likely always will be. 

Avery and I Reading The Little Engine That Could

 

The Train Rolls On is my modern take on this classic train adventure. Upon reading The Little Engine That Could with Avery, I often found myself wondering what a modern version of the story would look (and sound) like. I wondered if a short, rhyming text paired with bold, modern illustrations would capture her attention even more. So, as hesitant as I was to replicate such a giant in the children’s publishing world, I wrote The Train Rolls On in an effort to update and recreate this classic story in a way that resonates with today’s youth.

 

Who Am I?

I am a former Crime Scene Investigator (CSI) turned stay-at-home mom who has a passion for teaching and promoting children’s literacy. I live in Omaha, NE, with my husband, Eric, and my three-year-old daughter, Avery.  

Eric, Avery, and I Hanging Out At Home

 

Avery and I love reading books together. I have always loved reading and writing, but it wasn’t until Avery was born that I rediscovered my passion for children’s fiction. The Train Rolls On is my first children’s book, but I’m hoping that it will be the first of many.

Avery and I Reading On The Porch

 

How Did I Get Here?

One day in early 2019, Avery and I were reading stories together when I said to myself: "Why don’t I write a children’s book? Many others have done it. Why can’t I?" Shortly afterward, I wrote my first story…and then I couldn’t stop writing.

My Writing Space

 

By the end of 2019, I had written several children’s book manuscripts, but I still didn’t know anything about the publishing process. I didn't even know where to start. I just knew that I wanted to share my stories with others. 

So, this past January, I finally took the leap and decided to figure out what I needed to do to publish at least one book. Not knowing where to start, I Googled “How to publish a children’s book” and went from there. Many, many hours of research later, I have started my own publishing company (Young At Heart Publishing, LLC), and I am well on my way to self-publishing The Train Rolls On.

My Author Website

 

The Why 

 

1. I want to write and publish books that help children develop rich vocabulary and are fun for kids and their caregivers to read.  

I have seen the spark and love of learning that reading to a child creates, and I want to use my love of writing to give that gift to other kids and their families. I have always wanted to make a difference in the world, and I believe that writing children’s books is one way that I can do that.

 

2. This book could be the start of a new career path.

From 2011-2018, I was a CSI and CSI Field Supervisor. Then, my daughter was born…and everything changed. In 2018, I made the difficult decision to leave my CSI career and stay home with Avery full-time. In the end, it was the best decision for our family, and it has led me down this surprising new path of writing and publishing children’s books. I’m hoping to learn and grow through this process and to see where this new journey takes me. If this book is well-received, I'd love to write and publish many, many more. 

 

3. I want to set a strong example for my daughter and teach other aspiring writers how to share their stories with the world.

Even though my daughter is young, I want to set an example for her, showing her what it means to set a lofty goal and work really hard to achieve it. More than anything, I want her to grow up believing that she can do anything she sets her mind to, even if that means starting a new project (or career) from scratch.  

In addition, I plan to use my self-publishing experience to help other writers navigate the self-publishing process. Many people have dreamed about writing a book, but they aren’t sure how to make that dream a reality. They don’t know what steps to take or who to turn to for help. I have been there, so I want to do my part to help others fulfill their dream and share their stories with the world. If I can do it, they can too! 

"Let's Do This!"

 

The Goal

The goal of my Kickstarter campaign was to raise enough money to finish the book's illustrations and design and to print the completed books.

 

The Illustrations

Christina Wald began work on the book's illustrations in May. She originally sketched thumbnail-sized spreads in order to determine the best sequence, layout, and viewpoint of each illustration. Then she created full-scale sketches from each thumbnail. The full-scale sketches were completed and approved in mid-August, at which point Christina shifted her focus to sketching and finalizing the book's cover art.  

Original Thumbnail Sketches For Pages 2-15

 

As of the beginning of this campaign, all interior sketches and the final cover art are complete, and Christina is working on converting the interior sketches to final color illustrations. She is planning to complete all interior illustrations by early December.

 

The Design

In addition to an illustrator, I have hired a professional book designer. His name is David Miles, and his job is to optimize the book's readability and overall aesthetic, ensuring that it conforms to the standards of its genre but still stands out among the crowd. To this end, David will choose and arrange the book's fonts, design its front and back covers, and assemble the title page and copyright information. He will also collaborate all of the book's elements (its pages, text, illustrations, front cover, spine, back cover, etc.) into a cohesive, eye-catching package.

David Miles & Family

 

Once I began researching the various elements of book design, I quickly realized how many formatting and design decisions must be made and, thus, how beneficial it would be to have someone walk me through the design process with this first book. By hiring a professional designer, I am hoping to learn about publishing industry standards and the design decision-making process and to elevate the book beyond what I could currently create alone.

For more details regarding the decisions that book designers make, check out my What In The World Is A Book Designer & Why Did I Hire One? blog article.

 

The Printing

To ensure that The Train Rolls On is printed and bound using high-quality materials, I have elected to print the books through IngramSpark. IngramSpark is the self-publishing division of Ingram Content Group, which is the largest printer and distributor of books to bookstores, libraries, and academic institutions across the globe. In other words, they're the real deal! Most major publishing houses turn to Ingram for their book printing and distribution, so I am turning to IngramSpark for mine. IngramSpark will be printing paperback and hardcover versions of the book, both measuring 8" x 10" in size. 

 

The Creative Team 

 

The Timeline

The Train Rolls On is completely written and has been professionally edited. The interior sketches and cover are also complete, and Christina Wald is currently working on turning the interior sketches into final color illustrations. I plan to print and ship the books to backers next spring:

 

 December 2020: Complete illustrations

 January 2021: Complete book design

 February 2021: Order prototypes; Review and make any necessary adjustments

 March 2021: Print finished books; Review quality and prepare for shipping

 April-May 2021: Ship rewards to backers 

 

Yes, the delivery date is several months away, but I can assure you that it will be worth the wait! Good things take time, and our entire team wants to make sure that we have enough time to get everything just right. Pre-order The Train Rolls On today, and you will be among the first to receive a copy of the completed book, plus you’ll have the satisfaction of knowing that you helped us bring this story to life and share it with the world!


 

The Perks

Most of the perks are self-explanatory; however, the Fun For The Kids Gift Box contains a few items that are better shown through photos:

Choices of Stuffed Animal In Fun For The Kids Gift Box

 

Animal Sticker Sheet In Fun For The Kids Gift Box

 

A custom activity and coloring book is also included in the gift box. It contains 2 sticker scenes, 6 coloring pages, and 20+ educational activities based on The Train Rolls On. The activities cater to a variety of age groups and help kids learn about letters, numbers, colors, shapes, animals, etc. Example activities are provided below:    

 

Custom Activity & Coloring Book in Fun For The Kids Gift Box

 

Custom Activity & Coloring Book in Fun For The Kids Gift Box

 

Custom Activity & Coloring Book in Fun For The Kids Gift Box

 

The Add-Ons

Don’t see a reward tier that fits your needs? I will do my best to accommodate you. Most of the tiers have add-on options that allow you to pre-order extra items by increasing your pledge amount as follows: 

 

Extra Paperback Book = $12 each 

Extra Hardcover Book = $20 each 

Custom Activity & Coloring Book = $20 each 

 

*Note: No add-ons are available for the Publication Notification or eBook tiers.

 

If you have any questions at all, please don't hesitate to send me a message.

 

 

The Budget 

Below is a chart that shows how the pledged Kickstarter funds will be used:

All additional funds will be used to fulfill backer rewards and to donate additional books to libraries, schools, and children in need.

 

The Stretch Goals

Stretch Goal #1: If the campaign reaches $8,500, I will record myself reading the book and post it on YouTube in an effort to reach more kids.  (COMPLETE)

Stretch Goal #2: If the campaign reaches $9,000, I will donate 20 hardcover books to libraries and schools. ​(COMPLETE)

Stretch Goal #3: If the campaign reaches $9,500, I will send 3 coloring pages and 3 educational activities to every backer! All coloring pages and activities are custom-made and are based on The Train Rolls On. The activities are geared toward a variety of age groups, and they help children learn letters, numbers, shapes, and colors. Each activity has been made with love and is "Avery-approved," so I'm really hoping to be able to share them with you! ​(COMPLETE)

Stretch Goal #4: If the campaign reaches $10,000, I will donate 20 more hardcover books to libraries and schools, for a total of 40 donated books! ​

Stretch Goal #5: For every $100 pledged beyond $10,000, I will donate 1 additional hardcover book. Let's share this book with as many kids as possible, so please continue to pledge and spread the word about my campaign! Thank you!

 

You Want In! What’s Next?

I am beyond grateful for your support- it really means a lot! Please select your favorite perk, and pledge the corresponding amount. Don't forget to select one or more add-on items, if desired.

 

Other Ways You Can Help 

Not interested in pledging? No problem- you can still show your support by sharing my campaign information with family, friends, coworkers, or your social media communities...basically anyone who might love this book or want to support my cause!

 

Risks and challenges

This is an unprecedented time with COVID-19, and our creative team (like everyone else) is a little uncertain what will happen next. That being said, we will do our absolute best to deliver on our promises. I have tried to mitigate as many risks as possible and have already built extra time into our schedule to deal with potential setbacks. Still, it is possible that the timeline will need to be extended (if completing the illustrations or design takes longer than expected or errors occur during printing). Rest assured, however, that I will handle any such issues with the utmost transparency and care for my backers, notifying you of any delivery delays. Thank you so much for your support, especially during these uncertain times. I couldn’t do this without you!

 

Special Thanks To...

  • My husband, Eric, for always being my #1 fan
  • My daughter, Avery, for her daily inspiration
  • My parents, Tom and Barb Monahan, for teaching me to work hard, dream big, and believe in myself
  • My grandmother, Carol Johannesen, for her unending support and encouragement
  • My husband’s parents, Doug and Kelly Adams, for their love, support, and positivity 
  • Sarah Fabiny, for her wisdom, superb editing skills, and encouragement
  • Christina Wald, for her creativity, artistic talent, and dedication to this book
  • David Miles, for his patience, keen design sense, and enthusiasm

I’m hoping to learn and grow through this process and to see where this new journey takes me. If this book is well-received, I'd love to write and publish many, many more.  3. I want to set a strong example for my daughter and teach other aspiring writers how to share their stories with the world.Even though my daughter is young, I want to set an example for her, showing her what it means to set a lofty goal and work really hard to achieve it. More than anything, I want her to grow up believing that she can do anything she sets her mind to, even if that means starting a new project (or career) from scratch.  In addition, I plan to use my self-publishing experience to help other writers navigate the self-publishing process. Many people have dreamed about writing a book, but they aren’t sure how to make that dream a reality. They don’t know what steps to take or who to turn to for help. I have been there, so I want to do my part to help others fulfill their dream and share their stories with the world. If I can do it, they can too! "Let's Do This!" The GoalThe goal of my Kickstarter campaign was to raise enough money to finish the book's illustrations and design and to print the completed books. The IllustrationsChristina Wald began work on the book's illustrations in May. She originally sketched thumbnail-sized spreads in order to determine the best sequence, layout, and viewpoint of each illustration. Then she created full-scale sketches from each thumbnail. The full-scale sketches were completed and approved in mid-August, at which point Christina shifted her focus to sketching and finalizing the book's cover art.  Original Thumbnail Sketches For Pages 2-15 As of the beginning of this campaign, all interior sketches and the final cover art are complete, and Christina is working on converting the interior sketches to final color illustrations. She is planning to complete all interior illustrations by early December. The DesignIn addition to an illustrator, I have hired a professional book designer. His name is David Miles, and his job is to optimize the book's readability and overall aesthetic, ensuring that it conforms to the standards of its genre but still stands out among the crowd. To this end, David will choose and arrange the book's fonts, design its front and back covers, and assemble the title page and copyright information. He will also collaborate all of the book's elements (its pages, text, illustrations, front cover, spine, back cover, etc.) into a cohesive, eye-catching package.David Miles & Family Once I began researching the various elements of book design, I quickly realized how many formatting and design decisions must be made and, thus, how beneficial it would be to have someone walk me through the design process with this first book. By hiring a professional designer, I am hoping to learn about publishing industry standards and the design decision-making process and to elevate the book beyond what I could currently create alone.For more details regarding the decisions that book designers make, check out my What In The World Is A Book Designer & Why Did I Hire One? blog article. The PrintingTo ensure that The Train Rolls On is printed and bound using high-quality materials, I have elected to print the books through IngramSpark. IngramSpark is the self-publishing division of Ingram Content Group, which is the largest printer and distributor of books to bookstores, libraries, and academic institutions across the globe. In other words, they're the real deal! Most major publishing houses turn to Ingram for their book printing and distribution, so I am turning to IngramSpark for mine. IngramSpark will be printing paperback and hardcover versions of the book, both measuring 8" x 10" in size.  The Creative Team  The TimelineThe Train Rolls On is completely written and has been professionally edited. The interior sketches and cover are also complete, and Christina Wald is currently working on turning the interior sketches into final color illustrations. I plan to print and ship the books to backers next spring:  December 2020: Complete illustrations January 2021: Complete book design February 2021: Order prototypes; Review and make any necessary adjustments March 2021: Print finished books; Review quality and prepare for shipping April-May 2021: Ship rewards to backers  Yes, the delivery date is several months away, but I can assure you that it will be worth the wait! Good things take time, and our entire team wants to make sure that we have enough time to get everything just right. Pre-order The Train Rolls On today, and you will be among the first to receive a copy of the completed book, plus you’ll have the satisfaction of knowing that you helped us bring this story to life and share it with the world! The PerksMost of the perks are self-explanatory; however, the Fun For The Kids Gift Box contains a few items that are better shown through photos:Choices of Stuffed Animal In Fun For The Kids Gift Box Animal Sticker Sheet In Fun For The Kids Gift Box A custom activity and coloring book is also included in the gift box. It contains 2 sticker scenes, 6 coloring pages, and 20+ educational activities based on The Train Rolls On. The activities cater to a variety of age groups and help kids learn about letters, numbers, colors, shapes, animals, etc. Example activities are provided below:     Custom Activity & Coloring Book in Fun For The Kids Gift Box Custom Activity & Coloring Book in Fun For The Kids Gift Box Custom Activity & Coloring Book in Fun For The Kids Gift Box The Add-OnsDon’t see a reward tier that fits your needs? I will do my best to accommodate you. Most of the tiers have add-on options that allow you to pre-order extra items by increasing your pledge amount as follows:  Extra Paperback Book = $12 each Extra Hardcover Book = $20 each Custom Activity & Coloring Book = $20 each  *Note: No add-ons are available for the Publication Notification or eBook tiers. If you have any questions at all, please don't hesitate to send me a message.  The Budget Below is a chart that shows how the pledged Kickstarter funds will be used:All additional funds will be used to fulfill backer rewards and to donate additional books to libraries, schools, and children in need. The Stretch GoalsStretch Goal #1: If the campaign reaches $8,500, I will record myself reading the book and post it on YouTube in an effort to reach more kids.  (COMPLETE)Stretch Goal #2: If the campaign reaches $9,000, I will donate 20 hardcover books to libraries and schools. ​(COMPLETE)Stretch Goal #3: If the campaign reaches $9,500, I will send 3 coloring pages and 3 educational activities to every backer! All coloring pages and activities are custom-made and are based on The Train Rolls On. The activities are geared toward a variety of age groups, and they help children learn letters, numbers, shapes, and colors. Each activity has been made with love and is "Avery-approved," so I'm really hoping to be able to share them with you! ​(COMPLETE)Stretch Goal #4: If the campaign reaches $10,000, I will donate 20 more hardcover books to libraries and schools, for a total of 40 donated books! ​Stretch Goal #5: For every $100 pledged beyond $10,000, I will donate 1 additional hardcover book. Let's share this book with as many kids as possible, so please continue to pledge and spread the word about my campaign! Thank you! You Want In! What’s Next?I am beyond grateful for your support- it really means a lot! Please select your favorite perk, and pledge the corresponding amount. Don't forget to select one or more add-on items, if desired. Other Ways You Can Help Not interested in pledging? No problem- you can still show your support by sharing my campaign information with family, friends, coworkers, or your social media communities...basically anyone who might love this book or want to support my cause! Risks and challengesThis is an unprecedented time with COVID-19, and our creative team (like everyone else) is a little uncertain what will happen next. That being said, we will do our absolute best to deliver on our promises. I have tried to mitigate as many risks as possible and have already built extra time into our schedule to deal with potential setbacks. Still, it is possible that the timeline will need to be extended (if completing the illustrations or design takes longer than expected or errors occur during printing). Rest assured, however, that I will handle any such issues with the utmost transparency and care for my backers, notifying you of any delivery delays. Thank you so much for your support, especially during these uncertain times. I couldn’t do this without you! Special Thanks To...
My husband, Eric, for always being my #1 fan
My daughter, Avery, for her daily inspiration
My parents, Tom and Barb Monahan, for teaching me to work hard, dream big, and believe in myself
My grandmother, Carol Johannesen, for her unending support and encouragement
My husband’s parents, Doug and Kelly Adams, for their love, support, and positivity 
Sarah Fabiny, for her wisdom, superb editing skills, and encouragement
Christina Wald, for her creativity, artistic talent, and dedication to this book
David Miles, for his patience, keen design sense, and enthusiasm

story:
Story of My Book

My name is Aviva Peltin, and I am the author of Get Crunchy: How To Be a Sustainable, Healthy, and Smart Consumer. I wrote this book because I wanted to showcase companies that inspire me and offer products I use regularly. The founders of these companies run sustainably-minded and health-oriented businesses, showing us what is possible. I write about safe and healthy alternatives when considering personal care products, food, clothing, electronics, and housewares. 

My book examines the pre-conceived notions of consumers, many of whom assume that if a product is on a shelf in a store, it is safe. Sadly, that assumption is incorrect. We cannot blindly trust companies. 

My hope is that you will discover, through reading this book, that transparency in the marketplace is possible. Greenwashing is a modern epidemic — a marketing technique in which brands pretend their products are sustainable and healthy when in actuality, they are not. Examples of greenwashing include products labeled with buzzwords such as, “natural,” “eco-friendly,” “green,” “non-toxic,” and, “earth-friendly,” when in reality, they contain carcinogens and other toxic materials. I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that these founders feel about sustainability, business, health, natural living, and conscious consumerism. 

You'll learn about the intersections between business, environmentalism, and health: 

  • I interview the founder of a successful sustainable clothing chain and discuss how to have the most sustainable, healthy, and cutest wardrobe.

  • I interview various founders of women’s health companies, such as the owner of a sustainable condom company, the co-creator of period-proof underwear, and the inventor of a fertility monitor that can tell a woman when she can conceive.

  • I interview the founder of a glass water bottle and baby bottle company and explain how to avoid consuming a credit card-sized amount of microplastics per week. 

  • I interview the CEO of an organic heath food store chain and explain why triple-bottom business practices are essential. 

  • I interview the founder of an integrative pharmacy chain and discuss how the combination of Western and alternative medical approaches can be transformative. 

Who Will Love the Book

You will love this book if you are an aspiring entrepreneur who wants to do good in the world. You will also love this book if you want to feel as good as you possibly can and reduce your waste and negative impact on the planet, You will learn how to navigate your conventional grocery store, pharmacy, or online marketplace with greater ease. Get Crunchy speaks to the everyday aspiring “ecopreneur,“ consumer, environmentalist, or health-seeker who is looking to do better. 

The Book

The book is comprised of three parts:

Part 1 contains the Introduction + Chapters 1 and 2. This section introduces readers to the chemical-laden products universal on store shelves, the dangers of these chemicals, and how the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) isn’t protecting us as much as we like to think. I feature the non-profit, Environmental Working Group (EWG), and other non-profits, and discuss how these organizations are the true superheroes of conscious consumerism. 

Part 2 contains Chapters 3 through 13. This section features exclusive interviews with founders and CEOs of sustainability-oriented and health-focused companies that I have admired for years. These companies adhere to the triple-bottom line, meaning that instead of just focusing on profits, they take into account the environmental and ethical implications of what they produce.  

Part 3 contains Chapters 14 through 16. This section showcases social media influencers from the health and zero-waste spaces who share their stories and tips to help you transition to conscious consumerism. 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published by New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go toward the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise, copyedit, and publish my manuscript in December, 2019;

  • The cover design of my book (you only see a mock-up here); 

  • The layout design for the interior of my book;

  • The launch and promotion efforts for my book prior to publication.

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards, depending on which tier you choose:

  • A signed copy of my book when I publish; 

  • A personal, handwritten thank-you note for pre-ordering my book;

  • Your name in a special acknowledgements section of my book (“with special thanks to”);

  • Early access to the introduction of my book and my entire manuscript with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback;

  • The opportunity to help me select my cover;

  • A book workshop, where I share how to implement the ideas put forth in this book.

About the Author

Aviva is a recent graduate of The University of Washington, where she majored in English with an emphasis in creative writing. In her free time, she writes screenplays, makes YouTube videos, and contemplates why dogs in sweaters are not more ubiquitous. 

Aviva wrote this book because writing and publishing a book was always something she wanted to do. Aviva’s childhood wardrobe consisted of a lot of tie-dye, and she sweetened her tea with stevia before it was mainstream. You could say Aviva was always destined for hippie greatness. When she got ill in the summer of 2010 with chronic Lyme disease, Aviva had to revamp her life and realized she wasn’t living as sustainably and healthfully as she had always thought. While transitioning to a “low-tox life” (i.e., avoiding chemicals and using natural products instead), Aviva realized that the average consumer knows little. As she continued on her health and sustainability journey, Aviva discovered brands that she came to admire — these brands are profit-driven but also take health, the environment, and ethics into consideration. 

Contact Information

For more information you can connect with Aviva via email. You can also connect with her on LinkedIn, Instagram, YouTube, and Twitter. 

Shipping

Shipping is included if you live in the United States. Unfortunately, if you live outside of the U.S., shipping costs extra. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean that they can't help: 

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. 

  • You can share my pre-sale campaign page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

  • Please share my book with five friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. 

Thank you so much for all of your love and support! I am so grateful. If you have any questions, please reach out. 

Thanks again,
Aviva

story:
Short Summary

My name is Klaudia Klimek and I am fouder of few foundations and projects dedicated to Jewish life in Krakow or Poland. One of the foundation that I have established is Jewrnalism foundation because I believe that  media- doesn't matter which one: Radio, TV, Blog, web site are the most important tool for opinion making. Thats why we Jews should use it and as well create a change thru word, video, image.


My campaigne is dedicated for young Jewish journalists in Poland that want to make a change in their commuities by describing current reality, asking questions, bringing to light opinions of community members and create a space of discussion and opinion of young future leaders.

That why me, my foundation and organizations that I work in try to join forces and continue in 2016 mission that we have started in 2015. In 2015 we have made 36 meetings between young people and journalists that write for jewrnalism.com or weshalom.pl and we have created around 200 articles. In this year we want to continue with our dicussion meetings and as well with developing weshalom.pl web site.  


What We Need & What You Get

We need funds for conducting our meetings and for publishing articles on our web site.

Each month we do 2 meetings, sometimes more if we decide to be toghether during clebrating Jewish holidays. Each meeting is dedicated to different topic and a guest from outside is invited. Our guests are prominent people from world of education, culture or politics. It give us certain thoughts and perpectives that later we can agree wih or not.

Each meeting is in different venue. We rent for our meetings short term flats as well we do not try to create another organization. We want those meetings to be based on friendship between us and intelectual conversations not place, organization or leader.


Each meeting cost us 250 $ so 24 meetings will cost 6000$. We spend mostly on apartment, food and salary for a guest.

Beside that we have costs of publishing articles 1000$


The Impact

We know that our project is valuable because we made it pilot in 2015 and we know that not only we as a members of are satisfied from meetings but as well we know what is the perception on artcles we writ

e. We alredy have made few changes in our community only by word we published and discussion that we have created.

So even if on our meetings come between 15-20 people our message goes much wider that this audience.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribiute to our project by sending us money you can offer to be our guest or you can offer us place where we can do our meetings.

story:
Thank you all for backing me!

The book will be launched on October 14, 6pm at the ROM (Royal Ontario Museum) in Toronto. There will be a free 1-hour lecture. Everyone is welcome.
 
If you ordered a copy, it will be send to you during the second half of October.
I hope you will enjoy reading it.
 

My Campaign

Welcome to my campaign. My name is Koen Vanderstukken.  I've been an artist and educator for approximately 30 years. I'm thrilled to introduce to you my book GLASS Virtual, Real, a labour of love for the past 8 years. Please have a closer look and if you like what you see, I hope to count on your support.

Experience glass in a whole new light.

             Be tantalised by thought-provoking ideas.

                          Understand glass' unique position within contemporary art.

                                        High quality hard cover book.

                                                     288 pages with 250 beautiful images.

                                                                  A must-have resource for your library.

 

 

 

 

Pre-order your copy now!

Only available at a discounted price for a limited time!

 

 

 

What the book is about.

During the past 8 years, I have conducted intense research to acquire more insight into how people perceive glass and how it has been and is used within the arts. The result of my research is this book entitled, GLASS Virtual, Real, which is set to be released in autumn 2016. This book is not another traditional historical or technical publication on glass, but a quest into the relationship between the use of glass within the arts and the intrinsic qualities of the medium. Although I do refer to the history and science of glass, I only do so in function of its relevance to the use of glass in contemporary art. What makes this publication unique is that the whole thesis builds up towards an insightful vision on how glass can be relevant within a contemporary art context.

Ultimately, the entire book aims to explain the recent increase in use of glass within contemporary art and to investigate the effectiveness of glass as a relatively new medium. The last and largest chapter is completely devoted to this and gives a plethora of examples of work from leading contemporary artists such as Gerhard Richter, Josiah Mcelheny, Jaume Plensa, Fred Wilson, Jan Fabre, Wim Delvoye, Joseph Kosuth, Dani Karavan, Ann Veronica Janssens, Donald Lipski, Gabriel Barcia-Colombo, Javier Perez, Larry Bell, Koen Vanmechelen, Maya Lin, Mona Hatoum, Dan Graham, Mario Merz, Robert Smithson, Michelangelo Pistoletto, Luciano Fabro and many more.

For the table of contents scroll to the bottom of this page.

 

Receive the best deal and directly support the publication of this unique book.

 

Why this campaign?

London-based Black Dog Publishing is generously supporting my book. They are a renowned publishing company specialising in art-books. But high quality books like this one are very expensive to produce. Therefore, we are sharing the production costs which means that I have to raise £20,000 GBP. And this is where I need your help.
I have been an artist and educator for about 30 years, during which time I observed that the community frequently asked itself how glass fits within contemporary art. In response to this observation, I set out to explore this question 8 years ago. Since then, I have dedicated an enormous amount of time, energy and personal funds into researching this question.
It's been a long, intriguing but onerous journey and I have learned a great deal from it. But now that I'm so close to sharing my findings with the world, I realise that I can no longer finish this by myself. The research has drained my financial resources and I cannot afford to bear the full load of the publication costs. As well, I have unsuccessfully exhausted all government agency funding because their mandate does not support this kind of international publication.

So please forward this campaign to everyone you know to help spread the word. 

Reaching a large audience is a vital step to a successful campaign. It won't cost you anything and will only take a few minutes but it will help me a lot to raise funds.

Your action will make all the difference.

 

Of course, a financial contribution to my campaign is the ultimate support!

Check out the perks. I hope you'll find something you like. If you have alternative suggestions as to how you want to support my campaign, feel free to contact me directly. I'm always open to new ideas.
 

Thank You

For helping me

to complete

this 8-year chapter of my life.

 

 

 

 

GLASS Virtual, Real

 

Table of Contents
Foreword and Acknowledgements Introduction
1  Glass in the twentieth century: an overview
  Glass at the beginning of modernism
  The origins and significance of the Studio Glass Movement
  Glass outside the Studio Glass Movement
2  Glass during modernism and postmodernism
  Modernism and postmodernism
  The complexity of glass
  Glass and modernism
  Henri Matisse and the Chapelle du Rosaire 
  Marcel Duchamp and The Bride Stripped Bare by Her Bachelors, Even
  Glass and postmodernism
  Modernism and postmodernism reconsidered
  Glass: a true postmodern medium
3  A history of myths, craft and the art of painting
  The origin of glass: the beginning of a myth
  Earliest history: from myth to magic
  Roman glass:from magic to function
  The Renaissance: more function and decoration
  Stained glass: a different story
  Glass, science and philosophy
  Glass and the art of painting
  Gerhard Richter: a link between past and present
4  A scientific approach to glass
  The definition of glass
  The structure of glass
  The complexity of glass
  States of matter
  Is glass a liquid or a solid?
  The fourth state of matter?
5  Glass in a contemporary context
  A material immateriality
  The interface between reality and virtuality
  The real in-between and the glass/virtuality symbiosis
  A new look at contemporary glass
  Visual virtuality
  Emotional virtuality
  Rational virtuality
  Historical virtuality
  Virtuality
6  Epilogue
Bibliography


 

 

 

Latest Updates

June 5:

The Dutch association 'Vereniging van Vrienden van Modern Glas' made a generous contribution. Thank you for your fabulous support. As a result, I will be giving a lecture at DordtYart in Dordrecht on July 7, followed by a lecture of Koen Vanmechelen. Both lectures will be in the Dutch language.

May 30:

Today we went into InDemand. This means that you can still preorder the book at a discounted price but most other perks are no longer available. If you have any questions about the book or campaign, feel free to contact me.

May 26:

So with 3 more days to go, we made the goal!

Thank you all for your generous support!

May 3:

Yesterday, I received a generous donation from Glazenhuis in Lommel. Thank you for your fantastic support!

April 25:

Fantastic news! We have reached the halfway point! A big thank you to all of you who supported me thus far.

And there's more good news: the ROM (Royal Ontario Museum) in Toronto has confirmed a lecture and book launch. It will take place on October 14. Other speaking engagements will follow.

April 6:

Andrew Page, editor of GLASS Quarterly in Brooklyn, posted an article and interview about this campaign on the UrbanGlass website. You can read it here:

https://www.urbanglass.org/glass/detail/rethinking-the-littleton-myth-koen-vanderstukken-explores-alternate-histori
story_txt:
Thank you all for backing me!
The book will be launched on October 14, 6pm at the ROM (Royal Ontario Museum) in Toronto. There will be a free 1-hour lecture. Everyone is welcome.
 
If you ordered a copy, it will be send to you during the second half of October.
I hope you will enjoy reading it.
 
My Campaign

Welcome to my campaign. My name is Koen Vanderstukken.  I've been an artist and educator for approximately 30 years. I'm thrilled to introduce to you my book GLASS Virtual, Real, a labour of love for the past 8 years. Please have a closer look and if you like what you see, I hope to count on your support.

Experience glass in a whole new light.
             Be tantalised by thought-provoking ideas.
                          Understand glass' unique position within contemporary art.
                                        High quality hard cover book.
                                                     288 pages with 250 beautiful images.
                                                                  A must-have resource for your library.
 
 
 
 

Pre-order your copy now!


Only available at a discounted price for a limited time!

 
 
 
What the book is about.

During the past 8 years, I have conducted intense research to acquire more insight into how people perceive glass and how it has been and is used within the arts. The result of my research is this book entitled, GLASS Virtual, Real, which is set to be released in autumn 2016. This book is not another traditional historical or technical publication on glass, but a quest into the relationship between the use of glass within the arts and the intrinsic qualities of the medium. Although I do refer to the history and science of glass, I only do so in function of its relevance to the use of glass in contemporary art. What makes this publication unique is that the whole thesis builds up towards an insightful vision on how glass can be relevant within a contemporary art context.
Ultimately, the entire book aims to explain the recent increase in use of glass within contemporary art and to investigate the effectiveness of glass as a relatively new medium. The last and largest chapter is completely devoted to this and gives a plethora of examples of work from leading contemporary artists such as Gerhard Richter, Josiah Mcelheny, Jaume Plensa, Fred Wilson, Jan Fabre, Wim Delvoye, Joseph Kosuth, Dani Karavan, Ann Veronica Janssens, Donald Lipski, Gabriel Barcia-Colombo, Javier Perez, Larry Bell, Koen Vanmechelen, Maya Lin, Mona Hatoum, Dan Graham, Mario Merz, Robert Smithson, Michelangelo Pistoletto, Luciano Fabro and many more.
For the table of contents scroll to the bottom of this page.


 
Receive the best deal and directly support the publication of this unique book.

 

Why this campaign?
London-based Black Dog Publishing is generously supporting my book. They are a renowned publishing company specialising in art-books. But high quality books like this one are very expensive to produce. Therefore, we are sharing the production costs which means that I have to raise £20,000 GBP. And this is where I need your help.
I have been an artist and educator for about 30 years, during which time I observed that the community frequently asked itself how glass fits within contemporary art. In response to this observation, I set out to explore this question 8 years ago. Since then, I have dedicated an enormous amount of time, energy and personal funds into researching this question.

It's been a long, intriguing but onerous journey and I have learned a great deal from it. But now that I'm so close to sharing my findings with the world, I realise that I can no longer finish this by myself. The research has drained my financial resources and I cannot afford to bear the full load of the publication costs. As well, I have unsuccessfully exhausted all government agency funding because their mandate does not support this kind of international publication.

So please forward this campaign to everyone you know to help spread the word. 
Reaching a large audience is a vital step to a successful campaign. It won't cost you anything and will only take a few minutes but it will help me a lot to raise funds.
Your action will make all the difference.
 
Of course, a financial contribution to my campaign is the ultimate support!

Check out the perks. I hope you'll find something you like. If you have alternative suggestions as to how you want to support my campaign, feel free to contact me directly. I'm always open to new ideas.
 
Thank You
For helping me
to complete
this 8-year chapter of my life.
 
   GLASS Virtual, Real Table of ContentsForeword and Acknowledgements Introduction1  Glass in the twentieth century: an overview  Glass at the beginning of modernism  The origins and significance of the Studio Glass Movement  Glass outside the Studio Glass Movement2  Glass during modernism and postmodernism  Modernism and postmodernism  The complexity of glass  Glass and modernism  Henri Matisse and the Chapelle du Rosaire   Marcel Duchamp and The Bride Stripped Bare by Her Bachelors, Even  Glass and postmodernism  Modernism and postmodernism reconsidered  Glass: a true postmodern medium3  A history of myths, craft and the art of painting  The origin of glass: the beginning of a myth  Earliest history: from myth to magic  Roman glass:from magic to function  The Renaissance: more function and decoration  Stained glass: a different story  Glass, science and philosophy  Glass and the art of painting  Gerhard Richter: a link between past and present4  A scientific approach to glass  The definition of glass  The structure of glass  The complexity of glass  States of matter  Is glass a liquid or a solid?  The fourth state of matter?5  Glass in a contemporary context  A material immateriality  The interface between reality and virtuality  The real in-between and the glass/virtuality symbiosis  A new look at contemporary glass  Visual virtuality  Emotional virtuality  Rational virtuality  Historical virtuality  Virtuality6  EpilogueBibliography   Latest UpdatesJune 5:The Dutch association 'Vereniging van Vrienden van Modern Glas' made a generous contribution.
